translated: Thus, one infers that the immediately antecedent condition is similar to the effect, from which the effect is seen to arise in a similar way from a cause.

original: bar du chod pa brgyud pa dang ldan pa dag kyang rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bar du chod pa brgyud pa dang ldan pa dag kyang rjes su dpog pa ni ma yin pa des na 'khrul pa med do zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'o //
translated: The conclusion is that there is no error in the inference, because there is no inference of a series that is interrupted.

original: 'di snyam du rgyu tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dag kyang res 'ga' rnam par mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rgyu tha dad pa'i 'bras bu dag kyang res 'ga' rnam par mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: One might think that effects that are different from their causes are sometimes similar in appearance,

original: dper na nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na nags dang cig shos kyi rgyal mo ga gon la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: for example, the plantain tree and the bamboo, etc.

original: des na de ma thag pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa la 'khrul pa med do zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na de ma thag pa'i rgyu rjes su dpog pa la 'khrul pa med do zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Thus, how can it be said that there is no error in the inference of the immediately antecedent condition?

original: bshad pa / rnam pa tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ni dngos po de'i de nyid ma yin pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin na /
analyzed: bshad pa / rnam pa tha dad pa 'ba' zhig ni dngos po de'i de nyid ma yin pa dang tha dad pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ma yin na /
translated: Mere difference in aspect is neither the reality of that thing nor the reason for its difference.

original: gang gis rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis rnam pa tha dad pa med pa'i phyir tha dad pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: By what means would it not be different because of the absence of difference in aspect?

original: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang rang bzhin gzhan yang yin te ;
translated: However, it is also a different nature.

original: rnam pa tha dad pas kyang tha dad par rnam par 'jog la /
analyzed: rnam pa tha dad pas kyang tha dad par rnam par 'jog la /
translated: It is also established as different by means of different aspects.

original: rang bzhin gzhan gyis kyang yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan gyis kyang yin no //
translated: It is also different by means of a different nature.

original: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i nor bu la sogs pa ni rnam pa mtshungs pa yin yang ljid dang mthu'i khyad par gyis tha dad par rnam par gzhag nus pa yin no //
analyzed: bcos ma dang bcos ma ma yin pa'i nor bu la sogs pa ni rnam pa mtshungs pa yin yang ljid dang mthu'i khyad par gyis tha dad par rnam par gzhag nus pa yin no //
translated: Even though the aspects are similar, a fabricated and an unfabricated jewel, etc. can be established as different by means of the difference in their weight and power.

original: rang bzhin gzhan de nyid rnam par mtshungs kyang tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan de nyid rnam par mtshungs kyang tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du rnam pa du ma'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even though that very different nature is similar in aspect, it is taught in many ways as the reason for difference.

original: kha cig tu ni me tog tha dad pas te zhes smos so //
analyzed: kha cig tu ni me tog tha dad pas te zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIn some cases, by means of different flowers.‚Äù

original: me tog gi rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: me tog gi rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad pa ste /
translated: The difference is due to the flower.

original: gal te de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa ma yin na me tog kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag rang bzhin tha dad pa ma yin na me tog kyang tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If they are not different in nature, the flower would not be different.

original: yang na me tog yod na @263b tha dad par mtshon pa 'am /
analyzed: yang na me tog yod na @263b tha dad par mtshon pa 'am /
translated: Or, if the flower exists, the difference is indicated,

original: me tog de la tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: me tog de la tha dad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: or the difference is understood in that flower.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag yang sbyor ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag yang sbyor ro //
translated: The same is to be applied to the others.

original: mthu ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa'o //
analyzed: mthu ni 'bras bu skyed pa'i nus pa'o //
translated: Potency is the ability to produce an effect.

original: me tog la sogs pa ni rdzas kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa ni rdzas kyi nang du 'dus pa nyid yin la /
translated: The flower, etc. are included within the substance itself,

original: nus pa yang tha dad pa'i yul can yin no //
analyzed: nus pa yang tha dad pa'i yul can yin no //
translated: and the potency has a different object.

original: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par bye ba'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa dang 'brel pas shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid kyis rjes su dpag par nus pa'i phyir rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shin tu rnam par bye ba'i 'bras bu ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu la sogs pa dang 'brel pas shin tu rnam par phye ba'i 'bras bu gang yin pa de nyid kyis rjes su dpag par nus pa'i phyir rgyu la 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Therefore, the effect that is very distinct is the one that is very distinct due to its connection with the effect, etc. Because it can be inferred by that very thing, there is no error in the cause.

original: bshad zin pa'i don nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad zin pa'i don nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the very meaning that has been explained, he says:

original: bshad pa / rgyu khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par med na skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyu khyad par yod kyang 'bras bu khyad par med na skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: If the effect is not different, although the cause is different, there would be a fault.

original: rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu med pa nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would follow that it would be causeless.üîΩThis very point is summarized:

original: don 'di nyid du sdud pa ni gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de las rang bzhin gang zhig rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin de'i rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ni de yin pas /
analyzed: don 'di nyid du sdud pa ni gang gi phyir rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa de las rang bzhin gang zhig rgyur gyur pa'i rang bzhin de'i rjes su 'gro bar mthong ba'i rjes su 'gro bar byed pa de'i rang bzhin gyi rgyu ni de yin pas /
translated: Because of the forward and reverse pervasion, whatever nature is the cause, that nature is seen to be the forward pervasion. That which is the forward pervasion is the cause of that nature.

original: de rgyu can yin pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de rgyu can yin pa de'i phyir mi mthun pa las mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Because it has that cause, it does not arise from a dissimilar cause.

original: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bshad nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar 'bras bu dang rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained the effect and nature reasonings,

original: 'brel pa nges pa'i phyir de dag nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa de bshad pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par byed pa'am /
analyzed: 'brel pa nges pa'i phyir de dag nyid go bar byed pa yin no zhes gang bshad pa de bshad pa rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po nges par byed pa'am /
translated: it was explained that because their relationship is ascertained, they are the means of understanding.

original: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / de'i bdag nyid yin pa ni bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs su nges par yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang bzhin nges par byed pa las bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa dang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang / de'i bdag nyid yin pa ni bsgrub par bya bar gyur pa bsgrub pa la gtan tshigs su nges par yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In the ascertainment of the nature of something, the relation of cause and effect and the relation of identity are ascertained as the reason for the probandum.

original: de las bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nges par blta'i /
analyzed: de las bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nges par blta'i /
translated: Therefore, the non-occurrence of the probandum in the absence of that is seen as the definition of the reason.

original: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba dang mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba dang mthun pa'i phyogs la mthong ba las ni ma yin no //
translated: But not from the non-observation of the reason in the discordant side and the observation of it in the similar side.

original: gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang de'i bdag nyid med na gzhan dag dang lhan cig nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po dang de'i bdag nyid med na gzhan dag dang lhan cig nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the relation of cause and effect and the relation of identity did not exist, there would be no certainty of the existence of the reason in the similar instance.

original: gang zhig byas pa grub na ma grub pa'i rang bzhin de don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin par khas len na /
analyzed: gang zhig byas pa grub na ma grub pa'i rang bzhin de don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin par khas len na /
translated: If one accepts that the nature of something established by the effect is a property that has another as its cause,

original: nges par yod pa'i nges pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin te /
analyzed: nges par yod pa'i nges pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin te /
translated: what is called ‚Äúthe certainty of the existence of that‚Äù?

original: dper na gos la tshon nges par yod pa'i nges pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gos la tshon nges par yod pa'i nges pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the certainty that the color exists in the cloth.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chos don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin na /
translated: Moreover, if the nature of a thing is the sign of another thing,

original: nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /üîΩdon gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can @264a * //
analyzed: nges par yod pa'i nges pa med par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi / don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can @264a * //
translated: not only would there be no certainty of its existence,üîΩbut also the nature that is the sign of another thingüîΩwould itself be another thing.

original: gyi rang bzhin ni don gzhan yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gang gi phyir chos gang zhig don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par mthong ba de ni de las gzhan nyid yin no //
analyzed: gyi rang bzhin ni don gzhan yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni gang gi phyir chos gang zhig don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can yin par mthong ba de ni de las gzhan nyid yin no //
translated: This is explained as follows: Whatever thing is seen to be the sign of another thing is itself different from that.

original: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ba skad cig 'jig pa'i 'phro yin pas de nyid du bshad par bya ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi gnas skabs su 'gyur ba skad cig 'jig pa'i 'phro yin pas de nyid du bshad par bya ba ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: This is the continuation of the refutation of the argument for momentariness in the context of the argument by nature. Therefore, it should not be explained here.

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang gang zhig don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid kyis don gzhan du gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don grub pa na grub pa yin la /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang gang zhig don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can nyid kyis don gzhan du gyur pa de ni de'i rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don grub pa na grub pa yin la /
translated: True, but when it is established that something is different in meaning because it is the reason for another meaning, then it is established that it is a cause of difference.

original: rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs su bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i tha dad pa tha dad par byed pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yang 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs kyi skabs su bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: And the meaning of ‚Äúcause of difference‚Äù will be explained in the section on inference based on effect.

original: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa na lhag ma 'di bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs bshad pa na lhag ma 'di bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, when inference based on effect is explained, the remainder is explained.

original: rnam par 'brel pa bshad pa ni de grub na zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par 'brel pa bshad pa ni de grub na zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of the relation is ‚Äúwhen that is established.‚Äù

original: gang grub pa na gang ma grub pa de ni grub na ma grub pa 'am rgyu tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang grub pa na gang ma grub pa de ni grub na ma grub pa 'am rgyu tha dad pa yin te /
translated: When one is established, if the other is not established, then it is a cause of difference.

original: de ni sngar grub zin pa de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni sngar grub zin pa de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that what is already established is of the nature of that.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar yin zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po rnams kyi zhes smos te /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi zhes smos te /
translated: It is said ‚Äúof things.‚Äù

original: chos 'gal ba gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tha dad pa yin la /
analyzed: chos 'gal ba gnas pa gang yin pa de nyid ni tha dad pa yin la /
translated: That which is the abode of contradictory properties is precisely difference.

original: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni de'i yul can yin no //üîΩrgyu tha dad pa yang 'di kho na yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i tha snyad ni de'i yul can yin no // rgyu tha dad pa yang 'di kho na yin te /
translated: The convention of difference has that as its object.

original: skyed par byed pa tha dad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa tha dad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the only cause of difference, namely, the difference of the producer.

original: gang zhig 'jig rten na tha dad par grags pa de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gang zhig 'jig rten na tha dad par grags pa de nyid tha dad par brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it that which is known as different in the world that should be called different?

original: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa ni 'jig rten na grags pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa ni 'jig rten na grags pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The abode of contradictory properties is not known as different in the world.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'jig rten na tha dad par grags pa de gang yin gang la 'jig rten na tha dad par rtogs pa'o zhe na ;
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'jig rten na tha dad par grags pa de gang yin gang la 'jig rten na tha dad par rtogs pa'o zhe na ;
translated: If that is so, then what is known as different in the world? What is it that is known as different in the world?

original: 'jig rten na grags pa'i tha dad pa 'dri ba na 'jig rten pa'i rtogs ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten na grags pa'i tha dad pa 'dri ba na 'jig rten pa'i rtogs ba'o //
translated: When difference known in the world is asked about, it is the understanding of the world.

original: rtogs pa 'di'i yul gang yin zhes bya ba'i don 'di khyod la dris pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rtogs pa 'di'i yul gang yin zhes bya ba'i don 'di khyod la dris pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt this the meaning of the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the object of that understanding?‚Äù

original: des na gang la 'jig rten rtogs pa'o zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
analyzed: des na gang la 'jig rten rtogs pa'o zhes ci'i phyir brjod /
translated: Therefore, why is it said, ‚ÄúThat which is known as different in the world‚Äù?

original: chos tha dad pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni med pas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni de yin no //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa las gzhan pa'i rgyu ni med pas 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu ni de yin no //
translated: Since there is no cause other than the distinct phenomena, that is the cause of worldly conventions.

original: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pas so //
analyzed: des kyang zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i chos gnas pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the abiding of contradictory phenomena.

original: rgyu tha dad pa ni sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir 'dir mi bsgrub kyi 'di ni 'gal ba'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pa ni sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir 'dir mi bsgrub kyi 'di ni 'gal ba'i chos bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yin no //
translated: Since the distinct cause has already been established earlier, it is not established here. This is for the sake of establishing contradictory phenomena.

original: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan med pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no other reason for distinction,

original: ril gcig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ril gcig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: everything becomes one.

original: gal te ril gcig tu gyur mong des ci @264b 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ril gcig tu gyur mong des ci @264b 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If everything becomes one, what is the problem with that?

original: bshad pa / gcig yin pa des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gcig yin pa des na lhan cig skye ba dang 'jig pa der 'gyur ro //
translated: It is said: By that oneness, arising and ceasing together would follow.

original: rim gyis skye ba dang 'jig pa yin na ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba dang 'jig pa yin na ni skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang zhig pa dang ma zhig pa gang yin pa de dag gcig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If arising and ceasing were gradual, then what has arisen and what has not arisen, what has ceased and what has not ceased would not be one.

original: des na rim pa dang mi ldan pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rim pa dang mi ldan pa'i skye ba dang 'jig pa dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, arising and ceasing would not be simultaneous.

original: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod pa de la rim gyis skye ba dang 'jig pas na skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam gang zhig tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan can du khas mi len pa de grub pa dang ma grub pa'i rgyu mtshan dang zhig pa dang ma
analyzed: gang zhig 'gal ba'i chos gnas pa tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan du mi 'dod pa de la rim gyis skye ba dang 'jig pas na skyes pa dang ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa dang ma zhig pa dag tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ba mi rigs pa ma yin nam gang zhig tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos kyi rgyu mtshan can du khas mi len pa de grub pa dang ma grub pa'i rgyu mtshan dang zhig pa dang ma
translated: But if you do not assert that the reason for their difference is that they are phenomena that are contradictory, then it is illogical to say that because they arise and disintegrate sequentially, the arisen and the unarisen, and the disintegrated and the nondisintegrated are different.

original: zhig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis du ma nyid du khas len pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: zhig pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis du ma nyid du khas len pa ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if you do not accept that they are different and that they are the reason for being contradictory phenomena, then how could you accept that they are many due to the reason of being established and not being established, and the reason of being disintegrated and not being disintegrated?

original: bden mod kyi gang gis gang zhig yod par 'dod pa des ni de'i rang bzhin btang ba dang bral bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi gang gis gang zhig yod par 'dod pa des ni de'i rang bzhin btang ba dang bral bar khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: This is true, but whoever asserts that something exists must accept that it is not free from relinquishing its nature.

original: gang gi tshe yod pa de nyid kyi tshe de de'i rang bzhin las nyams pa yin no zhes ni shes par nus pa ma yin no ;
analyzed: gang gi tshe yod pa de nyid kyi tshe de de'i rang bzhin las nyams pa yin no zhes ni shes par nus pa ma yin no ;
translated: When it exists, it is not possible to know that it is degenerating from its nature.

original: / thams cad du de'i rang bzhin nyams pa yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: / thams cad du de'i rang bzhin nyams pa yongs su spangs nas gnas pa yin no //
translated: and in all cases, having completely abandoned the loss of its nature, it remains.

original: 'o na de dag gi tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can du ji ltar khas blangs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de dag gi tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can du ji ltar khas blangs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how is it that they are not accepted as having a reason that is a contradictory property that is different?

original: smras pa / yod pa thams cad ni yod pa dang med pa las gzhan pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa ma yin gyi yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa kho na'o //üîΩde la dngos po gang zhig skyes pa dang ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni nyams pa dang bral ba de'i rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin la /
analyzed: smras pa / yod pa thams cad ni yod pa dang med pa las gzhan pa'i 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa ma yin gyi yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa kho na'o // de la dngos po gang zhig skyes pa dang ma zhig pa gang yin pa de ni nyams pa dang bral ba de'i rang gi ngo bor yod pa yin la /
translated: We say: All existents are not accepted as different by means of a reason that is a contradictory property that is different from existence and nonexistence, but they are accepted as different by means of the reason of existence and nonexistence.üîΩIn that regard, any entity that has arisen and not yet ceased exists as having its own nature free from loss.

original: gang zhig ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pas de las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig ma skyes pa dang / zhig pa gang yin pa de ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pas de las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: And that which has not arisen and that which has ceased has a nature that is lost, and therefore is different from that.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can du khas blangs kyang yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can du ni tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ba yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i rgyu mtshan can du khas blangs kyang yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan can du ni tha dad pa khas blang bar bya ba yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, even though one accepts that the reason is a property of the dissimilar instances, one must accept that the reason is a property of the dissimilar instances only when it is a property of the non-existent.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa rim pa dang ldan pa yin na tha dad pa nyid du thal ba de'i phyir /
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa rim pa dang ldan pa yin na tha dad pa nyid du thal ba de'i phyir /
translated: If arising and ceasing were sequential, then it would follow that they are different.

original: gcig pa thams cad cig car skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pa thams cad cig car skye ba dang 'jig pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, all that is unitary would have to arise and cease simultaneously.

original: thams cad thams cad la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad thams cad la zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll of everything‚Äù indicates that this is what is being said.

original: dngos po'i yod pa nyid ni don bya ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i yod pa nyid ni don bya ba med pa'i rgyu mtshan can yin no //
translated: The existence of a thing is the reason for the non-existence of an object.

original: gal te yod pa thams cad gcig nyid yin na ni /üîΩde'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa la yang snam bu'i rang bzhin yod pa de'i @265a * //
analyzed: gal te yod pa thams cad gcig nyid yin na ni / de'i tshe bum pa la sogs pa la yang snam bu'i rang bzhin yod pa de'i @265a * //
translated: If all that exists is unitary,üîΩthen at that time, even such things as a pot would have the nature of a woolen cloth.

original: phyir bum pa la sogs pas kyang snam bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba bya dgos te /
analyzed: phyir bum pa la sogs pas kyang snam bus bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba bya dgos te /
translated: Therefore, even such things as a pot would have to perform the function to be accomplished by a woolen cloth.

original: gal te thams cad la thams cad yod na de lta na gcig nyid do //
analyzed: gal te thams cad la thams cad yod na de lta na gcig nyid do //
translated: If everything were in everything, then everything would be one.

original: don bya ba byed pa de las ldog na ni dngos po nyid kyang ldog par byed do //
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa de las ldog na ni dngos po nyid kyang ldog par byed do //
translated: If the performance of a function were to cease, then the thing itself would cease.

original: gang zhig gang la med pa de ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zhig gang la med pa de ni de'i rang bzhin nyams pa dang ldan pa nyid kyis gzhan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which does not exist in something is different from it, because it would lack the nature of that.

original: de la yang yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba'i rgyu mtshan can tha dad par thal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de la yang yod pa dang med pa 'gal ba'i rgyu mtshan can tha dad par thal ba kho na'o //
translated: And in that case, the consequence of difference would follow, because existence and nonexistence are contradictory reasons.

original: des na ril gcig nyid yin na cig car skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang / thams cad don bya ba thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar thal ba kho na'o ;
analyzed: des na ril gcig nyid yin na cig car skye ba dang 'jig pa dag dang / thams cad don bya ba thams cad la nye bar sbyor bar thal ba kho na'o ;
translated: Therefore, if everything were one, the consequence would be that everything would be produced and would perish simultaneously, and that everything would be applied to the performance of every function.

original: / de lta ma yin te skye ba dang 'jig pa rim pa dang ldan pa dang / thams cad thams cad la nye bar mi sbyor na de'i rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa dag gi mtha' dag tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ba gcig nyid dang ldan pa dngos po'i gnas lugs kyis gcig gi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'am ;
analyzed: / de lta ma yin te skye ba dang 'jig pa rim pa dang ldan pa dang / thams cad thams cad la nye bar mi sbyor na de'i rang bzhin yod pa dang med pa dag gi mtha' dag tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir gcig ces bya ba gcig nyid dang ldan pa dngos po'i gnas lugs kyis gcig gi rang bzhin du mi 'gyur ba'am ;
translated: If it were not so, if arising and ceasing were not connected in sequence, and if everything were not connected to everything else, then the extremes of existence and non-existence would be different, and therefore, since they would have the nature of being one, they would not be the nature of one thing.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir gcig ces ming tha dad par zad do //
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis tha dad par khas blangs pa'i phyir gcig ces ming tha dad par zad do //
translated: Or, since existence and non-existence are accepted as different on the basis of their respective reasons, they would be merely different names.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: du ma nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don khas blangs nas de skad du zhes bya ba gcig gi sgras brjod pa'o //
analyzed: du ma nyid kyi sgras brjod par bya ba'i don khas blangs nas de skad du zhes bya ba gcig gi sgras brjod pa'o //
translated: Having accepted the meaning expressed by the word ‚Äúmany,‚Äù it is expressed by the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: des na gcig yin na cig car yod pa dang med pa la mi 'khrul ba'i chos su mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na gcig yin na cig car yod pa dang med pa la mi 'khrul ba'i chos su mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if it were one, it would not be a phenomenon that is simultaneously existent and non-existent,

original: de dag gcig la cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gcig la cig car 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because those two are mutually exclusive with respect to one thing.

original: rim gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yin na ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul ba yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis skye ba dang 'gag pa dag yin na ni dngos po dang dngos po med pa la mi 'khrul ba yin no //
translated: If they arise and cease gradually, then they are not confused with respect to things and non-things.

original: don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba yang nges pa'i yul can ma yin te /
analyzed: don byed pa la nye bar sbyor ba yang nges pa'i yul can ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the application to the performance of function of a determinate object.

original: des na ril rdzas gcig nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ril rdzas gcig nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the whole is not a single substance.

original: gal te 'gal ba'i chos brten pa las du ma nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'gal ba'i chos brten pa las du ma nyid yin na /
translated: If it is a plurality because it supports contradictory properties,

original: rgyu don tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: rgyu don tha dad pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: it is not only the case that the causes have different meanings,

original: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang ste /
analyzed: rgyu don tha dad pa nyid med kyang ste /
translated: but even if the causes do not have different meanings,

original: don gyi dngos po yod pa'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gyi dngos po yod pa'i dus na mi rtag pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because impermanence is not established when the entity of the object exists.

original: mi rtag pa nyid ni ldog pa'i rang bzhin dngos po dang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ni ldog pa'i rang bzhin dngos po dang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: Impermanence is the opposite nature that is incompatible with an entity.

original: gal te skad cig dong po la yod na ni dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te skad cig dong po la yod na ni dngos po nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it exists in the first moment, it is not an entity,

original: skad cig gnyis ba bzhin no //
analyzed: skad cig gnyis ba bzhin no //
translated: like the second moment.

original: 'dis ni dngos po dang mi rtag pa 'gal ba'i chos brten par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dngos po dang mi rtag pa 'gal ba'i chos brten par brjod pa yin no //
translated: This states that an entity and impermanence are contradictory properties that are supported.

original: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don gzhan rgyu yin ba nyid la grub pa dang ma grub pa dag gis du ma yin ba de bzhin @265b du ;
analyzed: mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni ji ltar don gzhan rgyu yin ba nyid la grub pa dang ma grub pa dag gis du ma yin ba de bzhin @265b du ;
translated: ‚ÄúThe same‚Äù means that just as a different object is not multiple because of being established or not established as a cause,

original: rgyu don gzhan med pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu don gzhan med pa la yang yin no //
translated: so too, it is not a cause in the absence of a different object.

original: 'di spang ba'i phyir gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di spang ba'i phyir gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do zhes smos so //
translated: In order to eliminate this, he says, ‚ÄúThere is no other at all.‚Äù

original: sngon med pa'i rang bzhin thob pa ni grub par brjod do //
analyzed: sngon med pa'i rang bzhin thob pa ni grub par brjod do //
translated: The attainment of a nature that did not exist previously is called ‚Äúestablishment.‚Äù

original: gal te mi rtag pa dngos po yin par gyur na ni de sngar ma grub pa phyis grub pas 'gal ba'i chos brten par 'gyur ba yin na gang gi phyir gang zhig phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi dngos po ni 'ga' yang yod pa
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa dngos po yin par gyur na ni de sngar ma grub pa phyis grub pas 'gal ba'i chos brten par 'gyur ba yin na gang gi phyir gang zhig phyis 'grub par 'gyur ba mi rtag pa nyid kyi dngos po ni 'ga' yang yod pa
translated: If impermanence were an existent thing, then it would be established after not having been established previously, and so it would be the basis of contradictory properties. But because impermanence is not an existent thing,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not established later.

original: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan grub pa nyid med pas 'gal ba'i chos brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu mtshan grub pa nyid med pas 'gal ba'i chos brten pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the reason for establishment does not exist, the basis of contradictory properties does not exist.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med na 'o na gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya dag ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med na 'o na gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya dag ji ltar de'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid kyis 'brel zhe na /
translated: If impermanence is a non-entity, then how can the reason and the probandum be related as the same nature?

original: dngos po zhes smos so //
analyzed: dngos po zhes smos so //
translated: He says ‚Äúentity.‚Äù

original: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can zhes bya ni ldog pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid ni mi rtag par brjod do //
analyzed: skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos can zhes bya ni ldog pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin nyid ni mi rtag par brjod do //
translated: The property of the subject, ‚Äúthat which endures for an instant,‚Äù is the nature of the property of the counter-pervasion, which is called ‚Äúimpermanent.‚Äù

original: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya tha mi dad par gyur pa na de'i bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin pa des na gtan tshigs dang bsgrub bya tha mi dad par gyur pa na de'i bdag nyid kyi 'grel pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since that is the probandum, when the reason and the probandum are not different, the relation is the same nature. That is what is explained.

original: des na dngos po ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dngos po ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the entity is the counter-pervasion.

original: mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ngag dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin nam 'bras bu gang zhig grub par brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mi rtag par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i ngag dag gis dngos po'i rang bzhin nam 'bras bu gang zhig grub par brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that such statements as ‚Äúit becomes impermanent‚Äù express the nature or effect of an entity.

original: 'on kyang mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyi don gang yin pa de med do zhes bya ba'i don 'di brjod pa yin no //
translated: But the meaning of ‚Äúnon-existence‚Äù is that the object which is the nature of the seen does not exist.

original: dngos po gzhan brjod pa yin na dngos po snga ma ldog pa ma bstan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan brjod pa yin na dngos po snga ma ldog pa ma bstan par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were to express another entity, then it would follow that the negation of the prior entity would not be indicated.

original: de ni mang du bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ni mang du bshad zin to //
translated: This has been explained many times.

original: mang du cha lhag pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mang du cha lhag pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the remainder of the many.

original: skad cig tu gnas pa'i chos can zhes bya bder ro //
analyzed: skad cig tu gnas pa'i chos can zhes bya bder ro //
translated: The term ‚Äúhaving the nature of momentary duration‚Äù is used.

original: 'o na ji ltar bum pa mi rtag pa bum pa mi rtag pa zhes rjod par byed pa tha dad ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar bum pa mi rtag pa bum pa mi rtag pa zhes rjod par byed pa tha dad ce na /
translated: Well then, how is it that the impermanence of a pot is expressed as ‚Äúthe pot is impermanent‚Äù?

original: bshad pa / tshig ste brjod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba du ma nyid la yang ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / tshig ste brjod pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba du ma nyid la yang ste /
translated: It is said: ‚ÄúThe difference is in the words, i.e., in the expressions.‚Äù It is also in the multiplicity.

original: 'di'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad la yang ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i tha dad pa'i tha snyad la yang ngo //
translated: It is also in the conventional expressions of difference.

original: chos dang chos can nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid du ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is it that there is the nature of property and property possessor?

original: tha mi dad bar brjod pa ni chos can nyid du ste /
analyzed: tha mi dad bar brjod pa ni chos can nyid du ste /
translated: When it is expressed without difference, it is the nature of the property possessor.

original: sgra mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra mi rtag ces bya ba'o //
translated: For example, ‚Äúsound is impermanent.‚Äù

original: tha dad par brjod pa ni chos nyid du ste /
analyzed: tha dad par brjod pa ni chos nyid du ste /
translated: When it is expressed with difference, it is the nature of the property.

original: sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba'o //
translated: The expression ‚Äúsound is impermanent‚Äù is an example.

original: chos dang chos can gyi sgra gnyi gas rtag pa las ldog pa gcig nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi sgra gnyi gas rtag pa las ldog pa gcig nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Both the word ‚Äúproperty‚Äù and the word ‚Äúproperty-possessor‚Äù express the same exclusion from permanence.

original: tshig tha dad pa 'di la ni rgyu mtshan khyad par gzhan te /
analyzed: tshig tha dad pa 'di la ni rgyu mtshan khyad par gzhan te /
translated: The reason for the difference in the words is this:

original: ldog pa gzhan mi spong pa ste /üîΩde dang brjod par bya ba'i chos bdag nyid gcig tu @266a * //
analyzed: ldog pa gzhan mi spong pa ste / de dang brjod par bya ba'i chos bdag nyid gcig tu @266a * //
translated: The exclusion of another is not rejected.

original: 'brel par rung ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'brel par rung ba nyid do //
translated: The property and the property-possessor are suitable to be related as identical natures.

original: gang gi chos gzhan dag dang 'brel par rung ba brjod pa de'i tshe ni chos gzhan mi spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi chos gzhan dag dang 'brel par rung ba brjod pa de'i tshe ni chos gzhan mi spong ba yin te /
translated: When one expresses the suitability of a property to be related to another property, then the other property is not rejected.

original: dper na sgra mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sgra mi rtag pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the expression ‚Äúsound is impermanent,‚Äù

original: 'dir ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos sgra nyid la sogs pa sgra la brten pa'i chos de dag dang bdag nyid gcig tu 'brel par rung bar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni mi rtag pa zhes bya ba'i chos sgra nyid la sogs pa sgra la brten pa'i chos de dag dang bdag nyid gcig tu 'brel par rung bar brjod pa yin no //
translated: here the property called ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù is expressed as suitable to be related as identical with the property of sound and so on, which are properties based on sound.

original: gang gi tshe chos de nyid sgra nyid la sogs pa sgra la brten pa'i chos dag dang 'brel par mi rung ba de'i tshe chos gzhan spong ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos de nyid sgra nyid la sogs pa sgra la brten pa'i chos dag dang 'brel par mi rung ba de'i tshe chos gzhan spong ba yin te /
translated: When that property is not suitable to be related to sound itself and so on, which are properties based on sound, then it is a property of another.

original: dper na sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na sgra'i mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like the impermanence of sound.

original: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid la sgra la brten pa'i chos dag bdag nyid gcig tu 'brel par mi rung bar brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir mi rtag pa nyid la sgra la brten pa'i chos dag bdag nyid gcig tu 'brel par mi rung bar brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: Here it is said that impermanence is not suitable to be related to sound itself as one entity,

original: thams cad du 'gro ba la sogs pa bdag nyid la brten pa'i chos dag dang ni mi rtag pa nyid 'brel par rung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba la sogs pa bdag nyid la brten pa'i chos dag dang ni mi rtag pa nyid 'brel par rung ba kho na'o //
translated: but it is suitable for impermanence to be related to properties based on itself, such as being all-pervading and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i chos can gyi chos las tha dad par ston pa la drug pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos gzhan dang 'brel par rung ba'i chos can gyi chos las tha dad par ston pa la drug pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the sixth case is used to indicate a property of a subject that is suitable to be related to another property, which is different from the property itself.

original: gzhi mthun pa la ni spong ba dang mi spong ba dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa la ni spong ba dang mi spong ba dag tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In a common locus, there would be neither exclusion nor nonexclusion.

original: de lta bu la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i gang nas gang du 'phros pa gang yin pa de ni rnam 'grel du gtan la phab zin pa'i phyir 'dir ni mi spro'o //
analyzed: de lta bu la sogs pa bstan par bya ba'i gang nas gang du 'phros pa gang yin pa de ni rnam 'grel du gtan la phab zin pa'i phyir 'dir ni mi spro'o //
translated: Since such topics and so on have already been determined in the Pramii(laviirttikam) , they will not be elaborated here.

original: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos de nyid 'jig pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos de nyid 'jig pa yin na /
translated: If the very phenomenon that is the reversal of the nature of a thing is destruction,

original: de lta na ni 'o na ji ltar tha snyad byed pa po rnams ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs phyis 'byung ba 'jig par 'dod ce na /
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na ji ltar tha snyad byed pa po rnams ldog pa'i bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs phyis 'byung ba 'jig par 'dod ce na /
translated: then how is it that those who use terminology assert that the later occurrence of a state that has the nature of reversal is destruction?

original: 'di'i rang bzhin de ni mthong ba bzhin du yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di'i rang bzhin de ni mthong ba bzhin du yang zhes smos so //
translated: The nature of this is just as it is seen.

original: gang la thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas goms pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis blo zhe na pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: gang la thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas goms pa'i ma rig pa'i bag chags kyis blo zhe na pa yod pa ste /
translated: There is a mind that is distorted by the habitual tendencies of ignorance that have been cultivated since beginningless cyclic existence.

original: de lta ma yin na ci'i phyir mthong ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad mi rtogs /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na ci'i phyir mthong ba'i dngos po'i bdag nyid thams cad mi rtogs /
translated: If it were not so, why would one not understand the nature of all things as they are seen?

original: gal te ma rig pas ldog pa'i chos can nyid du mi rtogs pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te ma rig pas ldog pa'i chos can nyid du mi rtogs pa yin na /
translated: If one does not understand the phenomenon that is the reversal of the nature of a thing due to ignorance,

original: de lta na ni zhig pa'i dngos po la yang mi brtan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhig pa'i dngos po la yang mi brtan par rtogs par mi 'gyur ro zhes dogs pa la /
translated: But if that were so, then one would not understand that a disintegrated thing is unstable.

original: ma rig pa'i bag chags yod pa la phyi rol yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ma rig pa'i bag chags yod pa la phyi rol yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the existence of the latent potentialities of ignorance is the reason for the error of external things,üîΩit is said:

original: bshad pa / ldog pa dang mi ldan par dngos po dang 'brel pa'i yod pa 'ba' zhig dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / ldog pa dang mi ldan par dngos po dang 'brel pa'i yod pa 'ba' zhig dmigs pa ste /
translated: Only the existence that is related to a thing that is not devoid of cessation is observed.

original: med pa dang bcas pa'i yod @266b pa dmigs na ni /
analyzed: med pa dang bcas pa'i yod @266b pa dmigs na ni /
translated: If the existence that is associated with nonexistence were observed,

original: yod par dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa 'jig pa mthong ba bzhin no //
analyzed: yod par dogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir bum pa 'jig pa mthong ba bzhin no //
translated: then, because there would be no doubt about its existence, it would be like seeing a vase that is destroyed.

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par yang ngo //
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba ni skad cig gnyis pa la sogs par yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlways‚Äù means in the second moment and so on.

original: dngos po sngar mthong ba de ltar yod pa de'i dogs pa skyes pa des bslus shing brid pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po sngar mthong ba de ltar yod pa de'i dogs pa skyes pa des bslus shing brid pa'o //
translated: The existence of that thing that was previously seen is doubted, and by that doubt one is deceived and deluded.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po yod pa 'ba' zhig dmigs kyi /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas dngos po yod pa 'ba' zhig dmigs kyi /
translated: The eye consciousness observes only the existence of a thing,

original: med pa ni ma yin pa des na slu bar byed pa'i 'khrul pa skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: med pa ni ma yin pa des na slu bar byed pa'i 'khrul pa skyes pa yin no //
translated: and not its nonexistence. Therefore, the error of being deceived arises.

original: yod pa dmigs kyang bltar rung ba dang bral ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa las bum pa med par nges pa mthong ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: yod pa dmigs kyang bltar rung ba dang bral ba'i sa phyogs la sogs pa dmigs pa las bum pa med par nges pa mthong ba de bzhin du /
translated: Just as one sees that a pot does not exist in a place that is observed to exist but is devoid of a pot that could be seen,

original: dngos po gzhan skad cig gnyis pa'i dngos po sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong bar dmigs na snga ma med par tha snyad du byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan skad cig gnyis pa'i dngos po sngar mthong ba'i rang bzhin gyis stong bar dmigs na snga ma med par tha snyad du byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: in the same way, if one observes that another entity is empty of the nature that was seen in the previous moment, why would one not conventionally say that the former does not exist?

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba des bslus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba des bslus pa yin no //
translated: One is deceived by the occurrence of another similar one.

original: skad cig gnyis pa la mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni snga ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba yin par te /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la mthong ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni snga ma'i rang bzhin dang 'dra ba yin par te /
translated: The nature that is seen in the second moment is similar to the nature of the former.

original: des na tha dad par rtogs pa med la /
analyzed: des na tha dad par rtogs pa med la /
translated: Therefore, one does not understand them to be different.

original: de med pas na snga ma med par nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pas na snga ma med par nges pa ma yin no //
translated: And because of that, one does not ascertain that the former does not exist.

original: rnam par dbye ba ma nges na sngar yod pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par dbye ba ma nges na sngar yod pa de nyid 'di yin no zhes rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the distinction is not ascertained, one understands that it is just that which existed before. This is the meaning.

original: 'di la de 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba mthong ba dang / bar chad med pa ni slu ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di la de 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba mthong ba dang / bar chad med pa ni slu ba'i rgyu yin gyi /
translated: The reason is that the cause of deception is the occurrence of something similar to that, not the non-apprehension of something different, nor the obstruction of something different.

original: ma dmigs pa dang bar du chod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma dmigs pa dang bar du chod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cause of deception is the occurrence of something similar to that, not the non-apprehension of something different, nor the obstruction of something different.

original: glog gnyis 'dra ba yin yang bar mchod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma med par nges par des na gcig tu 'khrul pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: glog gnyis 'dra ba yin yang bar mchod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snga ma med par nges par des na gcig tu 'khrul pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: Even though two flashes of lightning are similar, there is no deception when one is absent, because there is an obstruction.

original: 'dir ni gnyis pa'i ngo bos stong ba'i dus med pa'i phyir bar chod med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni gnyis pa'i ngo bos stong ba'i dus med pa'i phyir bar chod med pa yin te /
translated: But here, there is no obstruction, because there is no time when it is empty of the nature of the second.

original: skye ba dang 'jig pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba gang bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'jig pa mnyam pa zhes bya ba gang bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is what is explained by the phrase ‚Äúthe arising and ceasing are the same.‚Äù

original: dmigs pa yang 'dra bar 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dmigs pa yang 'dra bar 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: And the similarity of the object is the cause of deception.

original: 'am zhes smos pa ni phyogs snga ma gnyis la lan tha dad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes smos pa ni phyogs snga ma gnyis la lan tha dad par ston pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates a separate response to the two previous positions.

original: don dam par ni phyogs snga ma bsdoms pa'i lan bsdoms pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don dam par ni phyogs snga ma bsdoms pa'i lan bsdoms pa nyid yin no //
translated: Ultimately, the response to the combination of the previous positions is just the combination itself.

original: des na tha dad pa la ltos nas ni rnam par brtags pa yin la /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa la ltos nas ni rnam par brtags pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the analysis is based on the distinction.

original: bsdoms pa la ltos nas ni sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: bsdoms pa la ltos nas ni sdud pa yin te /
translated: But in the sense of a collection, it is a collection.

original: dper na gal te lha sbyin 'ong ngam /
analyzed: dper na gal te lha sbyin 'ong ngam /
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúIf Devadatta comes,üîΩor if Vi≈õvƒÅmitra comes, then I will go,‚ÄùüîΩone is saying that one is available to either one.

original: gal te sna tshogs bshes gnyen 'ong ba de lta na yang do zla'i gya da ni nga'o zhes de dang de la do zla'i gya da ni nga'o zhes smra ba na @267a * //
analyzed: gal te sna tshogs bshes gnyen 'ong ba de lta na yang do zla'i gya da ni nga'o zhes de dang de la do zla'i gya da ni nga'o zhes smra ba na @267a * //
translated: In the same way, when one says, ‚ÄúI am available to each of them,‚Äù

original: re re la bsams nas lam gyi sgra sbyar ba bzhin no //
analyzed: re re la bsams nas lam gyi sgra sbyar ba bzhin no //
translated: one is using the word ‚ÄúI‚Äù in the sense of a collection.

original: yang na da ltar yod pa dmigs pas gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa ma mthong ba de'i tshe yang yod par sems pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na da ltar yod pa dmigs pas gang gi tshe dngos po yod pa ma mthong ba de'i tshe yang yod par sems pa yin te /
translated: Or else, when one sees something present, one thinks that it exists even when it is not seen.

original: dper na dngos po 'di ltar gnas pa de bzhin du phyis kyang gnas so zhes bya ba 'am ;
analyzed: dper na dngos po 'di ltar gnas pa de bzhin du phyis kyang gnas so zhes bya ba 'am ;
translated: For example, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis thing exists in this way now, and it will exist in the same way later.‚Äù

original: mthong ba'i bum pa dus re zhig ma mthong ba las yang mthong ba na /
analyzed: mthong ba'i bum pa dus re zhig ma mthong ba las yang mthong ba na /
translated: Or else, when one sees a pot that one has seen before,

original: de'i tshe mthong ba'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid dus de srid du gnas so zhes dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe mthong ba'i bum pa gang yin pa de nyid dus de srid du gnas so zhes dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: one thinks, ‚ÄúThe pot that I see now is the same pot that I saw a while ago.‚Äù

original: ma mthong ba la yang gnas par dogs pa ni yod pa dmigs pa las yin la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la yang gnas par dogs pa ni yod pa dmigs pa las yin la /
translated: Also, the doubt that it endures when it is not seen is due to the perception of existence.

original: da ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig tu dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i khyad par gyi 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba las yin no //
analyzed: da ltar yod pa 'ba' zhig tu dmigs pa ni sngar bshad pa'i khyad par gyi 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba las yin no //
translated: The perception of it as only presently existent is due to the arising of another similar instance, as explained earlier.

original: des na 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa ni yod pa dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin la /
analyzed: des na 'dra ba gzhan 'byung bas bslus pa ni yod pa dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan du brjod pa yin la /
translated: Thus, the deception due to the arising of another similar instance is said to be the reason for the perception of existence.

original: yod pa dmigs pas ni thams cad du ma mthong ba'i dus su yang gnas par 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: yod pa dmigs pas ni thams cad du ma mthong ba'i dus su yang gnas par 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: And the perception of existence is the reason for the error that it endures even when it is not seen.

original: de'i phyir bshad ma thag pa 'dis ni phyi rol gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bshad ma thag pa 'dis ni phyi rol gyi 'khrul pa'i rgyu bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this just explained is the explanation of the cause of external error.

original: des na skad cig ma tha mthong ba rnams la ldog pa'i chos nges pa'i phyir yod pa dmigs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
analyzed: des na skad cig ma tha mthong ba rnams la ldog pa'i chos nges pa'i phyir yod pa dmigs pa 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin la /
translated: Thus, for those who see the final moment, the cessation of the object is ascertained, and the perception of existence is the reason for error.

original: phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan de yod kyang thar pa rnams la 'khrul pa med pa de'i phyir sngar blo zhen pa zhes bya bas ma rig pa'i bslad pa rgyur bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan de yod kyang thar pa rnams la 'khrul pa med pa de'i phyir sngar blo zhen pa zhes bya bas ma rig pa'i bslad pa rgyur bshad pa yin te /
translated: Although external objective conditions exist, there is no error for the liberated. Therefore, the previous explanation of the cause of the contamination of ignorance is called ‚Äúthe adherence of mind.‚Äù

original: blo zhen pa ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: blo zhen pa ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du brjod do //
translated: Adherence of mind is said to be the characteristic of ignorance.üîΩWhen the master Dignaga taught the external objective conditions,

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan nyid ston par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos phyi rol gyi rgyu mtshan nyid ston par mdzad pa na /
translated: he said:

original: 'dra ba yis ni sgrib pa'i phyir //üîΩde bzung pas na de mi 'dzin //
analyzed: 'dra ba yis ni sgrib pa'i phyir // de bzung pas na de mi 'dzin //
translated: Because of the obscuration of similarity,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: when it is apprehended, it is not apprehended.

original: gzhan gang dag gzhung 'di rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dang ma 'brel par 'chad pa ni bshad pa 'dis spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gang dag gzhung 'di rjod par byed pa ma yin pa dang ma 'brel par 'chad pa ni bshad pa 'dis spang bar bya'o //
translated: Those who do not explain this text and explain it without connection should be refuted by this explanation.

original: 'o na ldog pa'i gnas skabs ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ldog pa'i gnas skabs ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Well, how is impermanence in the state of reversal?

original: bshad pa / yod pa'i dus kyi phyis bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs shes pa'i bdag nyid mi dmigs pa rgyur gyur pas mi gnas par rtogs pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bshad pa / yod pa'i dus kyi phyis bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po 'di bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs shes pa'i bdag nyid mi dmigs pa rgyur gyur pas mi gnas par rtogs pa de'i phyir /
translated: After the time of existence, the nonobservation that has the nature of the cognition of a thing, such as a vase, in a place that is devoid of a vase, serves as the cause for the realization that it does not endure.

original: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni dus phyis yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa'i rang bzhin nges pa ni dus phyis yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of the nature of cessation occurs later.

original: de'i phyir gang gi tshe nges pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gi tshe nges pa de'i tshe mi rtag pa nyid du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore, when it is ascertained, at that time it is posited as impermanence.

original: @267b dngos po ldog pa nyid kyi dus gang yin pa de'i khyad par can gyi ldog pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gyur ba mthong nas phyis rnam par 'jog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba der bshad
analyzed: @267b dngos po ldog pa nyid kyi dus gang yin pa de'i khyad par can gyi ldog pa'i gnas skabs kyi bdag nyid ni mi rtag pa nyid yin no zhes bya ba 'di yang 'gyur ba mthong nas phyis rnam par 'jog pa bzhin no zhes bya ba der bshad
translated: Also, the time of the cessation of a thing is its impermanence, which is the nature of the state of cessation that has that as its attribute. This is also like the later determination of something after seeing its transformation.üîΩThis has already been explained.

original: zin to // des na ldog pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ldog pa'i chos mi rtag pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: zin to // des na ldog pa'i gnas skabs kyi mthar thug pa de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ldog pa'i chos mi rtag pa nyid du gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature of the final state of cessation is the phenomenon of cessation that is impermanence.

original: ldog pa'i gnas skabs 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa'i gnas skabs 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not just the state of reversal,

original: de ni dngos po dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dngos po dang lhan cig 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is not related to the thing.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med ba dag 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because a thing and a non-thing are contradictory,

original: nges ba'i dus kyi khyad par can gyi ldog pa nyid kho bos mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs so zhes smos pa yin no zhes bya ba yang de nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: nges ba'i dus kyi khyad par can gyi ldog pa nyid kho bos mi rtag pa nyid du rtogs so zhes smos pa yin no zhes bya ba yang de nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: I have explained that reversal itself, which is qualified by a specific time, is understood to be impermanence.

original: des na ldog pa'i chos kyi dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ni tha snyad las kyang yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pa'i chos kyi dngos po nyid mi rtag pa yin par ni tha snyad las kyang yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thing that is the quality of reversal is impermanent even from the perspective of conventional usage.

original: de lta ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa ma yin gyis 'on kyang dus phyis 'byung ba yin na de'i tshe 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te gal te dngos po nyid mi rtag pa ma yin gyis 'on kyang dus phyis 'byung ba yin na de'i tshe 'gal ba'i chos dang ldan pa'i phyir don gzhan kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, if a thing were not impermanent but rather occurred later, then at that time it would be a different object because it would possess a contradictory quality.

original: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba rgyu mchan yod pa yin nam med pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can zhes bya ba rgyu mchan yod pa yin nam med pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: It is said to be ‚Äúdue to another cause,‚Äù whether that cause exists or not.

original: dus tha dad pas gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: dus tha dad pas gzhan nyid do //
translated: It is different because of the difference in time.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa de lta yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa nyid de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa de lta yin na ni bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po mi rtag pa nyid de dang ldan par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it were otherwise, that is, if impermanence were not the very nature of things, then impermanence would not be a property of things such as pots.

original: mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi bdag nyid la tha dad pa de'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dgos pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don gyi bdag nyid la tha dad pa de'i byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would be purposeless. This is because the nature of the object would not be different from that which is its cause.üîΩBut if impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.

translated: If impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.

original: pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur gyi /üîΩmi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'jig pa med par ni de yod kyang dngos po 'jig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: pa de nyid mi rtag pa yin par 'gyur gyi / mi rtag pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya ste rang gi bdag nyid du gyur pa'i 'jig pa med par ni de yod kyang dngos po 'jig pa ma yin no //
translated: If impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.

original: 'di snyam du mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pas dngos po mi rtag pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pas dngos po mi rtag pa yin gyi /
translated: If impermanence were to cause the object to become impermanent, then it would be purposeless.üîΩIf impermanence were to cause the

original: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not by its own nature.

original: des na mi rtag pa nyid nye bar sbyor ba ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pas mi rtag par 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: des na mi rtag pa nyid nye bar sbyor ba ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid dang 'brel pas mi rtag par 'gyur ba yin no snyam na /
translated: Therefore, even though impermanence is not applied, because it is related to impermanence, it becomes impermanent.

original: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo na zhes smos so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis mi g-yo na zhes smos so //
translated: If it does not move by its own nature, then it is stable.

original: brtan pa rang gi ngo bos @268a * //
analyzed: brtan pa rang gi ngo bos @268a * //
translated: Stable means not moving by its own nature.

original: g-yo ba med pa ni don gzhan 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa na rang gi ngo bo las 'pho ba ma yin te /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa ni don gzhan 'ga' zhig dang ldan pa na rang gi ngo bo las 'pho ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is related to something else, it does not move from its own nature.

original: des na g-yo ba de'i ngo bor mi 'thad de /
analyzed: des na g-yo ba de'i ngo bor mi 'thad de /
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that movement is its nature.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir dngos po de dang ldan par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that reason, it is not related to that thing.

original: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid de don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can du khas len na ;
analyzed: gzhan yang mi rtag pa nyid de don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can du khas len na ;
translated: Moreover, if impermanence is accepted as the reason for something else,

original: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba 'am /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba 'am /
translated: then that which is called impermanence

original: chos gzhan de'i dngos po'i rgyu gzhan las gyur pa'i don gzhan las 'byung ba na sgrub par byed pa mtshan nyid kyis dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gzhan de'i dngos po'i rgyu gzhan las gyur pa'i don gzhan las 'byung ba na sgrub par byed pa mtshan nyid kyis dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: or another phenomenon that is the cause of that thing would arise from another object. When it arises from another object, the characteristic of the proof would not be the nature of that thing.

original: des na rgyu'am 'bras bu zhig yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na rgyu'am 'bras bu zhig yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, it is either a cause or an effect.

original: gzhan ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de la yod pa 'dogs par rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po de la yod pa 'dogs par rjes su dpag pa gang yin pa de mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the other is unrelated, it is impossible to infer the existence of that thing which is characterized by the proof.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de la don gzhan de rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba de la don gzhan de rgyu nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: In that case, the other object is not the cause of the conceptual thought,

original: sgrub par byed par gyur pa de'i tshe phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir na'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed par gyur pa de'i tshe phyis 'byung ba'i rgyu'i phyir na'o //
translated: because it is the cause of the subsequent occurrence of the proof.

original: gang zhig gang gi phyis 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te ;
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi phyis 'byung ba de ni de'i rgyu ma yin te ;
translated: That which occurs subsequently to something is not the cause of that,

original: / sngar gyi de rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / sngar gyi de rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the former is the cause.

original: 'bras bu yin na yang de yod pa na gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu yin na yang de yod pa na gcig tu nges pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if it were the effect, it would not be ascertained as existing when that exists,

original: nges par rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par rjes su dpag par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be ascertained as the effect.

original: don gzhan las skyes pa de ji ltar sgyu ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: don gzhan las skyes pa de ji ltar sgyu ma yin zhe na /
translated: How can that which arises from another object be an illusion?

original: de zhes smos te /
analyzed: de zhes smos te /
translated: The response is ‚Äúthat‚Äù.

original: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu dag las grub nas so //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa zhes bya ba'i dngos po sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu dag las grub nas so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect is established from the cause of the establishment of the entity called the ‚Äòestablisher.‚Äô

original: don gzhan las 'byung na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: don gzhan las 'byung na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚Äù If it arises from another object,

original: skye ba 'grub pa'i rgyu dngos po gzhan yin no //
analyzed: skye ba 'grub pa'i rgyu dngos po gzhan yin no //
translated: the cause of the establishment of the effect is another entity.

original: gang zhig gang med par grub pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig gang med par grub pa'i dngos po de ni yod pa sngon du 'gro ba can ma yin pa'i phyir de de'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: If an entity is established without another, it is not the cause of that, because it does not precede that which exists.

original: gzhan gyi phan pa ste sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan du gyur pa'i phan pa bogs dbyung ba la ltos pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu gcig la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi phan pa ste sgrub par byed pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dngos po las gzhan du gyur pa'i phan pa bogs dbyung ba la ltos pa'i 'bras bu yang rgyu gcig la gdon mi za bar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe effect that is dependent on the benefit that is other than the characteristic of the establisher is not necessarily in one cause.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar 'bras bu des na sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu las tha dad pa'i rgyu ltos par bya ba yin na gang gi phyir de yang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa la ltos nas nye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'bras bu des na sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu las tha dad pa'i rgyu ltos par bya ba yin na gang gi phyir de yang rang gi rgyu dang 'brel pa la ltos nas nye ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: In this case, if the effect is dependent on a cause that is different from the cause of the establishment of the effect, then because that is also dependent on its own cause, it is not tenable that it is near.

original: don gzhan las skyes pa de yod pa ste /üîΩbdog pa'i go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no //üîΩci ste don gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don gzhan las skyes pa de yod pa ste / bdog pa'i go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs ma nges pa yin no // ci ste don gzhan la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause it arises from another object‚Äù is indefinite.üîΩIf you say that destruction does not depend on another object,

original: 'on kyang 'jig pa ni sgrub par byed pa tsam la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig pa ni sgrub par byed pa tsam la ltos pa yin no zhe na /
translated: but rather that it depends on the mere establishment of the thing,

original: gal te de ltar dngos po tsam las 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar dngos po tsam las 'byung ba yin te /
translated: then if destruction arises from the thing itself,

original: 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos @268b po de rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa'i dngos @268b po de rgyu gzhan la mi ltos pa nyid yin na /
translated: and if the thing that is the effect does not depend on another cause,üîΩthen it would arise without a cause, because it would not depend on another thing.

original: dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir de nyid de'i rgyu med par skyes pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan la mi ltos pa'i phyir de nyid de'i rgyu med par skyes pa yin te /
translated: Since it would not depend on another thing, it would arise without a cause.

original: dngos po'i rgyu las gzhan la mi ltos pas 'jig pa rgyu med par bshad pa yin la /
analyzed: dngos po'i rgyu las gzhan la mi ltos pas 'jig pa rgyu med par bshad pa yin la /
translated: Since it would not depend on a cause of a thing, it would be said that destruction is without a cause.

original: 'jig pa rgyu med pa de ni khyed kyi phyogs der yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: 'jig pa rgyu med pa de ni khyed kyi phyogs der yang mtshungs so //
translated: And that destruction is without a cause is the same for your position.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa tsam gyi rjes su 'brel pa rjes su 'gro ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat much‚Äù refers to the mere establishment of the thing. ‚ÄúConcomitance‚Äù means the relation of following.

original: gal te de tsam la ltos pa'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig na sgrub par byed pa yod pa de la de yang yod pa dang gang gi tshe dngos po grub pa de nyid kyi tshe grub pa yin na ni de'i phyir yu bu gnyis la khyad par cung zad
analyzed: gal te de tsam la ltos pa'i phyir gang 'ga' zhig na sgrub par byed pa yod pa de la de yang yod pa dang gang gi tshe dngos po grub pa de nyid kyi tshe grub pa yin na ni de'i phyir yu bu gnyis la khyad par cung zad
translated: If it is established in dependence on that, then it is established when the thing is established, and if it is established when the thing is established, then what is the difference between the two?

original: kyang med de /
analyzed: kyang med de /
translated: If it is said that because it depends on that, that which is established by some means of establishment exists, and that which is established at the time of the establishment of a thing exists, then in that case there is not the slightest difference between the two, the son and the father.

original: 'di ltar khyed kyis kyang 'jig pa rgyu med pa can dang / skad cig tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar khyed kyis kyang 'jig pa rgyu med pa can dang / skad cig tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because you also assert that destruction is causeless and that it follows after a mere instant.

original: gal te dngos po'i rgyu las gzhan la mi ltos pas rgyu med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i rgyu las gzhan la mi ltos pas rgyu med par brjod pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said that because a thing does not depend on another cause, it is not said to be causeless,

original: 'dir ni rgyu las dngos po dang dngos po las ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir ni rgyu las dngos po dang dngos po las ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: here, because a thing arises from a cause and destruction arises from a thing,

original: rgyu gzhan yin pas rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yin pas rgyu med par mi 'gyur ro ;
translated: it is not causeless because it has another cause.

original: / de lta yin dang skad cig dang po la ni dngos po /
analyzed: / de lta yin dang skad cig dang po la ni dngos po /
translated: If that were so, because in the first moment a thing exists,

original: skad cig gnyis pa la 'jig pa /
analyzed: skad cig gnyis pa la 'jig pa /
translated: in the second moment it is destroyed,

original: skad cig gsum pa la ldog pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: skad cig gsum pa la ldog pa yin pa'i phyir khyad par yod do zhes dogs pa la /
translated: and in the third moment it ceases, there would be a difference.

original: dngos po de las 'jig pa 'ga' zhig 'byung yang ste /
analyzed: dngos po de las 'jig pa 'ga' zhig 'byung yang ste /
translated: Even though some destruction arises from that thing,

original: skyes kyang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po de la rang bzhin gyis khyad par byed pa la 'jig pa de mi dgos pas so //
analyzed: skyes kyang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po de la rang bzhin gyis khyad par byed pa la 'jig pa de mi dgos pas so //
translated: since that thing that generates it does not need that destruction to generate a difference in its essential nature, even though it has arisen.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
