analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: 'jig pa skyed par byed pa'i dngos po brtan pa'i rang bzhin de ni des bskyed pas rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur te des na don de nyams pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig pa skyed par byed pa'i dngos po brtan pa'i rang bzhin de ni des bskyed pas rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'gyur te des na don de nyams pa med pa nyid do //
translated: That thing that generates destruction, which has the nature of stability, does not change into another nature through being generated by that, and therefore that object is not destroyed.

original: de ltar na yang thal ba snga ma zhes bya ba dngos po de la ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na yang thal ba snga ma zhes bya ba dngos po de la ldan par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba nyid yin no //
translated: In that case, the former absurd consequence, namely, ‚Äúthat thing would not be endowed with destruction,‚Äù would not occur.

original: gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo zlog par byed pa'i don byed na ni rang nyid ldog pa'i chos su 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rang gi ngo bo zlog par byed pa'i don byed na ni rang nyid ldog pa'i chos su 'gyur te /
translated: If the thing that is the object of the reversal of its own nature were to perform a function, it would be a phenomenon that is itself reversed.

original: de tsam las byung ba'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos pos de 'jig par byed pa'i nus pa de nyid las thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam las byung ba'i 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos pos de 'jig par byed pa'i nus pa de nyid las thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the thing called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù that arises from that would obtain that very capacity to destroy it.

original: gal te bdag nyid ldog par byed pa'i nus pa med na /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid ldog par byed pa'i nus pa med na /
translated: If it is not able to stop itself,

original: ci ltar bdag nyid ldog par byed nus pa'i dngos po skyed par byed /
analyzed: ci ltar bdag nyid ldog par byed nus pa'i dngos po skyed par byed /
translated: how can it stop something else that is able to stop itself?

original: de la rang gi ngo bo ldog par byed nus na rang nyid ldog pa'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: de la rang gi ngo bo ldog par byed nus na rang nyid ldog pa'i phyir gzhan gyis byas pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: If it is able to stop itself, it does not stop anything else, because it stops itself.

original: ldog par byed pa'i nus pa med na des byas pa gang yin pa de yang zlog par rung ba ma @269a * //
analyzed: ldog par byed pa'i nus pa med na des byas pa gang yin pa de yang zlog par rung ba ma @269a * //
translated: If it is not able to stop itself, then what it does is not suitable to be stopped,

original: yin te / nus pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / nus pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no cause for its ability.üîΩIs it not seen that the poison of a mouse or a mad dog, etc.,

original: byi ba dang khyi smyon gyi dug la sogs pa dang dngos su mi nus pa yang brgyad pas nus pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: byi ba dang khyi smyon gyi dug la sogs pa dang dngos su mi nus pa yang brgyad pas nus pa mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: is not directly able to stop something else, but is able to stop it indirectly?

original: de bzhin du don de bdag nyid ldog par byed mi nus kyang de ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du don de bdag nyid ldog par byed mi nus kyang de ldog par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, although that object is not able to stop itself, it stops itself.

original: 'di ni snying po med pa ste ;
analyzed: 'di ni snying po med pa ste ;
translated: This is pointless.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gang zhig dngos su 'bras bu gang byed pa'i nus pa med pa de nyid rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang / lhan cig dngos su byed nus par yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gang zhig dngos su 'bras bu gang byed pa'i nus pa med pa de nyid rang gi ngo bo tsam gyis byas pa'i lhan cig byed pa dang / lhan cig dngos su byed nus par yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: In this way, that very thing which is not actually able to produce an effect, by its mere nature, is not able to produce an effect in conjunction with other things, nor is it able to produce an effect in conjunction with other things.

original: 'dir ni de tsam gyis byas pa 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos pos rang nyid kyi dngos po de nyid gzhig dgos kyi gang gis dug brgyud pas 'chi bar byed pa ltar brgyud par 'gyur ba gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir ni de tsam gyis byas pa 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i dngos pos rang nyid kyi dngos po de nyid gzhig dgos kyi gang gis dug brgyud pas 'chi bar byed pa ltar brgyud par 'gyur ba gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, the thing called ‚Äúdestruction‚Äù is merely that, and it is necessary to destroy that very nature of itself. It is not like something that kills through a process of transmission, nor is it something that is transmitted.

original: 'dis ni tshogs pa gang las dngos po de skye ba de nyid las dngos po 'jig par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dis ni tshogs pa gang las dngos po de skye ba de nyid las dngos po 'jig par byed pa yin te /
translated: Here, the very collection from which that thing arises is what causes the destruction of the thing.

original: des na skad cig ma nyid yin yang re zhig 'jig pa tha dad par ni grub po zhes gang smras pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na skad cig ma nyid yin yang re zhig 'jig pa tha dad par ni grub po zhes gang smras pa de yang gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that what was said, ‚ÄúEven though it is momentary, the destruction is established as separate,‚Äù is also clear.

original: tshogs pa de nyid kyis dngos su dngos po de ldog pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin du bya dgos la /
analyzed: tshogs pa de nyid kyis dngos su dngos po de ldog pa'i chos kyi rang bzhin du bya dgos la /
translated: That very collection must directly make that thing the nature of the phenomenon of cessation.

original: des byas pa'i 'jig pa des kyang dngos su bskyed pa'i dngos po de nyid bzlog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des byas pa'i 'jig pa des kyang dngos su bskyed pa'i dngos po de nyid bzlog par bya ba yin no //
translated: And the cessation that it produces would be the cessation of that very thing that it directly generates.

original: de'i phyir tshogs pa de dngos su bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin ldog par byed pa dang / ldog par bya bar byed nus pa yin na /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshogs pa de dngos su bskyed par bya ba'i rang bzhin ldog par byed pa dang / ldog par bya bar byed nus pa yin na /
translated: Therefore, if the assembly directly generates the nature of the thing to be ceased, and it is capable of causing the cessation of that which is to be ceased,

original: ldog pa'i bya ba'i dngos po de nyid ji ltar ldog pa'i chos su mi byed de /
analyzed: ldog pa'i bya ba'i dngos po de nyid ji ltar ldog pa'i chos su mi byed de /
translated: then why would that very thing that is the activity of cessation not be the property of cessation?

original: brgyud pa la brten pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: brgyud pa la brten pas ci zhig bya /
translated: What would be the point of relying on an indirect process?

original: de'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos ma yin na ni gzhan gyis kyang ldog par byed mi nus so //üîΩtshogs pa gcig ni 'bras bu 'ga' bar skyed par byed pa yang mi 'thad pas tshogs pa gcig las skyes pa'am /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ldog pa'i chos ma yin na ni gzhan gyis kyang ldog par byed mi nus so // tshogs pa gcig ni 'bras bu 'ga' bar skyed par byed pa yang mi 'thad pas tshogs pa gcig las skyes pa'am /
translated: If the nature of that thing is not the property of cessation, then another thing also would not be able to cause cessation.üîΩIt is also untenable that a single assembly generates some effect.

original: de tsam las byung bas ni dngos po 'jig par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de tsam las byung bas ni dngos po 'jig par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a thing is not capable of being ceased by arising from a single assembly or by arising from that alone.

original: des na gal te 'jig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te 'jig pa ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos po yin na /
translated: Therefore, if a thing has a nature that is not cessation,

original: de la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mi rtag pa nyid rjes su dpog par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that impermanence is inferred.

original: des na 'dis don 'di brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'dis don 'di brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this passage means the following:

original: dngos po tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin na ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid dang / de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par 'grub pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tsam gyi rjes su 'gro ba yin na ni 'bras bur gyur pa'i 'jig pa rgyu med pa nyid dang / de tsam dang rjes su 'brel par 'grub pa yin no //
translated: If it were to occur merely in dependence on things, then the destruction that is the effect would be causeless, and it would be established that it occurs merely in dependence on that.

original: don gzhan nyid yin na ni dngos po 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gzhan nyid yin na ni dngos po 'jig par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a different object, then things would not be destroyed.

original: des na rgyu gzhan @269b la ma ltos pa dang de tsam gyis rjes su 'brel par khas len na /
analyzed: des na rgyu gzhan @269b la ma ltos pa dang de tsam gyis rjes su 'brel par khas len na /
translated: Therefore, if it is accepted that it does not depend on another cause and that it occurs merely in dependence on that,

original: de'i bdag nyid kho nas khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kho nas khas blang dgos te /
translated: then it must be accepted that it is the nature of things themselves.

original: de lta ma yin na dngos po 'jig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na dngos po 'jig pa nyid du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not be tenable that things are destroyed.

original: gal te de'i bdag nyid med kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las skye ba can 'jig pa'i go byed du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te de'i bdag nyid med kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag las skye ba can 'jig pa'i go byed du 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if it is not the nature of things, is it not the case that destruction is understood to occur through the presence of going and coming?

original: de la skye ba can 'ga' zhig 'jig par mthong bas ni rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
analyzed: de la skye ba can 'ga' zhig 'jig par mthong bas ni rjes su 'gro ba yin la /
translated: Since it is seen that some things that arise are destroyed, it is present in the presence of that.

original: mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po skye ba ste /
analyzed: mi rtag pa ma yin pa'i dngos po skye ba ste /
translated: If one does not see the arising of a thing that is not impermanent,

original: skye ba dang ldan par ma mthong na ni ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang ldan par ma mthong na ni ldog pa yin no //
translated: then one sees the reversal.

original: ma mthong ba las ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa yin la /
analyzed: ma mthong ba las ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa yin la /
translated: From non-seeing, the reason is reversed from the non-similar class, from the absence of the probandum.

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa des na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa des na gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med pa yin no //
translated: By that forward and reverse pervasion, the reason is non-erroneous.

original: 'khrul pa med pa las kyang go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa med pa las kyang go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: And from non-erroneous, there is understanding.üîΩTherefore, what is the use of that identity here?

original: des na 'di la de'i bdag nyid kyis ci bya zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: des na 'di la de'i bdag nyid kyis ci bya zhes dogs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to stop that doubt, it is explained:

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med par rigs pa min te /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni gtan tshigs 'khrul pa med par rigs pa min te /
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not reasonable that the reason is non-erroneous by mere non-seeing in the non-similar class,

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba yod kyang 'di la 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba yod kyang 'di la 'khrul pa srid pa can nyid phyir /
translated: because even though non-seeing exists, error is possible here.

original: phrul ba'i 'bras tshos pa la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phrul ba'i 'bras tshos pa la 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the error in a burnt offering.

original: der de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: der de nyid bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to establish that, it is explained:

original: mang po zhig tshos pa mthong yang phru ba'i nang du chud pa tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni tshos bar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: mang po zhig tshos pa mthong yang phru ba'i nang du chud pa tsam 'ba' zhig gis ni tshos bar mi 'grub po //
translated: Although one sees many that are cooked, one does not establish cooking by the mere fact that they are in a pot.

original: khyad par gzhan grub na ni chos par 'grub pa yin pas de bzlog pa'i phyir tsam smos pa yin te /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan grub na ni chos par 'grub pa yin pas de bzlog pa'i phyir tsam smos pa yin te /
translated: But if one establishes a difference, one establishes cooking. Therefore, the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is used to refute that.

original: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la zhes gang 'chad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin yin la zhes gang 'chad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äújust this.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi 'grub ce na /
translated: Why is it not established?

original: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the perception of error.

original: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba s'a lu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhes bya ba s'a lu la sogs pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: It is not the case that just this, the nature of rice, etc.,

original: me dang chu dang phru ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pas 'di dang tshogs pa'i rgyu 'dra ba dag tshogs so zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me dang chu dang phru ba la sogs pa dang 'brel pas 'di dang tshogs pa'i rgyu 'dra ba dag tshogs so zhes bya ba ni 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: is the cause of the assemblage that is similar to the assemblage of the causes of cooking, such as fire, water, a pot, etc.

original: de lta ma yin te khyad par de med na 'de la lhag ma yod pas lhag ma dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te khyad par de med na 'de la lhag ma yod pas lhag ma dang ldan pa ste /
translated: If it were not so, if that difference did not exist, then there would be a remainder, and one would possess a remainder.

original: yul gtan la ma phebs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: yul gtan la ma phebs pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that there is an indeterminate object.

original: de yang 'khrul pa can yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'khrul pa can yin no //
translated: That also is erroneous.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩsgrub par byed pa gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa ston par byed pa de'i ldog pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par the tshom za bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rang gi ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa / sgrub par byed pa gang zhig bsgrub par bya ba med pa la ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa ston par byed pa de'i ldog pa ni ma nges pa'i phyir mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yod par the tshom za bar 'gyur la /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the remainder, he says:üîΩIf a proof is one that shows the reversal of the probandum in the absence of the probandum, merely by the non-observation, then the reversal of that is uncertain, and so there is doubt as to whether it exists in the discordant side.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs kyang go @270a *// bar byed pa ma yin pas ma mthong ba ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs la 'jug pa'i gtan tshigs kyang go @270a *// bar byed pa ma yin pas ma mthong ba ni the tshom rgyu yin phyir /
translated: And since a reason that engages in the discordant side is not understood, the non-observation is the cause of doubt.

original: the tshom gyi rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan par brjod do //
analyzed: the tshom gyi rgyu'i rjes su dpag pa lhag ma dang ldan par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, the remainder is said to be the cause of doubt.

original: mi dmigs kyang ji ltar the tshom za zhe na /
analyzed: mi dmigs kyang ji ltar the tshom za zhe na /
translated: How is there doubt even though there is non-observation?

original: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa thams cad ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAll non-observations‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul can thams cad ni med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul can thams cad ni med pa rtogs par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: All subjects that have an apparent or non-apparent object do not ascertain the non-existence.

original: de'i phyir ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa 'dod pa ni /
translated: Therefore, if you assert that the object of reversal and the agent of reversalüîΩare distinct, then you must assert that the object of reversal and the agent of

original: ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid 'dod par bya dgos te /üîΩ'brel pa ni ldog par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa de gnyis rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid 'dod par bya dgos te / 'brel pa ni ldog par bya ba yin la /
translated: reversal are essentially related.üîΩThe relation is the object of reversal.

original: 'brel ba'i yul ni ldog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel ba'i yul ni ldog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The locus of the relation is the agent of reversal.üîΩOtherwise, if the reversal and the agent of reversal were not essentially related,üîΩthen, because there would be doubt, the reason would not make the probandum

original: de lta ma yin te ldog pa dang ldog par byed pa dag rang bzhin 'brel pa med na the tshom za ba'i phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub bya go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid kyi mjug bsdus pa'o
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ldog pa dang ldog par byed pa dag rang bzhin 'brel pa med na the tshom za ba'i phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub bya go bar byed pa ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa nyid kyi mjug bsdus pa'o
translated: known. This is the conclusion of the argument from the possession of a remainder.üîΩSince the reason makes the probandum known by means of the relation ofüîΩessence, and not just by being unperceived, the master Di·πÖnƒÅga says that theüîΩreason is not established, and that the reversal of the probandum and the reason

original: // gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin gyis ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin pa'i rgyu des na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ma grub pa dang bzlog pa don 'gal ba dang 'khrul pa can ma nges pa
analyzed: // gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid kyis gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin gyis ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ma yin pa'i rgyu des na slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos ma grub pa dang bzlog pa don 'gal ba dang 'khrul pa can ma nges pa
translated: are contradictory, erroneous, and indeterminate.

original: de dag gi gnyen po ste /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po ste /
translated: The antidotes to those are

original: des na gang gi phyir ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gsum la nges pa yod par brjod par mdzad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir ma grub pa dang 'gal ba dang ma nges pa mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir gtan tshigs kyi tshul phyogs kyi chos dang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa gsum la nges pa yod par brjod par mdzad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since unestablished, contradictory, and uncertain reasons are discordant, the three modes of the reason‚Äîthe property of the subject, positive concomitance, and negative concomitance‚Äîare stated to be certain.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa'i 'brel pa med pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa nyid mi 'grub pa des na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa'i 'brel pa med pa ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges pa nyid mi 'grub pa des na /
translated: Because, as previously explained, the relation of natural connection is not a relation of absence, and positive and negative concomitance are not established.

original: slob dpon rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa de nyid ston par mdzad pa na /
analyzed: slob dpon rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa de nyid ston par mdzad pa na /
translated: Therefore, when the master teaches the certainty of natural connection,

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa dag nges pa yin par bshad pa yin no //
translated: he explains that positive and negative concomitance are certain.

original: slob dbon gyi tshul gsum pa'i yul can gyi nges pa brjod ba'i tshig de nyid ston par byed de /
analyzed: slob dbon gyi tshul gsum pa'i yul can gyi nges pa brjod ba'i tshig de nyid ston par byed de /
translated: The master teaches the words that express the certainty that has the three modes as its object.

original: rab tu grub pa ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don ni'o //
analyzed: rab tu grub pa ni zhes bya ba ni nges pa'i don ni'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWell established‚Äù means ‚Äúcertain.‚Äù

original: gang la zhe na ;
analyzed: gang la zhe na ;
translated: Why?üîΩüîΩ

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang ngo //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la yang ngo //
translated: because it is in both the proponent and the opponent.

original: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa ste tshig ni 'di yin no //üîΩtshul gsum pa nges pa'i tshig de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba bsal lo //üîΩde'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag ste /
analyzed: sgrub pa zhes bya ba ni go bar byed pa ste tshig ni 'di yin no // tshul gsum pa nges pa'i tshig de la rjes su 'gro ba nges pas ni 'gal ba bsal lo // de'i phyogs dang mthun pa ni 'gal ba'i phyogs dang mthun pa dag ste /
translated: The proof is the means of understanding, and the words are the means of expression.üîΩThe trimodal definition is ascertained by the ascertainment of pervasion.

original: rjes su @270b 'gro ba nges pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: rjes su @270b 'gro ba nges pa nyid kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: The concordant is the discordant, and it is excluded by the ascertainment of pervasion.

original: de dag ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni de'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin te /
translated: They belong to that side,

original: 'gal ba dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gal ba dang lhan cig grub pa dang bde ba gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are established together with the discordant.

original: ldog par nges pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba dang thun mong gi ma nges ba'o //
analyzed: ldog par nges pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ldog par the tshom za ba dang thun mong gi ma nges ba'o //
translated: The ascertainment of the reverse is the doubt about the reverse in the discordant, and the common is the uncertain.

original: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gcig la grub pa 'gog pa ste /
analyzed: gnyi ga la zhes bya ba ni gcig la grub pa 'gog pa ste /
translated: Both is the negation of establishment in one,

original: gzhan gyis rang la grub pa'i gtan tshigs las don bstan par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rang la grub pa'i gtan tshigs las don bstan par bya ba yin te /
translated: because the other is to be taught by means of a reason established for oneself.

original: des na gcig la grub pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no //üîΩrab tu grub ces bya bas ni the tshom za ba lhag ma dang ldan pa thun mong ma yin pa dag go zhes bshad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gcig la grub pa ni go bar byed pa ma yin no // rab tu grub ces bya bas ni the tshom za ba lhag ma dang ldan pa thun mong ma yin pa dag go zhes bshad par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of one is not the means of establishing the other.

original: lhag ma dang ldan pa ni bshad ma thag pa yin la /
analyzed: lhag ma dang ldan pa ni bshad ma thag pa yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúestablished‚Äù indicates that the reason is not inconclusive, i.e., that it is not the case that the reason is present in some similar instances and also present in some dissimilar instances.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid do //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni mnyan bya nyid do //
translated: The reason is not present in any dissimilar instances.üîΩThe reason is present in all similar instances.

original: gang la the tshom za ba dag ce na /
analyzed: gang la the tshom za ba dag ce na /
translated: In what instances is there doubt?

original: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o //üîΩlhag ma dang ldan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za la /
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la'o // lhag ma dang ldan pa ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za la /
translated: In the similar instances and the dissimilar instances.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ni gnyi ga la yang the tshom za ba yin no //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ni gnyi ga la yang the tshom za ba yin no //
translated: The reason is not present in any dissimilar instances.üîΩThe reason is present in all similar instances.

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon rang bzhin 'brel pa bzhed pa yin no zhes bsgrubs nas yang /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa nges par brjod pa'i phyir slob dpon rang bzhin 'brel pa bzhed pa yin no zhes bsgrubs nas yang /
translated: Thus, the master DignƒÅga is proving that the relation between reason and probandum is natural, because he states that the reason is invariably concomitant with the probandum.

original: tshig gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshig gzhan gyis bsgrub pa'i phyir /
translated: He proves this by means of another statement.

original: 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúWithout a connection‚Äù and so on.

original: ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa tsam gyis slob dpon ldog par bzhed pa yin na ni slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa ste ci zhig bshad ce na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tshad ma ma yin pa tsam gyis slob dpon ldog par bzhed pa yin na ni slob dpon gyis bshad pa gang yin pa ste ci zhig bshad ce na /
translated: If the master [DignƒÅga] accepts that non-perception is not a valid means of knowledge, then what is it that the master explained?

original: re zhig ces bya ba nas 'dis brtsams zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: re zhig ces bya ba nas 'dis brtsams zhes bshad pa zhes bya ba'i mthar thug pa'o //
translated: [He explained] from ‚Äúat first‚Äù up to ‚Äúthis is what is explained.‚Äù

original: rigs pa de yang gang yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: rigs pa de yang gang yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: What is that reasoning? It is explained:

original: gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'dis ni rigs so //
analyzed: gnyi ga brjod par bya ba gang yin pa 'dis ni rigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù is what is to be stated. This is reasonable.

original: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'o //üîΩ'gal ba dang ma nges pa des pa de dag gi gnyen por te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'o // 'gal ba dang ma nges pa des pa de dag gi gnyen por te de'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúBoth‚Äù refers to concomitance and the counter pervasion.üîΩThe remedies for those two are the opposite of those two, i.e., the non-contradictory and the non-uncertain.

original: gang gi phyir 'gal ba dang ma des pa 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir de dag bzlog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa brjod par bya ba yin no//
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'gal ba dang ma des pa 'di dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa de'i phyir de dag bzlog pa'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa brjod par bya ba yin no//
translated: Because these two are the opposites of the contradictory and the uncertain, therefore the concomitance and the counter pervasion are to be stated.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma brjod na ni gtan tshigs 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma brjod na ni gtan tshigs 'gal bar dogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If the positive concomitance is not stated, there is the doubt that the reason is contradictory.

original: ldog pa ma brjod na ni ma nges par ro //
analyzed: ldog pa ma brjod na ni ma nges par ro //
translated: If the negative concomitance is not stated, there is the doubt that the reason is inconclusive.

original: re zhig gi sgra nas shes kyi sgra'i mthar thug pa'i tshig ni gang gi sgras gzung ba yin la gang dang de yang rtag tu 'brel pa yin te /üîΩdes na de la zhes khong @271a * //
analyzed: re zhig gi sgra nas shes kyi sgra'i mthar thug pa'i tshig ni gang gi sgras gzung ba yin la gang dang de yang rtag tu 'brel pa yin te / des na de la zhes khong @271a * //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is understood from the word ‚Äúfrom‚Äù at the end of the sentence. That which is grasped by the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is always related to the word ‚Äúthat.‚Äù

original: nas phyung ste ngag tu brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: nas phyung ste ngag tu brtag par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äúthat‚Äù is understood from the sentence.

original: bshad pa / gang yin pa de la chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / gang yin pa de la chos mi mthun pa smos pa ni ma nges pa'i gnyen por ro //
translated: The statement of the dissimilar example is the antidote to the doubt that the reason is inconclusive.

original: des na chos mi mthun pa smos pas ci bya /üîΩgal te ma mthong ba ston par byed do zhe na /üîΩgal te ma mthong ba ba ston par byed na ni ;
analyzed: des na chos mi mthun pa smos pas ci bya / gal te ma mthong ba ston par byed do zhe na / gal te ma mthong ba ba ston par byed na ni ;
translated: What is the use of stating the dissimilar example?üîΩIf it shows what is not seen,üîΩif it shows what is not seen,

original: ma mthong ba de ni ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba de ni ma smos kyang rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then that which is not seen would be understood even if it were not stated.

original: gal te 'di snyam du smos pa'i sngar pha rol po la mthong bar 'khrul pa yod pa gang yin pa de smos pas ldog go snyam na de la sngar zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du smos pa'i sngar pha rol po la mthong bar 'khrul pa yod pa gang yin pa de smos pas ldog go snyam na de la sngar zhes smos so //
translated: But if you think that the previously existing error of seeing in the other is eliminated by the statement, then the word ‚Äúpreviously‚Äù is stated.

original: tshig gis ma mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'khrul pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: tshig gis ma mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni mthong bar 'khrul pa ni med kyi /
translated: The word ‚Äúnot seeing‚Äù means that there is no error of seeing.

original: 'on kyang brjed pa'i phyir tshig gis dran par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang brjed pa'i phyir tshig gis dran par byed pa yin te /
translated: However, because of forgetting, one is reminded by the word.üîΩFor example, just as seeing itself is reminded by the word.

original: dper na mthong ba nyid tshig gis dran par byed pa bzhin no zhes dogs na dpe nyid mi mthun par bstan pa'i phyir mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: dper na mthong ba nyid tshig gis dran par byed pa bzhin no zhes dogs na dpe nyid mi mthun par bstan pa'i phyir mthong ba ma rtogs pa ni zhes smos te /
translated: If you suspect that, then in order to show that the example itself is inconsistent, he says, ‚ÄúThe non-realization of seeing.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir ma dran pa ni yan lag ma yin pa des na mthong ba de la ni dran pa'i rgyu brjod par rigs na ;
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma dran pa ni yan lag ma yin pa des na mthong ba de la ni dran pa'i rgyu brjod par rigs na ;
translated: Since non-remembrance is not a part of that, it is reasonable to state the cause of memory in that seeing.

original: ma mthong ba'i don du ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba'i don du ni mi rigs te /
translated: But it is not reasonable for the purpose of non-seeing.

original: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba ni mthong ba log pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma mthong ba ni mthong ba log pa yin te /
translated: Because non-seeing is the opposite of seeing.

original: de ni mthong bas ldog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mthong bas ldog par 'gyur ro //
translated: That is eliminated by seeing.

original: mthong ba de med na mthong ba med pa grub pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: mthong ba de med na mthong ba med pa grub pa kho na yin no //
translated: If that seeing does not exist, then the nonexistence of seeing is established.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is as follows:

original: mthong ba'i dngos po 'jug pa ni res 'ga' brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i don du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba'i dngos po 'jug pa ni res 'ga' brjod par 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i don du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The engagement of the entity of seeing is sometimes described, and therefore it is described in terms of that.

original: mthong ba ldog pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba med pa ni brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba ldog pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba med pa ni brjod par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: But the nature of the cessation of seeing cannot be described as the nonexistence of seeing.

original: de brjed na ni mthong ba yod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de brjed na ni mthong ba yod par dogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were forgotten, then seeing would be suspected of existing.

original: mthong ba yang ngo bo dang ldan par myong ba yin na myong ba yang med de /
analyzed: mthong ba yang ngo bo dang ldan par myong ba yin na myong ba yang med de /
translated: And if seeing is experienced as having an essence, then experience would exist.

original: des na mthong ba myong ba med pa nyid kyis mthong ba med pa ma brjed par gnas pa'i phyir ci zhig dran par byar yod /
analyzed: des na mthong ba myong ba med pa nyid kyis mthong ba med pa ma brjed par gnas pa'i phyir ci zhig dran par byar yod /
translated: But since seeing is not experienced, the nonexistence of seeing is not forgotten, so what is there to remember?

original: 'on te yang sngar mthong ba byung bar dogs pa gang yin pa de'i tshe ma mthong bar yang dogs par 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'on te yang sngar mthong ba byung bar dogs pa gang yin pa de'i tshe ma mthong bar yang dogs par 'gyur bas /
translated: But if it is suspected that the previously seen object exists, then it is suspected that it is not seen.

original: dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don du mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la gtan tshigs ma mthong ngo zhes brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: dogs pa de bzlog pa'i don du mi mthun pa'i phyogs de la gtan tshigs ma mthong ngo zhes brjod do zhe na /
translated: In order to eliminate that doubt, one says, ‚ÄúI do not see a reason for that contrary thesis.‚Äù

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: gang zhig rang nyid 'ga' zhig la mthong bar the tshom za ba de gzhan gyi tshig tshad ma ma yin pas ji ltar mthong ba med par nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang zhig rang nyid 'ga' zhig la mthong bar the tshom za ba de gzhan gyi tshig tshad ma ma yin pas ji ltar mthong ba med par nges par 'gyur /
translated: If one doubts that one sees something, then since the words of another are not a valid means of knowledge, how could one ascertain that one does not see?

original: dus de'i tshe yod pa'i mthong ba med pa yang nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba bstan pa ni don med do //
analyzed: dus de'i tshe yod pa'i mthong ba med pa yang nges pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ma mthong ba bstan pa ni don med do //
translated: At that time, one would also ascertain that one does not see what exists. Therefore, it is pointless to teach that one does not see.

original: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis @271b med do zhes med par nges pa ma yin pas de'i don du med pa nyid du nges pa'i don du mi mthun phyogs la med pa brjod do zhe na /üîΩgal te zhes smos te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis zhes bya ba mi dmigs pa tsam gyis @271b med do zhes med par nges pa ma yin pas de'i don du med pa nyid du nges pa'i don du mi mthun phyogs la med pa brjod do zhe na / gal te zhes smos te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúIt is not so by mere non-apprehension,‚Äù then one does not ascertain non-existence by mere non-apprehension. Therefore, in order to ascertain non-existence, one says that the contrary thesis does not exist.üîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúIf one does not understand by not seeing, one will not understand by stating it either.‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong bas mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas mi rtogs na brjod pas kyang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand by not seeing, one will not understand by stating it either.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes smos te /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThat also,‚Äù

original: mi dmigs pa tsam zhig brjod pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa tsam zhig brjod pas khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that there is no difference, because the mere non-apprehension of the proof is stated.

original: 'di snyam du tshig gis ni sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam ston pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshig gis ni sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pa tsam ston pa ma yin gyi /
translated: If you think that the words do not teach the mere non-apprehension of the proof,

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pa yang yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba mi dmigs pa yang yin la /
translated: but rather that the non-apprehension of the probandum is also the proof,

original: de las grub par byed pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de las grub par byed pa med par rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: and that from that, the non-existence of the proof is understood,üîΩthen NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: bshad pa / bsgrub bar bya ba gcig mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: bshad pa / bsgrub bar bya ba gcig mi dmigs pas so //
translated: The non-apprehension of one thing is not the proof of another.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother‚Äù is the proof.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because it is absurd.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig ma dmigs pas thams cad med par sgrub par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig ma dmigs pas thams cad med par sgrub par 'gyur te khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ha cang thal ba'o //
translated: The absurdity is that if the non-apprehension of either one of them is the proof of the non-existence of the other, then the non-apprehension of anything would prove the non-existence of everything, because there would be no difference between them.

original: sgrub par byed pa med pa ni gzhan mi dmigs pa des bsgrub pa ni ma yin na gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med pa ni gzhan mi dmigs pa des bsgrub pa ni ma yin na gang gis ha cang thal bar 'gyur /
translated: If the non-existence of the proof is not established by the non-apprehension of the other, then what is the absurdity?

original: 'on kyang rang nyid de bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi mi dmigs pas grub po //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang nyid de bdag nyid kyi yul can gyi mi dmigs pas grub po //
translated: But it is established by the non-apprehension of the object itself.

original: rang nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba ma dmigs pa rgyu yin pa bkag pa yin no //
analyzed: rang nyid ces bya ba 'dis ni bsgrub par bya ba ma dmigs pa rgyu yin pa bkag pa yin no //
translated: By the word ‚Äúitself‚Äù he refutes the cause of the non-apprehension of the object to be established.

original: de lta na yang snang ba mi dmigs par rung ba'i don ma mthong na med pa'i tha snyad du rigs kyi /
analyzed: de lta na yang snang ba mi dmigs par rung ba'i don ma mthong na med pa'i tha snyad du rigs kyi /
translated: Even so, if the object suitable for non-apprehension of appearance is not seen, it is reasonable to make the statement of non-existence.

original: snang ba ma mthong ba de med na ni sgrub par byed pa med pa'i tha snyad de mi rigs so //
analyzed: snang ba ma mthong ba de med na ni sgrub par byed pa med pa'i tha snyad de mi rigs so //
translated: But if the appearance is not seen, it is not reasonable to make the statement of non-existence of the proof.

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad la ni /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad la ni /
translated: In all cases of non-existence of the object to be established,

original: sgrub par byed pa snang ba mi dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa snang ba mi dmigs pa med do //
translated: there is no non-apprehension of the appearance of the proof.

original: 'o na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sgrub par byed pa snang ba mthong ba med pa yod pa de nyid las /
analyzed: 'o na ni bsgrub par bya ba med pa'i phyogs 'ga' zhig tu sgrub par byed pa snang ba mthong ba med pa yod pa de nyid las /
translated: But in some places where the object to be established does not exist, the appearance of the proof is not seen. From that,

original: bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad la sgrub par byed pa med par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba med pa thams cad la sgrub par byed pa med par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: it is understood that in all cases of non-existence of the object to be established, the proof does not exist.

original: gal te ma mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba'i sgrub par byed pa yod na ni /
translated: If the existent proof is not seen,

original: de'i tshe mthong ba la yang 'gyur na mthong ba la ni med de /
analyzed: de'i tshe mthong ba la yang 'gyur na mthong ba la ni med de /
translated: If it were so, then it would be seen, but it is not seen.

original: bltar rung ba las ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: bltar rung ba las ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because it is not observed in what is suitable to be seen.

original: / des na ma mthong ba la yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: / des na ma mthong ba la yang mi 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that it is not seen.

original: la lar te mthong ba la rgyu mtshan med par nye bar gnas pas 'dod rgyal du'o //
analyzed: la lar te mthong ba la rgyu mtshan med par nye bar gnas pas 'dod rgyal du'o //
translated: In some cases, it is accidental, because it is present without a reason for being seen.

original: bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: bzlog par bya ba dang zlog par byed pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The reason for what is to be refuted and the refutation is the relation.

original: de med par de ltar zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa @272a * //
analyzed: de med par de ltar zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa @272a * //
translated: If that does not exist, then even if the probandum is not so, the proof

original: log par gyur kyang de dag 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log par gyur kyang de dag 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: is reversed. But because they are not related, the pervasion is not established.

original: chos nyid 'brel pa yin na ni 'brel pa'i yul log na 'brel pa yang gdon mi za bar ldog par rtogs kyi /
analyzed: chos nyid 'brel pa yin na ni 'brel pa'i yul log na 'brel pa yang gdon mi za bar ldog par rtogs kyi /
translated: If the relation is the nature of the property, then when the object of the relation is reversed, the relation is certainly reversed.

original: phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pas ni khyab pa mi 'grub po ;
analyzed: phyogs gcig la 'jug pa'i snang ba mi dmigs pas ni khyab pa mi 'grub po ;
translated: But the non-observation of the appearance that engages one part does not establish the pervasion.

original: / de'i phyir de mi rigs so //
analyzed: / de'i phyir de mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, that is not reasonable.

original: des na bsgrub par bya ba ma mthong ba las ni sgrub par byed pa med par rtogs pa ma yin te der ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na bsgrub par bya ba ma mthong ba las ni sgrub par byed pa med par rtogs pa ma yin te der ma 'brel pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the nonseeing of the probandum does not realize the nonexistence of the proof, because they are not related.

original: de rang gi ngo bo ma mthong bas kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo ma mthong bas kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the nonseeing of its own nature,

original: bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not suitable to be seen.

original: mthong ba med pa ni rang nyid grub pa'i phyir tshig gis ni cung zad kyang byar med do //
analyzed: mthong ba med pa ni rang nyid grub pa'i phyir tshig gis ni cung zad kyang byar med do //
translated: Since the nonseeing is established by itself, words do not do anything at all.

original: 'di ltar dmigs pa bkag pa'i mi dmigs pa ni tshig gis nus par bya ba ma yin te med pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs pa bkag pa'i mi dmigs pa ni tshig gis nus par bya ba ma yin te med pa la nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus the nonapprehension that is the negation of an object is not something that can be done by words, because words have no power over nonexistents.

original: des na tshig ni don ston pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin la don yang mthong ba med pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: des na tshig ni don ston pa nyid kyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin la don yang mthong ba med pa nyid yin na /
translated: Thus words have a purpose only by teaching the meaning, and the meaning is the nonseeing.

original: de ni grub zin pa'i phyir tshig gis ci bya /
analyzed: de ni grub zin pa'i phyir tshig gis ci bya /
translated: Since that is already established, what can words do?

original: 'di snyam du tshig gang las sgrub par byed pa de bzlog pa ni nus pa de 'dra ba yin no snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du tshig gang las sgrub par byed pa de bzlog pa ni nus pa de 'dra ba yin no snyam na /
translated: If you think that the words that prove that have the power to negate that,

original: rgol ba des bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te zhes bya ba de la sgrub par byed pa med par mi 'gyur te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgol ba des bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa med do zhes brjod pas kyang de ltar 'gyur ba ma yin te zhes bya ba de la sgrub par byed pa med par mi 'gyur te ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because it would lead to absurdity.

original: yod dam med kyang rung ste rgol ba dang 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i tshig las 'grub par 'gyur na /
analyzed: yod dam med kyang rung ste rgol ba dang 'dod pa gang yin pa de nyid de'i tshig las 'grub par 'gyur na /
translated: If the opponent‚Äôs statement established the absence of the proof, then whether the probandum exists or not, whatever the opponent asserts would be established by his statement.

original: de lta yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so.

original: de bas na gcig log pas gzhan log par 'dod pas de la ste cig shos ldog pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ldog pa la rigs pa ni 'thad pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gcig log pas gzhan log par 'dod pas de la ste cig shos ldog pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi ldog pa la rigs pa ni 'thad pa ste /
translated: Therefore, since the opponent asserts that the negation of one thing is the negation of another, the negation of the one is the antecedent of the negation of the other.

original: rigs pa gang gis rtogs pa po 'di bsgrub bya log na sgrub byed ldog pa zhes nges par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rigs pa gang gis rtogs pa po 'di bsgrub bya log na sgrub byed ldog pa zhes nges par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By what reasoning does the opponent ascertain that the negation of the probandum is the negation of the proof?

original: don de nyid tshigs su bcad pas bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: don de nyid tshigs su bcad pas bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to summarize that point, he says,

original: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: med ces bya ba'i tshig gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThe word ‚Äònot‚Äô also . . .‚Äù

original: med do zhes brjod pas ni de med pa kho nar mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: med do zhes brjod pas ni de med pa kho nar mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: But by saying it does not exist, it does not become nonexistent.

original: gal te ji ltar te rigs pa'i rnam pa gang gis de med pa'i rigs pa de brjod pa de'i tshe med do zhes nges pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te ji ltar te rigs pa'i rnam pa gang gis de med pa'i rigs pa de brjod pa de'i tshe med do zhes nges pa yin no //
translated: If one says it does not exist, it is ascertained as nonexistent only when the reason for its nonexistence is stated.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid bstan pa'i don du 'brel pa'i yul log pas 'brel pa'i chos ldog pa ni ldog pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya @272b ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa nyid bstan pa'i don du 'brel pa'i yul log pas 'brel pa'i chos ldog pa ni ldog pa'i tshig gis brjod par bya ba yin no zhes bya @272b ba ni slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po'i dgongs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to show the relation of intrinsic identity, the master Dignaga said, The negation of the related object is expressed by the word 'negation,' because the negation of the related property is implied by the negation of the related object.

original: de zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa grub pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba bsgrub par bya ba med pa la sgrub par byed pa mi dmigs pas bsgrub par bya ba med pa las ldog pa grub pa'o //
translated: The word that refers to the object of negation, and the non-observation of the proving property in the object of negation establishes the negation of the object of negation.

original: 'di la la lar 'dod rgyal du log pa yin yang 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes cung zad bshad zin to ;
analyzed: 'di la la lar 'dod rgyal du log pa yin yang 'brel pa med pas khyab pa mi 'grub po zhes cung zad bshad zin to ;
translated: It has been explained a little earlier that even if the negation is accidental, the pervasion is not established because there is no relation.

original: / gzhan yang gal te ma mthong ba mthong ba med pa tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: / gzhan yang gal te ma mthong ba mthong ba med pa tsam gyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the absence of the opposite of non-seeing were to be the mere absence of seeing,

original: slob dpon gyis ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa can yin par gsungs /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ji ltar lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa 'khrul pa can yin par gsungs /
translated: then how could the master state that the inference with remainder is erroneous?

original: dper na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa slob dpon gyis gsungs pa de nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya ba ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i rjes su dpag pa slob dpon gyis gsungs pa de nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: For example indicates that very inference with remainder that the master stated.

original: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba zos pa'i 'bras bu dang ro 'dra ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang ro 'di bro ba zhes bya ba zos pa'i 'bras bu dang ro 'dra ba nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: The establishment is that the ripened fruit and the taste are similar to the eaten fruit and taste.

original: khyad par can gyi gzugs skya bo ni gtan tshigs yin la /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi gzugs skya bo ni gtan tshigs yin la /
translated: The reason is the special gray color.

original: shing phung ngam yal ga gcig las skyes pa yang gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: shing phung ngam yal ga gcig las skyes pa yang gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: The reason is also that it is born from a single tree trunk or branch.

original: zos pa'i 'bras bu ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: zos pa'i 'bras bu ni dpe yin no //
translated: The example is the eaten fruit.

original: sbyor ba 'di la yang mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba 'di la yang mi dmigs pa yod pa yin te /
translated: This syllogism also has non-apprehension.

original: dpe zos pa'i 'bras bu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu phyogs su byas te /
analyzed: dpe zos pa'i 'bras bu las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu phyogs su byas te /
translated: The result of eating is different from the result of the object that is the domain of the sense faculties.

original: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du brten na gtan tshigs yal ga gcig las skyes pa dang gzugs khyad par med pa dag bsgrub par bya ba med pa la mi dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba nyid du brten na gtan tshigs yal ga gcig las skyes pa dang gzugs khyad par med pa dag bsgrub par bya ba med pa la mi dmigs pa yod pa yin no //
translated: If the domain of the sense faculties is taken as the subject, then the reason is not established, and the nonobservation of the nonappearing is present.

original: 'di ltar zos pa dang phyogs su byas pa las gzhan la gtan tshigs 'jug pa med pas bsgrub bya med pa la mi dmigs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zos pa dang phyogs su byas pa las gzhan la gtan tshigs 'jug pa med pas bsgrub bya med pa la mi dmigs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, because the reason does not apply to anything other than what is eaten and the domain of the sense faculties, the nonobservation of the nonappearing is present when the subject is not present.

original: de'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa grub pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba la ji ltar 'khrul pa yin ;
analyzed: de'i phyir ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa grub pa'i gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba la ji ltar 'khrul pa yin ;
translated: Therefore, how can the reason that establishes the pervasion by mere nonobservation be mistaken?

original: dbang phyug sde la sogs pa kha cig na re mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba la gnod pa der dogs pa de nyid 'khrul pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang phyug sde la sogs pa kha cig na re mngon sum gyis bsgrub par bya ba la gnod pa der dogs pa de nyid 'khrul pa yin te /
translated: Some, such as ƒ™≈õvarasena, say that the reason is mistaken because there is doubt that the subject is undermined by direct perception.

original: phyogs su byas pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pas gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: phyogs su byas pa'i yul la mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pas gtan tshigs 'khrul pa yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: They say that the reason is mistaken because there is doubt that the subject is undermined by direct perception.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'ba' zhig gis ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa 'ba' zhig gis ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: A reason is not a proof merely by the presence or absence of the property to be established.

original: 'on kyang gnod pa med pa'i yul can zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang gnod pa med pa'i yul can zhes bya ba'i mtshan nyid gzhan yod pa yin no //
translated: But there is another characteristic, namely, that it is not contradicted.

original: mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa la ni de nges pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gzhan ma nges pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis gnod par dogs pa la ni de nges pa med pa'i phyir mtshan nyid gzhan ma nges pa'i phyir 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: If there is doubt about contradiction by perception, then the reason is mistaken because the other characteristic is not ascertained.

original: ma yin te @273a * //
analyzed: ma yin te @273a * //
translated: No, it is not.

original: zhes bya bas de zlog par byed do //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de zlog par byed do //
translated: The word ‚Äúno‚Äù refutes that.

original: phyogs su byas pa'i yul de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyogs su byas pa'i yul de la mngon sum gyis gnod pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no contradiction by perception with regard to the object that is the property-possessor.

original: ji ste phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod par gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ji ste phyogs la mngon sum gyis gnod par gal te na 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If there were contradiction by perception with regard to the subject, then there would be contradiction.

original: ji lta bur dogs na zhes bya ba gnod pa 'jug par dogs na'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur dogs na zhes bya ba gnod pa 'jug par dogs na'o //
translated: If there is doubt about contradiction, then there is doubt about the presence of the reason in the subject.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i phyogs gzhan la yang gnod pa med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i phyogs gzhan la yang gnod pa med par nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no certainty that there is no contradiction with regard to another subject that is desired.

original: gal te gnod par dogs pa la yang sgrub par byed pa 'jug par khas blangs na /üîΩ'o na ni gnod pa zhugs pa gnod par byas pa'i yul la yang 'jug ste /
analyzed: gal te gnod par dogs pa la yang sgrub par byed pa 'jug par khas blangs na / 'o na ni gnod pa zhugs pa gnod par byas pa'i yul la yang 'jug ste /
translated: If you accept that even when there is a doubt about whether there is a fault, the proof is engaged,üîΩthen even when there is a fault, the proof would be engaged with respect to the object that is the basis of the fault.

original: des na gang la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod pa de la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang la mngon sum gyis gnod pa yod pa de la yang rjes su dpag pa 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, even with respect to that which is undermined by perception, inference would be engaged.

original: 'di gsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di gsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to clarify this, Dharmakirti says:

original: tshad ma zhugs pa gtan tshigs zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshad ma zhugs pa gtan tshigs zlog par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: A valid cognition that undermines the object of the reason is what stops the reason.

original: tshad ma ma zhugs par gnod par byed pa yin na ni go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
analyzed: tshad ma ma zhugs par gnod par byed pa yin na ni go bar byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs thams cad la yid brtan du med do //
translated: If a valid cognition that does not engage its object undermines it, then since it would not be understood, one could not rely on any reason at all.

original: 'di ltar ci srid gtan tshigs ma zhugs pa de srid du bsgrub bya med par dogs pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ci srid gtan tshigs ma zhugs pa de srid du bsgrub bya med par dogs pa nyid yin la /
translated: As long as the reason does not engage its object, there is doubt that the probandum does not exist.

original: med par dogs pa nyid kyang gnod par dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: med par dogs pa nyid kyang gnod par dogs pa yin no //
translated: And doubt that something does not exist is doubt that it is undermined.

original: gnod pa'i yul can gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gnod pa'i yul can gang yin pa de ni go bar byed pa ma yin te /
translated: That which has an object that is undermined is not understood.

original: des na 'ga' yang go bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na 'ga' yang go bar byed par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, nothing would be understood.

original: ci ste sngar sgrub par byed pa zhugs pa las yul 'ga' zhig tu bsgrub bya med par dogs pa med do //
analyzed: ci ste sngar sgrub par byed pa zhugs pa las yul 'ga' zhig tu bsgrub bya med par dogs pa med do //
translated: But if one has already engaged in the proof, then there is no doubt that the probandum does not exist in some domain.

original: dngos po gtan la phebs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po gtan la phebs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the thing has been ascertained.

original: 'o na ni gong las gnod pa med par nges pa de nyid go bar byed pa yin pas gtan tshigs gzhan gyis ci bya /
analyzed: 'o na ni gong las gnod pa med par nges pa de nyid go bar byed pa yin pas gtan tshigs gzhan gyis ci bya /
translated: But then, since that very ascertainment, which is not undermined by something higher, is what understands, what is the use of another reason?

original: des na gnod par dogs par 'gyur ba nyid la gtan tshigs sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gnod par dogs par 'gyur ba nyid la gtan tshigs sbyor ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, one employs a reason only when there is doubt.

original: de lta yin dang gnod par dogs pa gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang gnod par dogs pa gtan tshigs 'jug pa'i yan lag gang yin pa de nyid kyis gtan tshigs skyon can du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were the case, then that very thing which is a limb of the engagement of a reason, because of being a doubt, would not be a fault of the reason.

original: des na yul 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs pa'i tshad ma nyid gnod par byed pa yin gyi ma zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na yul 'gog pa'i phyir zhugs pa'i tshad ma nyid gnod par byed pa yin gyi ma zhugs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, the valid cognition that engages in order to refute the object is what undermines, but it is not one that does not engage,

original: the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the domain of the reason is just the doubt.

original: gal te de lta na ni ldog pa la yang zhugs pa'i tshad ma gnod par byed par 'gyur gyi dogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni ldog pa la yang zhugs pa'i tshad ma gnod par byed par 'gyur gyi dogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If that were so, then a valid cognition that engages in the reverse of the probandum would be a refutation, but that is not the case.

original: ma mthong ba tsam la ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma zhugs pa med do zhes dogs pa la bshad pa /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam la ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma zhugs pa med do zhes dogs pa la bshad pa /
translated: There is no valid cognition that engages in the mere nonperception of the probandum.

original: ldog pa ni grub pa kho @273b na nges pa kho na sgrub par byed pa go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa ni grub pa kho @273b na nges pa kho na sgrub par byed pa go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: The reverse of the probandum is established, and the proof is understood in dependence on that.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo grub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i ldog pa ni nges pa la ltos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i ngo bo grub par byed pa'i ngo bo'i ldog pa ni nges pa la ltos so //
translated: Therefore the reverse of the probandum, which is the nature of the proof, depends on ascertainment.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gtan tshigs ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba'i khyad par gyi don gyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ni sgron ma bzhin du rung ba'i khyad par gyi don gyis go bar byed pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: A reason is not a proof that is understood by the meaning of a suitable distinction, like a lamp.

original: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bsgrub par bya ba med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: Rather, it is ascertained to be the nonoccurrence of the probandum.

original: de'i med na mi 'byung bar nges pa nyid lkog tu gyur ba'i don sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i med na mi 'byung bar nges pa nyid lkog tu gyur ba'i don sgrub par byed pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That ascertainment of its nonoccurrence is the proof of a hidden object, but nothing else is.

original: med na mi 'byung ba des na yang ldog pa ma nges pa ci yod /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba des na yang ldog pa ma nges pa ci yod /
translated: If it is not, then what is the uncertainty of the contrapositive?

original: ldog pa la the tshom za na ni 'brel pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: ldog pa la the tshom za na ni 'brel pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur bas /
translated: If there is doubt about the contrapositive, then there is doubt about the relation.

original: 'brel pa nges pa'i bdag nyid go bar byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa nges pa'i bdag nyid go bar byed pa'i dngos por mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the contrapositive would not be a means of knowing that has the nature of a definite relation.

original: des na ldog pa ni nges pa la ltos pa kho na go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pa ni nges pa la ltos pa kho na go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the contrapositive is a means of knowing that depends only on certainty.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par dogs na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma yod par dogs na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If there is doubt about the existence of a countering valid cognition, then the contrapositive is not ascertained.

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi yul yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni the tshom za ba nyid gtan tshigs kyi yul yin te /
translated: The object of the reason is only the doubt about the probandum.

original: nges sam bzlog pa yin na ni de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges sam bzlog pa yin na ni de bsgrub par bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is ascertained or reversed, then it is not the probandum.

original: des na ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i yul la gnod pa yod par dogs na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar bsgrub par bya ba'i yul la gnod pa yod par dogs na /
translated: Thus, if there is doubt about the existence of a countering valid cognition with regard to the object of the probandum,

original: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du ldog pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin pa de bzhin du ldog pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: then the reason is a means of knowing. It is not like that with regard to the contrapositive.

original: lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa ni 'brel pa nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa sgrub pa ni 'brel pa nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The proof of the imperceptible is by the nature of the ascertainment of the relation.

original: 'o na khyod kyi phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod kyang lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba ci ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi phyogs la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod kyang lhag ma dang ldan pa 'khrul par 'gyur ba ci ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: But in your system, even though there is no seeing of the counter-pervasion, how is there the error of having a remainder?

original: mi dmigs pas bltar rung ba'i bsgrub bya med par nges la 'ga' zhig la bltar rung ba'i gtan tshigs med par grub kyang /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas bltar rung ba'i bsgrub bya med par nges la 'ga' zhig la bltar rung ba'i gtan tshigs med par grub kyang /
translated: Non-apprehension ascertains the absence of the perceptible probandum. Although the absence of the perceptible reason is established in some cases,

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba de med pa thams cad la zhes bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la yang gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ldog pa la the tshom za pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa med pa ni bsgrub par bya ba de med pa thams cad la zhes bya ba lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la yang gtan tshigs med par mi 'grub pa'i gtan tshigs kyis ldog pa la the tshom za pa de'i phyir /
translated: the absence of the relation to the probandum is not established in all cases of the absence of the probandum. The reason that the imperceptible object is not established as absent by the absence of the reason is that there is doubt about the counter-pervasion.

original: 'di la ldog pa nges pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ldog pa nges pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no ascertainment of the counter-pervasion in this case.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i don dang 'brel pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no relation to the probandum.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nges pa med pa'i gtan tshigs ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa 'di la yod pas 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs las ldog pa nges pa med pa'i gtan tshigs ni lhag ma dang ldan pa'i 'khrul pa 'di la yod pas 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: The reason that is uncertain because it is reversed from the discordant side is present in this error that has a remainder, so it is an error.

original: ma mthong ba tsam ldog pa nges pa'i rgyu yin na ni ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam ldog pa nges pa'i rgyu yin na ni ldog pa can yang gtan tshigs 'gyur na /
translated: If mere non-seeing were the cause of certainty of reversal, then even a reversed reason would be a reason.

original: de ni slob dpon gyis go byed du bzhed pa ma yin no //üîΩldog pa can gyi gtan @274a * //
analyzed: de ni slob dpon gyis go byed du bzhed pa ma yin no // ldog pa can gyi gtan @274a * //
translated: But that is not accepted by the master as the means of understanding.

original: tshigs de nyid ston pa ni gson po ma shi ba'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
analyzed: tshigs de nyid ston pa ni gson po ma shi ba'i lus 'di ni zhes bya ba ni chos can no //
translated: That very reversed reason is shown by This living body that has not died is the subject.

original: bdag med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba bdag med pa bkag pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa ma yin te zhes bya ba bdag med pa bkag pa ni bsgrub bya'o //
translated: Is not without a self is the negation of non-self, which is the probandum.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par srog la sogs pa ldog pa de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa ma yin par srog la sogs pa ldog pa de ltar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs so //
translated: Because it would follow that life and so on would be reversed in the absence of life and so on is the reason.

original: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni bdag dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig la ma mthong la /
analyzed: srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs 'di ni bdag dang bcas pa 'ga' zhig la ma mthong la /
translated: The reason ‚Äúbecause of possessing life, etc.‚Äù is not seen in anything that has a self.

original: bdag med pa dag la ni ldog pa'i phyir bsgrub bya log pa na log pa'i chos ldog pa can du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag med pa dag la ni ldog pa'i phyir bsgrub bya log pa na log pa'i chos ldog pa can du brjod pa yin no //
translated: But since it is excluded from those that are without a self, it is said to be a reason that excludes what is contrary.

original: 'di ni gal te bdag med pa gson pa'i lus las ma log na srog la sogs pa med pa yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas bkod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gal te bdag med pa gson pa'i lus las ma log na srog la sogs pa med pa yang ldog par mi 'gyur ro zhes thal bar 'gyur ba'i sgo nas bkod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated by way of the consequence that if the absence of a self were not excluded from a living body, the absence of life, etc. would not be excluded either.

original: da ni bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa rnams srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni bum pa la sogs pa bdag med pa rnams srog la sogs pa med pas khyab pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag med pa bum pa la sogs pa zhes smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that pots, etc., which are without a self, are necessarily without life, etc., he says, ‚Äúpots, etc., which are without a self.‚Äù

original: bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa med pas khyab pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa med pa de log na na khyab par bya ba bdag med pa yang ldog pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag med pa spangs nas bdag yodüîΩpa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag med pa gang yin pa de ni srog la sogs pa dang ldan pa med pas khyab pa de'i phyir srog la sogs pa med pa de log na na khyab par bya ba bdag med pa yang ldog pa'i gtan tshigs kyis bdag med pa spangs nas bdag yod pa rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The argument refutes the absence of self and establishes the existence of the self.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i gzhan gyi thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir bshad pa /üîΩbltar mi rung ba de'i mi dmigs pa des med pa ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa dag med par ma grub po //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i gzhan gyi thal bar 'gyur ba spang ba'i phyir bshad pa / bltar mi rung ba de'i mi dmigs pa des med pa ma grub na bum pa la sogs pa dag med par ma grub po //
translated: To explain the avoidance of the unwanted consequence of the above argument, it is said:üîΩIf the non-observation of the visible self does not establish its non-existence, then the non-existence of pots and so on is not established.

original: gang gis bum pa la sogs pa la de med par 'gyur ba bdag bltar rung ba ni ma yin no //üîΩbdag med pa de la ma grub pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gis bum pa la sogs pa la de med par 'gyur ba bdag bltar rung ba ni ma yin no // bdag med pa de la ma grub pa'i phyir te /
translated: The self is not visible, and therefore its non-existence is not established.

original: gtan tshigs kyis srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa med do //
analyzed: gtan tshigs kyis srog la sogs pa bdag med pa las ldog pa med do //
translated: Since the self is not established for the opponent, the argument does not refute the absence of self in life and so on.

original: srog la sogs pa ldog pas bdag med pa the tshom za ba de la khyab pa ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa ldog pas bdag med pa the tshom za ba de la khyab pa ma grub po zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Since the existence of life-force and so on is refuted, the pervasion is not established for one who doubts selflessness.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa ldog pa bdag khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang srog la sogs pa ldog pa bdag khyab par bya ba dang / khyab par byed pa'i dngos po grub na thal ba 'dir 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the existence of the pervaded and the pervader were established, then this consequence would apply: ‚ÄúSince selflessness and the refutation of life-force and so on pervade self, the pervasion is not established.‚Äù

original: de dag ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por ma grub ste bdag med pa nyid ni the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / the tshom za ba yang bdag bltar rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos por ma grub ste bdag med pa nyid ni the tshom za ba'i phyir dang / the tshom za ba yang bdag bltar rung ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But they are not established as the pervaded and the pervader because selflessness itself is doubted and doubt is not suitable to be seen as self.

original: 'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par khyed kyis khas blangs @274b pa yin pas de nyid kyis de 'grub po snyam na /
analyzed: 'di snyam du bum pa la sogs pa ni bdag med par khyed kyis khas blangs @274b pa yin pas de nyid kyis de 'grub po snyam na /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúSince you accept that pots and so on are selfless, that alone establishes them,‚Äù

original: da ni ji ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni ji ltar zhes smos so //
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says, ‚ÄúNow, how?‚Äù

original: gal te nged kyis khas blangs pas bdag med par 'dod na /
analyzed: gal te nged kyis khas blangs pas bdag med par 'dod na /
translated: If we assert selflessness because of our acceptance,

original: de lta ni 'o na nged cag gis thams cad bdag med par 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta ni 'o na nged cag gis thams cad bdag med par 'dod pa'i phyir ji ltar bdag 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If that is so, then since we assert that everything is selfless, how could the self be established?

original: gal te gson po'i lus 'di ni gzhan gyis bdag med par khas blangs pa de lta na yang de tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du bdag bsgrub pa yin zhe na /
