analyzed: gal te gson po'i lus 'di ni gzhan gyis bdag med par khas blangs pa de lta na yang de tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin pa nyid pas de'i don du bdag bsgrub pa yin zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúAlthough this living body is accepted by others to be selfless, it is not valid cognition, so we establish the self for that purpose,‚Äù

original: gson po'i lus las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par phyir rgol ba la grub pa yang tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gson po'i lus las gzhan bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par phyir rgol ba la grub pa yang tshad ma dang ldan pa ma yin no //
translated: then the opponent‚Äôs establishment that the pot and so on, which are other than the living body, are selfless is also not valid cognition.

original: 'di ltar bdag med pa'i phyir rgol ba'i khas blangs pas 'grub pa mi rigs pas grub kyang bla ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag med pa'i phyir rgol ba'i khas blangs pas 'grub pa mi rigs pas grub kyang bla ste /
translated: Since it is illogical to establish something as selfless by the assertion of the opponent, it is fine if it is established.

original: rnam pa thams cad du phyir rgol ba ni bdag med pa dang dngos po thams cad kyi yul can du 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du phyir rgol ba ni bdag med pa dang dngos po thams cad kyi yul can du 'dod pa yin no //
translated: In every way, the opponent asserts that the object of the self is selfless and all things.

original: de la gson po'i lus la bdag med pa tshad ma can ma yin par smra ba ni /
analyzed: de la gson po'i lus la bdag med pa tshad ma can ma yin par smra ba ni /
translated: In that regard, the statement that the living body is selfless and not valid cognitionüîΩis illogical.

original: de'i khas blangs pa dang rigs pa yang tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i khas blangs pa dang rigs pa yang tshad ma ma yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: And the assertion and reasoning are not valid cognitions.

original: de ltar khas blangs pa 'am rigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid las bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ci ltar rjod par byed /
analyzed: de ltar khas blangs pa 'am rigs pa tshad ma ma yin pa de nyid las bum pa la sogs pa bdag med par ci ltar rjod par byed /
translated: In that case, how can you say that a pot, etc. are selfless?

original: de'i phyir bdag med par ni srog la sogs pa med pas ma khyab po /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med par ni srog la sogs pa med pas ma khyab po /
translated: Therefore, the absence of life, etc. does not entail selflessness.

original: gzhan yang khas blangs pa 'ba' zhig gis bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa ngag rnam par phye nas bum pa la sogs pa gzhan nam bdag gis bdag med par khas blangs pa des na bdag med pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan yang khas blangs pa 'ba' zhig gis bdag dang bcas pa dang bdag med pa ngag rnam par phye nas bum pa la sogs pa gzhan nam bdag gis bdag med par khas blangs pa des na bdag med pa yin la /
translated: Moreover, having distinguished the self-possessing and the self-less by mere assertion, if you assert that a pot, etc. are selfless, then they are selfless.

original: gson po'i lus la kho bo cag gis bdag med par khas blangs pa ste /
analyzed: gson po'i lus la kho bo cag gis bdag med par khas blangs pa ste /
translated: But we assert that the living body is not selfless.

original: de'i phyir bdag med pa ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas bdag gi rtogs par byed pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag med pa ma yin no zhes de ltar rnam par phye nas bdag med pa de la srog la sogs pa med pas bdag gi rtogs par byed pa nyid du'o //
translated: Therefore, it is not selfless. Having distinguished in this way, since life, etc. do not exist in selflessness, you should understand that the self is the apprehender.

original: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa dag las log pas bdag dang bcas pas khyad par khas len par byed pas ni khyab pa lung gis grub par brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srog la sogs pa bdag med pa dag las log pas bdag dang bcas pas khyad par khas len par byed pas ni khyab pa lung gis grub par brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since you accept that the self is distinguished from the selflessness of life force and so on, you are saying that the self is established by scripture.

original: de las kyang bdag grub pa'i phyir bdag kyang lung gis grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang bdag grub pa'i phyir bdag kyang lung gis grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: And since the self is established from that, the self is also established by scripture.

original: des na khyab pa'i yul khas blangs pas grub pa'i phyir khyab pa med do //
analyzed: des na khyab pa'i yul khas blangs pas grub pa'i phyir khyab pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since the pervasion is established by the acceptance of the subject, there is no pervasion.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa yin na ni srog la sogs pa bdag med pa la ma mthong ba des na ldog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa yin na ni srog la sogs pa bdag med pa la ma mthong ba des na ldog par 'gyur te /
translated: If the reversal is due to mere nonseeing, then by that nonseeing of the selflessness of life force and so on, there would be a reversal.

original: de'i phyir 'di go bar byed pa yin @275a * //üîΩpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di go bar byed pa yin @275a * // par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore this would be an invalidation.

original: 'di ni go bar byed par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni go bar byed par 'dod pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not asserted to be an invalidation.

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas go bar byed par 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas go bar byed par 'dod do //
translated: Therefore it is asserted that the invalidation is due to the relation of nature alone.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na gang yang ma grub sbyar ba de yang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog na gang yang ma grub sbyar ba de yang zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If the reversal is due to mere nonseeing, then since nothing is established, the statement ‚ÄúThat also‚Äù is applied.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba nas brjod par bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni ma grub sbyor ba'i ngag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba nas brjod par bya ba'i mthar thug pa ni ma grub sbyor ba'i ngag yin no //
translated: Similarly, up to the final expression of the probandum is the statement of the unestablished reason.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnyi ga dang gang yang rung ba dang the tshom za ba dang zhi ma grub pa bzhi bstan nas phyogs kyi chos dgu la bsgre ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos la gnyi ga dang gang yang rung ba dang the tshom za ba dang zhi ma grub pa bzhi bstan nas phyogs kyi chos dgu la bsgre ba'i phyir de bzhin du zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: Having taught the four types of unestablished reasons with respect to the property of the subject, the two, either one, and doubt, he says similarly in order to extend that to the nine types of property of the subject.

original: ji ltar bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi bshad pa /
translated: Just as the four types of unestablished reasons with respect to the property of the subject have been explained,

original: de bzhin du phyogs kyi chos bshad pa /
analyzed: de bzhin du phyogs kyi chos bshad pa /
translated: so the property of the subject is explained.

original: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mthun pa'i phyogs la yod pa dang med pa zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa gang yin pa de la yang mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhir brjod par bya ste /
translated: With respect to that, whatever is stated as existing or not existing in the similar class and so on, there are four types of unestablished reasons with respect to the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs sam gzhan gang la ma grub pa gang rigs pa de ni de la brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs sam gzhan gang la ma grub pa gang rigs pa de ni de la brjod par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is not established in the similar class or the dissimilar class should be stated as such.

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ldog par bzhed na ni bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhir bshad nas /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis ldog par bzhed na ni bsgrub bya'i chos can la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhir bshad nas /
translated: If you accept that the reason for the reversal is merely non-observation, then the four types of non-establishment with regard to the subject of the probandum are explained.

original: mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yul can phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu la bsgres shing skye ba'i ma grub sbyar ba 'di ni brjod bya min par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthun pa'i phyogs mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi yul can phyogs kyi chos rnam pa dgu la bsgres shing skye ba'i ma grub sbyar ba 'di ni brjod bya min par 'gyur ro //
translated: The application of the nine types of property of the subject to the domain of the similar and dissimilar classes, and the application of the non-establishment of the origin, would be inexpressible.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dmigs pa kho nar zad na the tshom za ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is doubt only in the case of non-observation.

original: de ga las she na bshad pa /
analyzed: de ga las she na bshad pa /
translated: Why is that? It is said:

original: dmigs na the tshom de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs na the tshom de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no doubt when there is observation.

original: 'ga' zhig tu dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa las chos kyi rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig tu dmigs pa dang mi dmigs pa las chos kyi rnam pa gzhan ni med do //
translated: There is no other type of phenomenon apart from observation and non-observation.

original: de la dmigs pa la ni nges pa nyid yin gyi the tshom ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa la ni nges pa nyid yin gyi the tshom ni ma yin no //
translated: In that case, observation is itself ascertainment, not doubt.

original: lhag mar gyur pas mi dmigs pa nyid las the tshom yin la ldog pa yang de nyid las yin no //
analyzed: lhag mar gyur pas mi dmigs pa nyid las the tshom yin la ldog pa yang de nyid las yin no //
translated: The remainder, which is doubt from non-observation alone, is also the reversal.

original: gal te ma dmigs pa nyid las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin mod /
analyzed: gal te ma dmigs pa nyid las ldog pa la the tshom za ba yin mod /
translated: If you doubt the reversal of non-observation,

original: de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ci ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how could that be?

original: gtan tshigs des na the tshom du gyur pa ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na the tshom du gyur pa ma bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of that reason, doubt would not be reversed.

original: mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: mi dmigs pas ldog pa grub pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because reversal is established by non-observation,

original: ldog pa grub pa nyid ni go bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: ldog pa grub pa nyid ni go bar byed pa yin te /
translated: and the establishment of reversal is the proof,

original: de'i phyir gang gis go bar byed pa las bzlog par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gis go bar byed pa las bzlog par bya ba yin la /
translated: therefore, by what is the proof, the reversal is to be done?

original: the tshom du gyur pa yang zlog par 'gyur ba ma grub pa sbyar ba de nyid mi bya bar 'gyur @275b ro ;
analyzed: the tshom du gyur pa yang zlog par 'gyur ba ma grub pa sbyar ba de nyid mi bya bar 'gyur @275b ro ;
translated: And also the doubt would be reversed. That which is not established should not be applied.

original: /'di snyam du ci rigs par zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni smos pa'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma bzlog pa kho na ste /
analyzed: /'di snyam du ci rigs par zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni smos pa'i phyir ldog pa la the tshom za ba ma bzlog pa kho na ste /
translated: If you think: The word ‚Äúas appropriate‚Äù is used for the sake of mentioning that the reversal of doubt is not reversed.

original: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi po 'grigs pa de la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: mthun pa dang mi mthun pa'i phyogs dag las gang la ma grub pa rnam pa bzhi po 'grigs pa de la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The meaning is that the four types of non-establishment should be applied to the similar and dissimilar classes as appropriate.

original: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon du brjod ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ba'i ma grub pa ni gtan tshigs kyi skyon du brjod ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the fault of a reason is not said to be a nonestablishment that is a doubt about the discordant side.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir ma yin te zhes smos so //
translated: To refute this, the text says, ‚ÄúIt is not because of that.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang zhig gnyi ga la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa de kho na bsgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zhig gnyi ga la zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig gnyi ga la nges par brjod pa de kho na bsgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi /
translated: Because it says, ‚ÄúThat which is ascertained for both,‚Äù and so on.üîΩThe master says that that which is expressed as ascertained for both is either a proof or a refutation.

original: gang yang rung ba la grub ba dang the tshom za ba brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs te /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba la grub ba dang the tshom za ba brjod pa ni ma yin no zhes slob dpon gyis gsungs te /
translated: That which is expressed as established or as a doubt for either is not.

original: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la nges pa'i don brjod pa'i sgra gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la sgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi gang yang rung ba la grub pa dang the tshom za ba brjod paüîΩni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba gnyi ga la nges pa'i don brjod pa'i sgra gang yin pa de nyid gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la sgrub pa 'am sun 'byin pa yin gyi gang yang rung ba la grub pa dang the tshom za ba brjod paüîΩni ma yin no //
translated: The sound that expresses a meaning ascertained for both the proponent and the opponent is either a proof or a refutation in an inference for the sake of others. That which is expressed as established or as a doubt for either is not.

original: 'dir gzhung 'di ni dper brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir gzhung 'di ni dper brjod pa yin te /
translated: Here, this text is an example.

original: gang zhig rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba brjod pa de ni sgrub par byed pa 'am sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang zhig rgol ba dang phyir rgol ba la ma grub pa'am the tshom za ba brjod pa de ni sgrub par byed pa 'am sun 'byin pa ma yin no //
translated: If one states something that is not established or is doubted by the proponent or opponent, that is not a proof or a refutation.

original: ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i chos kyang gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ste /
analyzed: ldog pa la the tshom za ba'i chos kyang gnyi ga mi mthun pa'i phyogs la the tshom za ste /
translated: A property that is doubted in the reverse is also doubted in both the similar and dissimilar classes.

original: de'i phyir de brjod pa sgrub byed ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de brjod pa sgrub byed ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, stating that is not a proof.

original: de yang gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de yang gtan tshigs ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no /
translated: And that is not a reason, this is what is taught.

original: gal te ldog pa la the tshom za yang gtan tshigs yin na 'dir yang de gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs zhe'am gzhan yang rung ste /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa la the tshom za yang gtan tshigs yin na 'dir yang de gtan tshigs su bstan pa'i phyir ci rigs zhe'am gzhan yang rung ste /
translated: If something is a reason even when doubted in the reverse, then since that is taught as a reason here, it is appropriate or else it is something else.

original: de'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir sgra 'ga' zhig sbyor bar 'gyur na sbyar ba med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal ba'i phyir sgra 'ga' zhig sbyor bar 'gyur na sbyar ba med do //
translated: Therefore, because of the exception, some sound would be used in the syllogism, but it is not used.

original: des na gang zhig gzhan du gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa de nyid ci 'dir ci rigs par smos pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs su brjod pa ci ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang zhig gzhan du gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa de nyid ci 'dir ci rigs par smos pa'i sgo nas gtan tshigs su brjod pa ci ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could that which is explained as not being a reason elsewhere be expressed as a reason here by the expression ‚Äúin some cases‚Äù?

original: 'o na ci rigs bar zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci rigs bar zhes ci'i phyir smos she na /
translated: If that is so, why is ‚Äúin some cases‚Äù mentioned?

original: brjod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos kyi gzhi ma grub ba bshad pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ldog pa'i gzhi ma grub par 'ga' zhig rtogs pas de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brjod pa ji ltar bsgrub bya'i chos can la phyogs kyi chos kyi gzhi ma grub ba bshad pa de bzhin du mi mthun pa'i phyogs la yang ldog pa'i gzhi ma grub par 'ga' zhig rtogs pas de bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is mentioned in order to reverse the understanding of some that just as the basis of the property of the subject is not established in the proof of that, so too the basis of the reverse pervasion is not established in the dissimilar class.

original: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod ces gang bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par 'di la gzhi mi 'dod ces gang bshad pa yin te /
translated: It is explained that ‚Äúin some cases, the basis is not asserted.‚Äù

original: dngos po yod na ni gtan tshigs 'jug srid pas ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po yod na ni gtan tshigs 'jug srid pas ldog pa la the tshom za bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the thing exists, since it is possible for the reason to pervade it, there is doubt about the reverse pervasion.

original: med na ni de @276a * //
analyzed: med na ni de @276a * //
translated: If it does not exist,

original: med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ldog pa nges pa yin no //
analyzed: med pas de la mi 'jug pa'i phyir ldog pa nges pa yin no //
translated: then since it does not exist, the reason does not pervade it, and therefore the reverse pervasion is ascertained.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan du gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan du gtan tshigs ma yin par bshad pa /
translated: Since it is explained as not being a reason elsewhere,

original: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa med par dgongs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi dmigs kyang the tshom za bas mi mthun pa'i phyogs las gtan tshigs ldog pa med par dgongs te /
translated: Therefore, although there is no observation, there is doubt, and so the reason does not exclude the discordant side.

original: ma grub pa sbyar bas ldog pa la the tshom za ba de gtan tshigs nyid dgag pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ma grub pa sbyar bas ldog pa la the tshom za ba de gtan tshigs nyid dgag pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: The master has explained that the reason itself is refuted by the application of the unestablished.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi bzhed pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog pa mi bzhed pa gzhan yang bstan pa'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that he does not accept exclusion merely on the ground of non-observation, he says, ‚ÄúNor is audibility.‚Äù

original: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni slob dpon gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges par gsungs so //
analyzed: mnyan par bya ba nyid ni slob dpon gyis thun mong ma yin pa'i ma nges par gsungs so //
translated: The master has stated that audibility is not ascertained as the uncommon reason.

original: gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid med par bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong bas ldog par 'gyur na mnyan par bya ba nyid kyang rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa nyid med par bsgrub pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba yod pa yin te /
translated: If there were exclusion merely on the ground of non-observation, then audibility would be observed in the discordant side in the proof of the absence of permanence or impermanence.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa grub pas go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa grub pas go bar byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, exclusion would be established and the reason would be understood.

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la ma mthong ba'i phyir de las log pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa dang mi rtag pa nyid la ma mthong ba'i phyir de las log pa yin te /
translated: Because permanence and impermanence are not seen, they are excluded from that.

original: de bas na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de dag rnam par gcod pa 'gog pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na rtag pa dang mi rtag pa de dag rnam par gcod pa 'gog pa go bar byed pa'i gtan tshigs su 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of permanence and impermanence is understood as a reason that refutes them.

original: gal te ma mthong ba'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid de de las ldog mod /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba'i phyir mnyan par bya ba nyid de de las ldog mod /
translated: If it is said that audibility is excluded because it is not seen,

original: rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs su go ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be understood as a reason that excludes?

original: rnam par gcod pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: The text says, ‚ÄúExclusion is . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang gang las log pa de'i de las ldog pa gang yin pa de las rnam par gcod pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni med do //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gang las log pa de'i de las ldog pa gang yin pa de las rnam par gcod pa zhes bya ba gzhan ni med do //
translated: Thus, whatever is excluded from something, that is excluded from that. There is nothing else called ‚Äúexclusion.‚Äù

original: ldog pa'i yul de las rnam par gcod pa ni ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: ldog pa'i yul de las rnam par gcod pa ni ldog pa nyid do //
translated: Exclusion from the object of exclusion is exclusion itself.

original: des na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig las ldog pa nges pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po la med par nges pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'ga' zhig 'ga' zhig las ldog pa nges pa gang yin pa de nyid ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi don ldog pa'i chos dang ldan pa'i dngos po la med par nges pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the certainty of the reversal of something from something is the certainty of the absence of a thing that possesses the property of reversal, which is the meaning of the definition of reversal.

original: des na de las ldog pa nyid rnam par gcod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na de las ldog pa nyid rnam par gcod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the reversal of that is the exclusion.

original: 'o na khyod kyi phyogs la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i mnyan par bya ba nyid de dag rnam par gcod par mi byed par ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyod kyi phyogs la rtag pa dang mi rtag pa dag la ma mthong ba'i mnyan par bya ba nyid de dag rnam par gcod par mi byed par ji ltar zhe na /
translated: Now, in your system, how is the audibility that is not seen in either the permanent or the impermanent not made into an exclusion of those?

original: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcod pa ma yin pa ni zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThere is no exclusion.‚Äù

original: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa gang las kyang mnyan bya nyid ldog pa nyid yin par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa'am mi rtag pa gang las kyang mnyan bya nyid ldog pa nyid yin par ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because audibility is not ascertained to be a reversal from either the permanent or the impermanent.

original: ldog par ma nges pa ni gcig dang yang 'brel pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog par ma nges pa ni gcig dang yang 'brel pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the uncertain reversal is not ascertained to be related to either.

original: dngos po'i chos ni 'ga' zhig la 'jug par nges na gzhan las ldog par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos ni 'ga' zhig la 'jug par nges na gzhan las ldog par 'gyur gyi /
translated: When the property of an entity is ascertained to be engaged in something, it is reversed from another.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that it is reversed from another.

original: gal te rnam par gcod par nges pa @276b ldog pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni ldog pa ma nges pas rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par gcod par nges pa @276b ldog pa'i bdag nyid ma yin na ni ldog pa ma nges pas rnam par gcod par mi 'gyur pa yin na /
translated: If the ascertainment of exclusion is not the nature of negation, then since negation is not ascertained, there would be no exclusion.üîΩHow is that?

original: de nyid ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: It is explained:

original: gang zhig yul gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de ni de las ldog par nges pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yul gang la med do zhes bya bar nges pa de ni de las ldog par nges pa yin te /
translated: One who ascertains that something does not exist in a certain place ascertains that it is absent from that place.

original: de ltar nges par 'gyur ba de dngos po 'ga' la yod na ste /
analyzed: de ltar nges par 'gyur ba de dngos po 'ga' la yod na ste /
translated: If that ascertainment occurs in regard to some thing,

original: bdog na ci ltar ga la med par nges pa de med pa go bar mi byed /
analyzed: bdog na ci ltar ga la med par nges pa de med pa go bar mi byed /
translated: then how could one ascertain that it does not exist there? How could one understand that it does not exist?

original: ji ltar gang la med do zhes rtogs pa med par rtogs par mi byed /
analyzed: ji ltar gang la med do zhes rtogs pa med par rtogs par mi byed /
translated: How could one understand that it does not exist without understanding that it does not exist?

original: gal te gzhan rnam par gcod pa go bar mi byed pa de lta na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gzhan rnam par gcod pa go bar mi byed pa de lta na ni ldog pa nges par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one does not understand the exclusion of other, then negation would not be ascertained.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not so.

original: des na gzhan rnam par gcod pa ni ldog pa nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan rnam par gcod pa ni ldog pa nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, the exclusion of other is the ascertainment of negation.

original: ma mthong ba yod kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yod kyang rtag pa dang mi rtag pa gnyi ga rnam par gcod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Although non-perception exists, it does not eliminate both permanence and impermanence.

original: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa gang yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is undermined by another valid cognition.

original: bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: gang du tshad ma'i gnod pa med pa der ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis ldog pa yod pa des na rnam par gcad pa 'grub pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang du tshad ma'i gnod pa med pa der ma mthong ba'i rgyu mtshan gyis ldog pa yod pa des na rnam par gcad pa 'grub pa yin gyi /
translated: Where there is no undermining by valid cognition, there is elimination by the reason of non-perception. Therefore, exclusion is established.

original: ma mthong ba yin yang gang la ldog pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma yod pa der ni ldog pa nges pa 'am /
analyzed: ma mthong ba yin yang gang la ldog pa la gnod pa'i tshad ma yod pa der ni ldog pa nges pa 'am /
translated: But where there is a valid cognition that undermines elimination, even though there is non-perception, there is no ascertainment of elimination.

original: de'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan rnam par bcad ba yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyis gzhan rnam par bcad ba yod pa ma yin la /
translated: Or, by its own nature, there is no exclusion of the other.

original: 'dir yang gnod pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang gnod pa yod pa yin no //
translated: And here, there is undermining.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says,

original: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ni ldog pa'o //
analyzed: phan tshun rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo ni ldog pa'o //
translated: The nature of mutual exclusion is elimination.

original: ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de rnams ni rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa gcig rnam par bcad pas 'gal ba'i chos gzhan grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang la yod pa de rnams ni rtag pa 'am mi rtag pa gcig rnam par bcad pas 'gal ba'i chos gzhan grub pa'i rgyu'i phyir /
translated: Those that have an intrinsic reality are either permanent or impermanent, and the exclusion of one is the cause for establishing the other, a contradictory phenomenon.

original: bsgrubs pa de nyid yang bkag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsgrubs pa de nyid yang bkag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that which is established is not refuted again.

original: mi rtag pa nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa na rtag pa bsgrubs pa yin la /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid rnam par gcod par byed pa na rtag pa bsgrubs pa yin la /
translated: When impermanence is excluded, permanence is established.

original: yang gtan tshigs de nyid rtag pa zlog par byed pas rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs yin na ni gcig nyid gcig la gcig gi tshe bsgrub pa dang dgag pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'ga' yang rnam par bcad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gtan tshigs de nyid rtag pa zlog par byed pas rtag pa rnam par gcod pa'i gtan tshigs yin na ni gcig nyid gcig la gcig gi tshe bsgrub pa dang dgag pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'ga' yang rnam par bcad pa ma yin no //
translated: If that very reason that refutes permanence is a reason that excludes permanence, then when one excludes one, it is contradictory to both establish and refute, and therefore nothing is excluded.

original: bsgrub pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: bsgrub pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
translated: Establishment is the complete abandonment of the intrinsic reality that is to be refuted.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa yongs su spangs pa yin la /
translated: Refutation is the intrinsic reality that is to be abandoned.

original: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa nyid ni dgag pa yin pas 'gal ba de gnyis gcig la cig car ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyams pa nyid ni dgag pa yin pas 'gal ba de gnyis gcig la cig car ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How could those two contradictory actions occur simultaneously in one thing?

original: des na mnyan bya nyid ni 'ga' zhig las kyang ldog par nges pa 'am /
analyzed: des na mnyan bya nyid ni 'ga' zhig las kyang ldog par nges pa 'am /
translated: Therefore, it is certain that the object of hearing is distinguished from something else,

original: de'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa yang ma yin pas go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid rnam par bcad pa yang ma yin pas go bar byed pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: but it is not distinguished from the nature of that, so it is not the cause of understanding.

original: gal te mnyan bya nyid ni nyan pa'i shes pa skyed pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te mnyan bya nyid ni nyan pa'i shes pa skyed pa yin la /
translated: If the object of hearing is the cause of the arising of the consciousness of hearing,

original: @277a * // de yang don byed par nus pa nyid yin pa des na mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dag las ldog pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid go bar byed pa'i rtag pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩci ste mnyan bya nyid ci nyan pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i don byed pa tsam zhig yin nam /
analyzed: @277a * // de yang don byed par nus pa nyid yin pa des na mnyan par bya ba nyid rtag pa dag las ldog pa'i phyir mi rtag pa nyid go bar byed pa'i rtag pa nyid ma yin nam zhe na / ci ste mnyan bya nyid ci nyan pa'i shes pas rtogs pa'i don byed pa tsam zhig yin nam /
translated: and that is the capacity to perform a function, then since the object of hearing is distinguished from permanent things, impermanence is the cause of understanding, not permanence.üîΩIf the object of hearing is merely the cause of the arising of the consciousness of hearing,

original: gal te de lta na ni go bar byed pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni go bar byed pa nyid yin no //
translated: then it is the cause of understanding.

original: 'on kyang de ni thun mong ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni thun mong ba nyid yin te /
translated: But that is common to all.

original: yod pa tsam ni thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa tsam ni thams cad la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because mere existence exists for all.

original: ci ste mnyan pa'i shes pa skyed pa nyid mnyan bya yin na /
analyzed: ci ste mnyan pa'i shes pa skyed pa nyid mnyan bya yin na /
translated: If the cause of the arising of the consciousness of hearing is the object of hearing,üîΩthen the object of hearing is the cause of the arising of the consciousness of hearing.

original: de ni thun mong ma yin pa yin na go bar byed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni thun mong ma yin pa yin na go bar byed par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not shared, then it is not understood.

original: de ni sgra nyid la brten pas gnod par byed pas sgra la khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: de ni sgra nyid la brten pas gnod par byed pas sgra la khyab pa bsgrub par bya ba yin na /
translated: If it is to be established that sound is pervaded by impermanence, then it is to be established that sound is impermanent.

original: tshad ma gang gis sgra la de mi rtag pas khyab pa bsgrub pa de nyid kyis sgra mi rtag par grub pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid kyis ci bya /
analyzed: tshad ma gang gis sgra la de mi rtag pas khyab pa bsgrub pa de nyid kyis sgra mi rtag par grub pa'i phyir mnyan bya nyid kyis ci bya /
translated: Since that very means of valid knowledge which establishes that sound is pervaded by impermanence establishes that sound is impermanent, what is the use of audibility?

original: 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa thams cad go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni thun mong ma yin pa thams cad go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: This shows that all non-shared reasons are understood.

original: gzhan yang chos can gcig nyid la ni yod pa mi rtag pas khyab pa bstan par mi nus so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzhan yang chos can gcig nyid la ni yod pa mi rtag pas khyab pa bstan par mi nus so zhes sngar bshad zin to //
translated: Moreover, it was previously explained that it is not possible to demonstrate that existence is pervaded by impermanence in regard to a single subject.

original: 'o na ni nges pa'i yul can gyi yod pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa mi 'grub pa de bzhin du brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyang ma khyab par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni nges pa'i yul can gyi yod pa nyid mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa mi 'grub pa de bzhin du brtsal ma thag tu 'byung ba nyid kyang ma khyab par 'gyur te /
translated: Well, just as the establishment of the pervasion of existence by impermanence by means of a definite object is not established, so also the pervasion by immediacy is not established,

original: nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is a definite object.

original: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid yod pa'i rang bzhin nye bar bzung nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa bsgrub par ni mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: brtsal ma thag tu byung ba nyid yod pa'i rang bzhin nye bar bzung nas mi rtag pa nyid kyis khyab pa bsgrub par ni mi brjod kyi /
translated: But we do not say that impermanence is established as pervading that which exists by the mere fact that it occurs as soon as it is sought.

original: 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtsol ba'i 'bras bu nyid do //
translated: Rather, it is the effect of effort.

original: de yang rtsol ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pas khyab pa yin gyi yod pa tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang rtsol ba'i rjes su 'gro ldog gi rjes su byed pa'i phyir de dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba mi rtag pas khyab pa yin gyi yod pa tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: And since that is something that follows after and conforms to effort, it is related to that, and so is pervaded by impermanence, but not by mere existence.

original: rtsol ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rtsol ba dang 'brel pa nyid ni yod pa las tha dad pa ma yin te /
translated: Being related to effort is not different from existence.

original: des na rang bzhin yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin yin pas skyon med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is a nature, there is no error.

original: ma mthong bas kyang ldog pa ma yin na /
analyzed: ma mthong bas kyang ldog pa ma yin na /
translated: If it is not reversed by not being seen,

original: 'o na da ni mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na da ni mi dmigs pa tshad ma ma yin te /
translated: then nonobservation is not a valid means of knowledge,

original: tshad mas gnod par srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad mas gnod par srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that it is undermined by valid knowledge.

original: ma mthong ba ldog pa sgrub pa ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma mthong ba ldog pa sgrub pa ni tshad mas gnod pa nyid do //
translated: Establishing that it is reversed by not being seen is undermined by valid knowledge.

original: 'di ltar gnod pa mthong ba'i ma mthong ba las gzhan gnod pa mthong ba chad ma nyid du 'dod pa'i ma mthong ba la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gnod pa mthong ba'i ma mthong ba las gzhan gnod pa mthong ba chad ma nyid du 'dod pa'i ma mthong ba la yang tshad ma gzhan gyis gnod pa srid de /
translated: Thus, the non-perception of the object of refutation by a valid cognition is not the means of understanding the non-existence of the object of refutation.

original: des de ltar ma mthong ba de la gnod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur srid pa yin no //
analyzed: des de ltar ma mthong ba de la gnod pa de bzhin du 'di la yang 'gyur srid pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the non-perception of the object of refutation by a valid cognition is not the means of understanding the non-existence of the object of refutation.

original: ji ltar na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ma zhugs kyang dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma ma zhugs kyang dogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be doubt even when a valid cognition that contradicts does not occur?

original: go bar byed @277b pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na /
analyzed: go bar byed @277b pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa la gnod pa srid na /
translated: If it is possible that there is contradiction of the definition that possesses the characteristic of the understood,

original: de'i zhes bya ba go bar byed pa'i'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba go bar byed pa'i'o //
translated: then the definition is not established.

original: de tsam gyis mtshan nyid la gnod par byas na mtshon bya mtshon par mi nus te des na sun phyung bar brjod pa yin te mtshon par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyis mtshan nyid la gnod par byas na mtshon bya mtshon par mi nus te des na sun phyung bar brjod pa yin te mtshon par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the definition is contradicted by that much, the definiendum cannot be indicated, and therefore it is said to be refuted, because it is not indicated.

original: gang gi phyir yul gcig nyid la mtshan nyid de mtshon byed ma yin pas na de'i phyir ldog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa snga ma la yang yid brtan du med de yid mi ches so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul gcig nyid la mtshan nyid de mtshon byed ma yin pas na de'i phyir ldog pa bsgrub pa'i phyir mi dmigs pa snga ma la yang yid brtan du med de yid mi ches so //
translated: Since that characteristic is not the indicator of just one object, therefore, in order to establish the exclusion, the former non-apprehension is also unreliable, i.e., not credible.

original: go bar byed pa ma yin par nges so zhes bya ba'i don te //
analyzed: go bar byed pa ma yin par nges so zhes bya ba'i don te //
translated: It is ascertained that it is not the indicator. This is the meaning.

original: gal te de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i yul la mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brtan du med pa rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: gal te de ltar na rjes su dpag pa'i rtogs par bya ba'i yul la mngon sum dang / rjes su dpag pa dang 'gal ba mthong bas yid brtan du med pa rjes su dpag pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: If that is so, then, in the case of the object to be understood by inference, since direct perception and inference are seen to contradict each other, they are unreliable. Inference is also the same.

original: 'di ltar smin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di ltar smin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus, in the case of what is called ‚Äúripe,‚Äù

original: yal ga gcig las skyes pa dang // gzugs khyad par med pa tshul gsum dang ldan pa yin yang mngon sum gyis ma smin par myong ba dang ji ltar sngo bsangs yin te /
analyzed: yal ga gcig las skyes pa dang // gzugs khyad par med pa tshul gsum dang ldan pa yin yang mngon sum gyis ma smin par myong ba dang ji ltar sngo bsangs yin te /
translated: even though it has three modes, i.e., is produced from one branch and has no difference in form, direct perception does not experience it as ripe. How is it that it is blue?

original: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: de'i bu yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la ;
translated: In the case of ‚ÄúHe is the son because he is the son of that person,‚Äù

original: de'i bu nyid tshul gsum pa yin yang sngo bsangs nyid mngon sum nyid kyis gnod pa lta bu 'am /üîΩdper na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i byed pa nyid sgra rtag ste /
analyzed: de'i bu nyid tshul gsum pa yin yang sngo bsangs nyid mngon sum nyid kyis gnod pa lta bu 'am / dper na mi rtag pa nyid bsgrub pa la tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i byed pa nyid sgra rtag ste /
translated: For example, the son of that man is a man, but his blueness is undermined by direct perception.

original: mnyan bya'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i mnyan bya nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gnod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mnyan bya'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tshul gsum dang ldan pa'i mnyan bya nyid kyis gnod pa'i phyir rjes su dpag pa gnod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: For example, in the proof of sound as impermanent, the property of the subject, ‚Äúbeing an object of hearing,‚Äù is undermined by the property of the subject, ‚Äúbeing permanent,‚Äù which is related to the three modes.üîΩTherefore, the inference is undermined.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa de ltar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir bshad pa de ltar ni ma yin te /
translated: To refute this, it is explained: ‚ÄúIt is not like that.‚Äù

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa mi srid do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bu zhes bya ba bshad zin pa'i mtshan nyid can gyi rjes su dpag pa de'i bdag nyid dang de las byung ba'i 'brel pa dang ldan pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa mi srid do //
translated: The inference that has the characteristics explained above, that is, the relation of identity and causality, cannot be undermined by direct perception or inference.

original: de'i bu nyid dang yal ga gcig las skyes pa ni bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i bu nyid dang yal ga gcig las skyes pa ni bsgrub bya dang 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Being the son of that man and being produced from the same branch have no relation to the probandum.

original: byas pa ni bsgrub bya dang 'brel ba'i phyir gnod bya ma yin la /
analyzed: byas pa ni bsgrub bya dang 'brel ba'i phyir gnod bya ma yin la /
translated: Since the object of the act is related to the act, the object of the act is not the object of harm.

original: mnyan bya nyid ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir gnod byed ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyan bya nyid ni ma 'brel pa'i phyir gnod byed ma yin no //
translated: And since the object of hearing is not related to the act, it is not the object of harm.

original: gal te rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med na /
analyzed: gal te rjes su dpag pa la mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pas gnod pa med na /
translated: If there were no harm to inference by direct perception and inference,

original: tshul gsum pa'i rtags tshul gsum par mtshungs pa nyid kyis gnod pa ston pa na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can brjod pa de mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: tshul gsum pa'i rtags tshul gsum par mtshungs pa nyid kyis gnod pa ston pa na 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can brjod pa de mi 'thad par 'gyur ro zhe na bshad pa /
translated: then it would be untenable to demonstrate harm by the mere similarity of the three modes of the reason to the three modes of the subject, and to state that it is nonerroneously contradictory.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa nyid do //üîΩkho bo @278a * //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med do zhes bya ba 'di ni 'dod pa nyid do // kho bo @278a * //
translated: We accept that there is no nonerroneously contradictory statement whatsoever in the domain of inference.

original: 'ba' zhig 'dod par ma zad kyi slob dpon yang bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: 'ba' zhig 'dod par ma zad kyi slob dpon yang bzhed pa yin te /
translated: Not only do we accept this, but the master also accepts it,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la de ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul la de ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he does not state that in the domain of inference.

original: yul gang la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can /
analyzed: yul gang la 'gal ba 'khrul pa med pa can /
translated: In the domain of what object is there a nonerroneously contradictory statement?

original: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa 'di'i yul de ni le'u gsum par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gsungs pa 'di'i yul de ni le'u gsum par bstan par bya'o //
translated: The master says that the object of this will be taught in chapter three.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ldog par slob dpon bzhed pa ma yin no zhes yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ni ldog par slob dpon bzhed pa ma yin no zhes yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: The master does not accept that one should desist merely from not seeing. In order to demonstrate this again, he says:

original: slob dpon gyis gang yang bshad pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis gang yang bshad pa'o //
translated: The master also says that.

original: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni gzhung gi ngo bo bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni gzhung gi ngo bo bstan pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to whatever is taught in the treatise.

original: de nyid ston pa na gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ston pa na gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: When he demonstrates that, he says, ‚ÄúIf it is merely not seen. . . . ‚Äù

original: 'dir bye brag pas rlung yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir shing dang rtsva med pa'i mya ngam gyi phyogs su grang ba ma yin /üîΩdro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa de ni yon tan yin las /
analyzed: 'dir bye brag pas rlung yod par bsgrub pa'i phyir shing dang rtsva med pa'i mya ngam gyi phyogs su grang ba ma yin / dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa'i khyad par dmigs pa de ni yon tan yin las /
translated: Here the Vai≈õe·π£ika proves that wind exists because a special kind of contact that is neither hot nor cold is observed in a desert region where there are no trees or grass.üîΩThat is a quality of a substance that is its support.

original: de'i rten rdzas yin dgongs na des la sogs pa mthong ba rnams kyi yon tan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rten rdzas yin dgongs na des la sogs pa mthong ba rnams kyi yon tan ni ma yin no //
translated: The Vai≈õe·π£ika thinks that the substance that is its support is wind. The master says that the quality of those that are seen, such as sound, is not that.

original: des na yon tan 'di ni rlung gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa la /
analyzed: des na yon tan 'di ni rlung gi yin par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa la /
translated: Therefore, this quality belongs to the wind.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis sa la sogs pa rnam snang zer ba dag la mthong bas 'di de dag gi yon tan ma yin du chug kyang mi snang ba rnams kyi go ji ltar ma yin gyi /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis sa la sogs pa rnam snang zer ba dag la mthong bas 'di de dag gi yon tan ma yin du chug kyang mi snang ba rnams kyi go ji ltar ma yin gyi /
translated: The master says that if the earth and so on are said to be Vairocana, since they are seen, it may be that they are not his qualities, but how could they not be the qualities of the invisible ones?

original: de la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause they are not seen, they are not the qualities of those,‚Äù

original: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi snang ba dag las reg pa'i khyad par 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te ma mthong ba tsam gyis mi snang ba dag las reg pa'i khyad par 'gog par byed na de yang rigs pa ma yin no zhes gsungs te /
translated: if you refute the difference of contact with the invisible ones merely because they are not seen, that is illogical.

original: sa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bltar mi rung ba mi snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa mi dmigs pa la dmigs pa med pa gang yin pa de ni bltar mi rung ba mi snang ba yin te /
translated: The nonobservation of the earth and so on is the nonobservation of the unobservable, which is invisible.

original: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa tsam yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta ma yin pa de'i phyir mi dmigs pa tsam yin no //
translated: Because it is not like that, it is merely nonobservation.

original: des na dgag pa gang yin de mi rigs so zhes de ltar slob dpon gyis brgal zhing brtags pa ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi dgag pa de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin /
analyzed: des na dgag pa gang yin de mi rigs so zhes de ltar slob dpon gyis brgal zhing brtags pa ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi dgag pa de ji ltar rigs pa ma yin /
translated: In this way, the master has argued that it is illogical to refute something based on the mere non-observation of a reason.

original: gang gi phyir khyed la mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir khyed la mi dmigs pa tsam gyis gtan tshigs kyi ldog pa grub pa yin la /
translated: Why is it that for you, the mere non-observation establishes the negation of the reason?

original: grub pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: grub pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir rigs pa kho nar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because that established reason alone is logical,

original: mi rigs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi rigs par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: it is not illogical.

original: des na ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas na /
analyzed: des na ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan gyis dgag par rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pas na /
translated: Therefore, it is explained that it is illogical to refute something based on the mere non-observation of a reason.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan las slob dpon ldog par bzhed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyi rgyu mtshan las slob dpon ldog par bzhed pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the master does not accept a negation based on the mere non-observation of a reason.

original: de ltar slob dpon gyi dgongs pa bsgrubs nas ma mthong ba tsam gyi zhes bshad pa gang yin ba de brtag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar slob dpon gyi dgongs pa bsgrubs nas ma mthong ba tsam gyi zhes bshad pa gang yin ba de brtag pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus established the master's intention, in order to examine what was explained as mere non-observation,

original: reg pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: reg pa zhes smos te /
translated: he says contact.

original: @278b dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni yul te der gyur pa'i rgyu de'i phyir reg pa dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: @278b dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid ni yul te der gyur pa'i rgyu de'i phyir reg pa dgag par rigs pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: The characteristic of the objective support is the object. Since it is the cause of that, is it not reasonable to refute contact?

original: reg pa tha mal pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: reg pa tha mal pa ni dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that ordinary contact is the objective support,

original: cig shos kyis dgag pa smras pa ni /
analyzed: cig shos kyis dgag pa smras pa ni /
translated: the other party‚Äôs refutation is stated:

original: rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is unreasonable.‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni snang ba'o //üîΩde'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni snang ba'o // de'i rang bzhin gang la yod pa de ni de'i rang bzhin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to light.üîΩThat which has the nature of that is ‚Äúof the nature of that.‚Äù

original: de'i rang bzhin gyi yul de gang la yod pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyi yul na yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin gyi yul de gang la yod pa ni de'i rang bzhin gyi yul na yod pa ste /
translated: That which has the nature of that as its object is ‚Äúhaving the nature of that as its object.‚Äù

original: snang ba'ang yin la de'i rang bzhin gyi yul na yod pa'ang yin pas so //
analyzed: snang ba'ang yin la de'i rang bzhin gyi yul na yod pa'ang yin pas so //
translated: It is light and it has the nature of that as its object.

original: de nyid ni de tsam ste de ni 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid ni de tsam ste de ni 'gog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is just that, because it is not refuted.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Non-appearance is non-apprehension, and it is twofold:

original: shin tu bltar mi rung ba gang yin pa dang / bltar rung ba mi snang ba'i yul can gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: shin tu bltar mi rung ba gang yin pa dang / bltar rung ba mi snang ba'i yul can gang yin pa ste /
translated: that which is extremely unobservable and that which is observable but has an unobservable object.

original: dper na snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul la sha za lta bu 'am /
analyzed: dper na snang ba dang mi snang ba'i yul la sha za lta bu 'am /
translated: For example, it is like a ghost in a visible or invisible place,

original: mi snang ba'i yul du bum pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mi snang ba'i yul du bum pa bzhin no //
translated: or like a pot in an invisible place.

original: de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pas bltar rung ba 'gog par byed pas ni sa phyogs la sogs pa snang ba la snang ba la snang ba dgag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir snang ba mi dmigs pas bltar rung ba 'gog par byed pas ni sa phyogs la sogs pa snang ba la snang ba la snang ba dgag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the non-apprehension of appearance refutes the suitability of seeing, it is the appearance of the place, etc. that is to be refuted in regard to appearance.

original: bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang ba'i spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
analyzed: bye brag pa des ni sa la sogs pa snang ba dang mi snang ba'i spyir bzung nas dgag pa smras so //
translated: But the Vaise~ika, taking the general as both visible and invisible, speaks of a refutation.

original: de la mi snang ba'i yul du ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la mi snang ba'i yul du ni ma mthong ba tsam gyis dgag pa 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, in regard to an invisible place, this refutation is not reasonable, merely on the ground of non-perception.

original: gal te sngon po ser po las log pa'i rang bzhin dang / shes pa ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa dang ; me mi dro ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba de ltar ma mthong ba yang tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sngon po ser po las log pa'i rang bzhin dang / shes pa ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa dang ; me mi dro ba las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin du mthong ba de ltar ma mthong ba yang tha snyad byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: If the nature of blue is seen as the opposite of yellow, the nature of non-understanding as the opposite of understanding, and the nature of fire as the opposite of non-heat, then is not the non-seeing of that also conventionally expressed?

original: sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba dag ni ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las log pa yin gyi ma mthong ba ni rnam pa gzhan du yang srid do zhes ni dogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba dag ni ser po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin las log pa yin gyi ma mthong ba ni rnam pa gzhan du yang srid do zhes ni dogs pa ma yin no //
translated: When one sees blue and so on, one sees them as the opposite of the nature of yellow and so on, but it is not suspected that one does not see them as another aspect.

original: de bzhin dus la sogs pa snang ba la rig pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba des na /
analyzed: de bzhin dus la sogs pa snang ba la rig pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba des na /
translated: In the same way, when one sees time and so on, one sees them as the opposite of the nature of consciousness.

original: ci ltar sa la sogs pa snang ba dag de'i rang bzhin dang bral pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba yang yin no //
analyzed: ci ltar sa la sogs pa snang ba dag de'i rang bzhin dang bral pa de bzhin du ma mthong ba yang yin no //
translated: Just as the appearance of earth and so on is seen as the opposite of its nature, so too is nonseeing.

original: ci ste 'dir ma mthong ba dag la rnam pa gzhan du rtog na /
analyzed: ci ste 'dir ma mthong ba dag la rnam pa gzhan du rtog na /
translated: But if one imagines that nonseeing has another aspect,

original: 'o na ni nye bar bkod pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang ma mthong ba la rnam pa gzhan du dogs par bya dgos so zhes dogs pa las /
analyzed: 'o na ni nye bar bkod pa'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa yang ma mthong ba la rnam pa gzhan du dogs par bya dgos so zhes dogs pa las /
translated: then one must suspect that consciousness and so on, which are not seen, have another aspect.

original: bshad pa sa la sogs pa'i spyi dang ldan pa de la yang dgag par bya ba grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa yod par gdon mi za bar dogs par 'gyur gyi nges par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bshad pa sa la sogs pa'i spyi dang ldan pa de la yang dgag par bya ba grang ba yang ma yin dro ba yang ma yin pa'i reg pa yod par gdon mi za bar dogs par 'gyur gyi nges par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The reply is: ‚ÄúEven in the case of earth, etc., which are qualified by the universals, there is no doubt that the object of negation, namely, the contact which is neither cold nor hot, exists.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: snang ba'i yul 'ga' zhig las nyid @279a * //
analyzed: snang ba'i yul 'ga' zhig las nyid @279a * //
translated: Even though the universal exists in some visible objects,

original: yin yang mthong ba las gzhan pa'i khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: yin yang mthong ba las gzhan pa'i khyad par srid pa'i phyir ro zhes 'chad pa ni /
translated: it is possible that there is a difference from what is seen.

original: shing bal dang / rdo ba dang / lo ma dang / me tog la sogs pa snang ba dag las nyid de yod kyang /
analyzed: shing bal dang / rdo ba dang / lo ma dang / me tog la sogs pa snang ba dag las nyid de yod kyang /
translated: The explanation is: ‚ÄúEven though the universal exists in visible objects such as cotton, stone, leaf, flower, etc.,

original: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jam pa dang rtsub pa la sogs pa reg pa tha dad pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because a difference in contact, such as softness and roughness, etc., is seen.

original: de bzhin du reg pa'i khyad par gzhan yang sa nyid las ma 'das par lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg pa'i khyad par gzhan yang sa nyid las ma 'das par lkog tu gyur pa'i yul la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, even though the universal exists in the invisible object, earth, etc., it is possible that there is a difference in contact.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: gal te reg pa'i khyad par nyid sa yin na ni mi snang ba yang reg pa gzhan dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te reg pa'i khyad par nyid sa yin na ni mi snang ba yang reg pa gzhan dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If the specific type of contact were earth, then what is not visible would not be associated with another contact.

original: gang gi phyir reg pa'i khyad par la ltos pa reg pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pas rab tu phye ba rang dang mthun pa'i rtog pa skyed par rung ba yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir reg pa'i khyad par la ltos pa reg pa la sogs pa 'dus pa'i bdag nyid can 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pas rab tu phye ba rang dang mthun pa'i rtog pa skyed par rung ba yin te /
translated: But because it is distinguished by the function of apprehending that depends on the specific type of contact, and because it generates a conception that is compatible with it, it is suitable to be earth.

original: des na ji ltar gang zhig sreg pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gang zhig 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pa dang de'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa'i don de ni sa ma yin par 'gyur
analyzed: des na ji ltar gang zhig sreg pa'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa de bzhin du gang zhig 'dzin pa'i bya ba byed pa dang de'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa'i gzung ba ma yin pa'i don de ni sa ma yin par 'gyur
translated: Therefore, just as something is not the object of a conception that has the aspect of burning, in the same way, something is not earth if it is not the object of the function of apprehending and the conception that has its aspect.

original: gyi / reg pa gzhan dang ldan pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gyi / reg pa gzhan dang ldan pas ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not because it is associated with another contact.

original: des na de ltar yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is just as we have explained.

original: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i shing bal la sogs pa'i reg pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mthong ba'i shing bal la sogs pa'i reg pa gzhan dang 'brel pa ni /
translated: The contact of visible objects such as cotton is associated with another contact.

original: sa nyid zlog par byed pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir thams cad la zhes bya ba snang ba dang mi snang ba la ma mthong ba tsam gyis reg pa dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sa nyid zlog par byed pa ma yin pa'i gtan tshigs de'i phyir thams cad la zhes bya ba snang ba dang mi snang ba la ma mthong ba tsam gyis reg pa dgag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The reason is that the very ground itself is not reversed. Therefore, it is not reasonable to negate contact with mere non-perception of what appears and does not appear to all.

original: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni ma mthong ba rnams kyang rnam pa gzhan du srid pa dgag pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la sogs pa ni ma mthong ba rnams kyang rnam pa gzhan du srid pa dgag pa yin te /
translated: Even those not seen, such as consciousness, are negated as other aspects.

original: don 'dzin par byed pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i rtog pa skyed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ni rnam par shes par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'dzin par byed pa dang 'dzin par byed pa'i rtog pa skyed pa'i dngos po gang yin pa ni rnam par shes par brjod pa yin no //
translated: That which is the basis for generating the conception of apprehending an object and the apprehender is called consciousness.

original: des na rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa nyid yin pas de med na shes pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan ni ma rtogs pa las bzlog pa nyid yin pas de med na shes pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the very reason for consciousness is the opposite of non-realization. If that does not exist, it would not be consciousness.

original: de bzhin du dro ba'i reg pa'i me yang rang bzhin du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de bzhin du dro ba'i reg pa'i me yang rang bzhin du mi 'thad do //
translated: Similarly, it is not tenable that heat is fire by nature.

original: de bzhin du kha dog gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngon po nyid ni kha dog gzhan yin par ni 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du kha dog gzhan las ldog pa'i rang bzhin gyi sngon po nyid ni kha dog gzhan yin par ni 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the nature of blue that is the opposite of other colors is just the other colors.

original: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par smra na mngon sum gyis gnod par bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par smra na mngon sum gyis gnod par bstan pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: If you say that the opposite is due to mere non-seeing, we say that is undermined by direct perception.

original: gal te ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan la sogs pa ma brtags par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam @279b gyis te ;
analyzed: gal te ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan la sogs pa ma brtags par mi mthun pa'i phyogs la ma mthong ba tsam @279b gyis te ;
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúHow is it that . . . ,‚Äù it is that without examining other objects and so on, you say that mere non-seeing in the discordant class is the nonobservation of the property of the inferential predicate of the probandum.

original: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas bsgrub bya de la 'brel pa med pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'khrul pa med par khas len no zhe na /
analyzed: mi snang ba mi dmigs pas bsgrub bya de la 'brel pa med pa yang bsgrub par bya ba dang 'khrul pa med par khas len no zhe na /
translated: You accept that mere nonappearance, which is a nonobservation, is related to the probandum and is nonerroneous with respect to the probandum.

original: de'i tshe yul 'ga' zhig na skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba yid 'byung ba bskyed par bska ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan par mthong ba yul dang dus dang 'du byed pa gzhan la gzhan du yang snang ngo
analyzed: de'i tshe yul 'ga' zhig na skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas kha cig ci zhig ltar zhes bya ba yid 'byung ba bskyed par bska ba la sogs pa'i ro dang ldan par mthong ba yul dang dus dang 'du byed pa gzhan la gzhan du yang snang ngo
translated: At that time, in some places, some substances such as myrobalan are seen to have a taste such as sourness. In other places and times, they appear to have a different taste.

original: // phyogs der gzhan du mthong ba ni gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: // phyogs der gzhan du mthong ba ni gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The other, i.e., the other place, is the invalidating factor.

original: dper na sman kha cig dang lo tog la sogs pa zhing khyad par can las ni ro la sogs pa khyad par can yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: dper na sman kha cig dang lo tog la sogs pa zhing khyad par can las ni ro la sogs pa khyad par can yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: For example, certain medicines, when they come from a special place, have a special taste, etc.

original: ro ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ro ni mngar ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Taste is sweet, etc.

original: gang gi tshe zos pa zhu ba na grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa byed par nus pa de'i tshe nus pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zos pa zhu ba na grang ba dang dro ba la sogs pa byed par nus pa de'i tshe nus pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When they are eaten and digested, they have the power to produce cold, heat, etc. At that time, they are called potency.

original: zos te zhu ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i ror gyur pa gang yin pa ni smin par byed pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zos te zhu ba dang mngar ba la sogs pa'i ror gyur pa gang yin pa ni smin par byed pa zhes brjod do //
translated: When they are eaten and digested, they become sweet, etc., in taste. At that time, they are called ripening.

original: zhing gzhan las ni de lta bur 'gyur ba ma yin no //üîΩdper na yul gyi khyad par gyis ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhing gzhan las ni de lta bur 'gyur ba ma yin no // dper na yul gyi khyad par gyis ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa'am /
translated: They do not become like this when they come from another place.üîΩJust as taste, potency, and ripening differ according to the difference in place,

original: khrun dang sboms tha dad pa de bzhin du dus kyi khyad par las kyang yin te /
analyzed: khrun dang sboms tha dad pa de bzhin du dus kyi khyad par las kyang yin te /
translated: so also they differ according to the difference in time.

original: bdag nyid thams cad kyi s'a lu'i myu gyu dbyar gyi tshe gzhan du 'gyur la /
analyzed: bdag nyid thams cad kyi s'a lu'i myu gyu dbyar gyi tshe gzhan du 'gyur la /
translated: The rice sprout of the entire self is different in the summer,

original: dbyid  kyi tshe yang gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dbyid  kyi tshe yang gzhan du 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: and it is different in the winter.

original: de bzhin du legs par bya ba'i bye brag las kyang zhing de la yod pa'i sman yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du legs par bya ba'i bye brag las kyang zhing de la yod pa'i sman yang tha dad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the herbs that grow in that field are different due to the differences in the cultivation.

original: lud btab pa la sogs pa ni zhing legs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: lud btab pa la sogs pa ni zhing legs par byed pa yin la /
translated: The cultivation of the field is the application of fertilizer, etc.

original: 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa ni skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas legs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'o mas bcu ba la sogs pa ni skyu ru ra la sogs pa'i rdzas legs par byed pa yin no //
translated: The cultivation of the substance, such as the myrobalan fruit, is the application of milk, etc.

original: de'i phyir sman la sogs pa dag de ltar yul dang dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sman la sogs pa dag de ltar yul dang dus dang legs par bya ba'i khyad par las tha dad par mthong ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, herbs, etc., are seen to be different due to the differences in place, time, and cultivation.

original: sman ni mtshon pa tsam ste 'bras bu dang ljon shing khyad par can dag la yang de bzhin du blta'o //
analyzed: sman ni mtshon pa tsam ste 'bras bu dang ljon shing khyad par can dag la yang de bzhin du blta'o //
translated: Herbs are merely an illustration; the same should be understood with regard to fruits and special trees.

original: 'di ltar sa'i khyad par las 'bra go skyed pa dang / 'o mas bcus pa'i khyad par las skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu mngar por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa'i khyad par las 'bra go skyed pa dang / 'o mas bcus pa'i khyad par las skyu ru ra'i 'bras bu mngar por 'gyur ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, the same sugarcane, depending on the quality of the soil, produces different results, and the same emblic myrobalan fruit, depending on the quality of the milk in which it is cooked, will have a different taste.

original: 'du byed dang ldan pa'am de dang bral ba'i yul gcig du skyes pa'i sman de yang sman de nyid kyi yul na yod pa'i srog chags gang yin pa yul de ba de rnams kyis de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de'i phyir thams cad du s'a lu dangüîΩskyu ru ra de nyid kyis de lta bu zhes bya ba yul gzhan du mthong ba'i ro la sogs pa dang ldan @280a * //
analyzed: 'du byed dang ldan pa'am de dang bral ba'i yul gcig du skyes pa'i sman de yang sman de nyid kyi yul na yod pa'i srog chags gang yin pa yul de ba de rnams kyis de ltar mthong ba gang yin pa de'i phyir thams cad du s'a lu dang skyu ru ra de nyid kyis de lta bu zhes bya ba yul gzhan du mthong ba'i ro la sogs pa dang ldan @280a * //
translated: The same medicinal herb, when it grows in a place where it is mixed with or separated from other herbs, will be seen by the people of that place to have different properties, depending on the other herbs with which it is mixed.

original: pa yin par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa yin par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the same rice or emblic myrobalan fruit will have the same taste, etc., when seen in another place.

original: 'di skad du s'a lu nyid dam skyu ru ra nyid yin pas ni thams cad du ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa 'dra bar rjes su dpag par mi nus so zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du s'a lu nyid dam skyu ru ra nyid yin pas ni thams cad du ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa 'dra bar rjes su dpag par mi nus so zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, it is not possible to infer that the same rice or emblic myrobalan fruit will have the same taste, potency, and ripening effect everywhere, because it is rice or emblic myrobalan fruit.

original: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
analyzed: gtan tshigs bshad pa /
translated: The reason is stated:

original: ro la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyu'i khyad par gang la srid pa de dag la ni /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa dang 'brel pa'i rgyu'i khyad par gang la srid pa de dag la ni /
translated: But in the case of rice and myrobalan fruit, the special causes related to taste, etc.,

original: ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan gzhan du srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: are possible, because other qualities such as taste, potency, and ripening are possible.

original: khyad par can gyi rgyu'i dbang gis yon tan gzhan srid pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad s'a lu dang skyu ru ra nyid log pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: khyad par can gyi rgyu'i dbang gis yon tan gzhan srid pa gang ji snyed pa de thams cad s'a lu dang skyu ru ra nyid log pa yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: One cannot say that all the other qualities that are possible by the power of the special causes are nonexistent in rice and myrobalan fruit.

original: gang gi phyir don gang byed par mthong ba'i dngos po dang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtog pa ni skyu ru ra zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don gang byed par mthong ba'i dngos po dang de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rtog pa ni skyu ru ra zhes brjod do //
translated: Because when one sees the function of an object, one says ‚Äúmyrobalan fruit‚Äù in accordance with the conception.

original: ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa la yang skyu ru ra'i nye bar sbyor bas ldog par bya ba'i nad la phan pa'i phyir khyad par can gyi don byed pa dang / skyu ru ra'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa skyed par byed par skyu ru ra'i tha snyad kyi yul de ni yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: ro dang nus pa dang smin par byed pa gzhan dang ldan pa la yang skyu ru ra'i nye bar sbyor bas ldog par bya ba'i nad la phan pa'i phyir khyad par can gyi don byed pa dang / skyu ru ra'i rnam pa can gyi rtog pa skyed par byed par skyu ru ra'i tha snyad kyi yul de ni yod pa nyid do //
translated: It is also a special object that performs a function, because the application of the myrobalan cures the illness that is to be cured. And the object of the convention ‚Äúmyrobalan‚Äù is real, because it produces the conception that has the aspect of myrobalan.

original: dper na khyad par gzhan dag la reg pa tha dad pa dang ldan na yang sa nyid dang mig la sogs pa rten tha dad pas byas pa las shes pa nyid dang / bud shing gi khyad par gyis gnas pa la me nyid dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i dbye bas byas pa la sngon po nyid mi ldog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na khyad par gzhan dag la reg pa tha dad pa dang ldan na yang sa nyid dang mig la sogs pa rten tha dad pas byas pa las shes pa nyid dang / bud shing gi khyad par gyis gnas pa la me nyid dang / bee d'u rya la sogs pa'i dbye bas byas pa la sngon po nyid mi ldog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, even though earth, fire, and so on have different contacts with other different attributes, earth is not negated as earth, fire is not negated as fire, and so on, because of the difference in their supports, such as the eye, and so on.
