original: des na khyad par can gyi rtog pa skyed pa la sogs par nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ma log par 'jug pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni rgyu khyad par srid pa la yang 'jug pas na dgag pa ma yin
analyzed: des na khyad par can gyi rtog pa skyed pa la sogs par nus pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan ma log par 'jug pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni rgyu khyad par srid pa la yang 'jug pas na dgag pa ma yin
translated: Therefore, the nature of a cause that is able to generate a specific conception, etc., and the specific feature that engages without negating the reason for a convention, is also engaged in the possibility of a specific cause, and thus is not negated.

original: no // gang la rgyu khyad par med par gyur pa de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
analyzed: no // gang la rgyu khyad par med par gyur pa de'i rang bzhin rjes su dpag tu rung ngo //
translated: The nature of that which becomes without a specific cause is suitable to be inferred.

original: ci lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: ci lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: dper na zhes bya bas ston te tshig gang la byed pa po ma mthong ba yod pa'o //
analyzed: dper na zhes bya bas ston te tshig gang la byed pa po ma mthong ba yod pa'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfor example‚Äù indicates that a statement is made in which an agent is not seen.

original: skyes bu'i 'du byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'du byed pa ni bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: The creation of a person‚Äôs action is what is to be created.

original: de sngon du 'gro ba gang la yod pa'o //
analyzed: de sngon du 'gro ba gang la yod pa'o //
translated: That which precedes it is what exists.

original: skyes bus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for ‚Äúcreated by a person.‚Äù

original: gal te byed pa po mthong ba med kyang de skyes bus byas par gyur pa ci'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te byed pa po mthong ba med kyang de skyes bus byas par gyur pa ci'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If an agent is not seen, why is it that it becomes created by a person?

original: bshad pa / skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas bar 'dod pa mthong ba'i tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa / skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas bar 'dod pa mthong ba'i tshig la khyad par med pa'i phyir te ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: Because there is no difference in the words that are seen as asserted to be created or uncreated by a person.

original: gal te sgra la brten pa'i khyad par smra dka' bzhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i khyad par sngags kyi bdag nyid @280b skyes bus ma byas pa la mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sgra la brten pa'i khyad par smra dka' bzhes bya ba dang / 'bras bu grub pa'i khyad par sngags kyi bdag nyid @280b skyes bus ma byas pa la mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt the difference based on sound, such as the difficulty of speaking, and the difference based on the result, such as the nature of a mantra, seen to be uncreated by a person?

original: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: So how can you say there is no difference?

original: rang bzhin la brten pa dang 'bras bu la brten pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin la brten pa dang 'bras bu la brten pa'i khyad par gyi rnam pa thams cad skyes bu dag gis byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all aspects of the difference based on nature and the difference based on result are created by persons.

original: 'di ltar rig byed kyi bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i yang 'brel par dka' ba nyid brjod dka' ba nyid skyes bus byed par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed kyi bzhin du 'jig rten pa'i yang 'brel par dka' ba nyid brjod dka' ba nyid skyes bus byed par nus pa yin no //
translated: Just as in the case of the Vedas, the difficulty of the connection of worldly knowledge, the difficulty of speaking, and so on can be created by persons.

original: sngags kyi rgyu las 'byung ba'i grub pa yang skyes bus byas pa'i sngags las kyang mthong ste /
analyzed: sngags kyi rgyu las 'byung ba'i grub pa yang skyes bus byas pa'i sngags las kyang mthong ste /
translated: And the result that arises from the cause of a mantra is also seen to arise from a mantra created by a person.

original: des na rang bzhin la brten pa 'am 'bras bu la brten pa de 'dra ba ni khyad par ma yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin la brten pa 'am 'bras bu la brten pa de 'dra ba ni khyad par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, such a basis for the nature or the result is not a distinguishing feature.

original: yi ge'i go rigs dang tshig gi go rims kyang skyes bus byas pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yi ge'i go rigs dang tshig gi go rims kyang skyes bus byas pa las khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The order of the letters and the order of the words are not distinguished from what is created by a person.

original: de'i phyir gang zhig mthong bas skyes bus ma byas par rtogs par 'gyur ba rig byed la skyes bus bya bar mi nus pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang zhig mthong bas skyes bus ma byas par rtogs par 'gyur ba rig byed la skyes bus bya bar mi nus pa'i khyad par ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no distinguishing feature in the Veda that cannot be created by a person, by seeing which one could understand that it is not created by a person.

original: de 'dra ba ni skyes bus byas pa la mthong bas tshig de skyes bus ma byas par ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: de 'dra ba ni skyes bus byas pa la mthong bas tshig de skyes bus ma byas par ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How could one understand that such a statement is not created by a person, since one sees that it is created by a person?

original: gal te de'i khyad par skyes bus byed par mi nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te de'i khyad par skyes bus byed par mi nus pa yin na ni /
translated: If it is the case that its distinguishing feature cannot be created by a person,

original: skyes bus rtsol bas ma bskyed par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bus rtsol bas ma bskyed par rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would be understood that it is not generated by the exertion of a person.

original: gang zhig rgyu gang gis skyed par ni nus pa de ni rgyu mthong ba can yin yang gzhan gyi rgyu can du shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gang zhig rgyu gang gis skyed par ni nus pa de ni rgyu mthong ba can yin yang gzhan gyi rgyu can du shes par 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If something is capable of being generated by a certain cause, then even if one sees its cause, one would understand that it has another cause.

original: skye ba ma mthong ma rgyu med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: skye ba ma mthong ma rgyu med par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: If you do not see arising, it would be causeless.

original: gang zhig bdag nyid thams cad des bskyed pa dang 'dra ba de'i rgyu gzhan nyid yin na ni mthong ba de'i rgyu yang de yin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gang zhig bdag nyid thams cad des bskyed pa dang 'dra ba de'i rgyu gzhan nyid yin na ni mthong ba de'i rgyu yang de yin par thal bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: If another cause were the cause of that which is similar to that which is produced by itself, then it would follow that what is seen would be the cause of that.

original: de rgyu med pa can yin na de yang rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro //üîΩrgyu mtshan med par 'dra ba dag las gcig ni gzhan gyi rgyu can yin la /
analyzed: de rgyu med pa can yin na de yang rgyu med pa can du 'gyur ro // rgyu mtshan med par 'dra ba dag las gcig ni gzhan gyi rgyu can yin la /
translated: Or, if that were causeless, that would also be causeless.üîΩIt is not possible to conceive that one of two similar things, without a reason, is caused by the other,

original: cig shos ni rgyu med pa can nam tha dad pa'i rgyu can du brtag par mi nus te /
analyzed: cig shos ni rgyu med pa can nam tha dad pa'i rgyu can du brtag par mi nus te /
translated: or that the other is causeless or has a different cause,

original: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa dang tha dad pa med pa'i tha snyad 'jig par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the conventions of difference and nondifference would be destroyed.

original: gal te skyes bus ma byas pa mthong ba rnams khyad par med kyang /
analyzed: gal te skyes bus ma byas pa mthong ba rnams khyad par med kyang /
translated: If you say: Although things not made by a person are seen without distinction,

original: tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba rnams la 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: tshad med pa nyid kyi phyir ma mthong ba rnams la 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: because they are immeasurable, it is not so for those not seen.

original: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Then, because there is no distinction, why do you say, ‚Äúbecause there is no distinction‚Äù?

original: bsam pa 'di yin te gal te skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i ngag thams cad ma mthong ba de lta na skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i ngag mthong ba ci snyed pa de thams cad skyes bus byas pa las khyad par med par shes pa yin
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te gal te skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i ngag thams cad ma mthong ba de lta na skyes bus ma byas par 'dod pa'i ngag mthong ba ci snyed pa de thams cad skyes bus byas pa las khyad par med par shes pa yin
translated: The idea is this: if one does not see any speech that is not produced by a person, then one should understand that all speech that is seen to be not produced by a person is not different from that produced by a person.

original: no // de'i phyir ngag gcig la skyes bus ma byas pa las @281a * //
analyzed: no // de'i phyir ngag gcig la skyes bus ma byas pa las @281a * //
translated: Therefore, the fact that one does not see any difference in one instance of speech that is not produced by a person

original: gyur pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gyur pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa thams cad la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: does not mean that it exists in all that is not produced by a person,

original: khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi rgyu tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the cause that is the reason for positing a difference.

original: rgyu ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na de ni gzhan la yang khyad par med do //
analyzed: rgyu ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid yin na de ni gzhan la yang khyad par med do //
translated: If the cause is not produced by a person, then there is no difference in that cause in other cases.

original: de ni gcig la khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin na yang thams cad du khyad par gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni gcig la khyad par gyi rgyu ma yin na yang thams cad du khyad par gyi rgyur mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a cause of difference in one case, then it is not a cause of difference in all cases.

original: des na khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba la yang khyad par med pa rjes su dpag go //
analyzed: des na khyad par gyi rgyu med pa'i phyir ma mthong ba la yang khyad par med pa rjes su dpag go //
translated: Therefore, since there is no special cause, we infer that there is no difference in the unseen.

original: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir dag thams cad skyes bus byas par rjes su dpog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par med pa'i phyir dag thams cad skyes bus byas par rjes su dpog pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because there is no difference, we infer that all scriptures are the work of a person.

original: 'ga' zhig skyes bus ma byas na de dang khyad par med pa thams cad skyes bus ma byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig skyes bus ma byas na de dang khyad par med pa thams cad skyes bus ma byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If some were not the work of a person, then all would not be the work of a person, since there would be no difference between them.

original: gzhung gi tshogs 'dis ni don 'di brjod pa yin te /üîΩrnam pa thams cad mthong ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de dag ni ma mthong ba'i rnam pa yang de dang 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhung gi tshogs 'dis ni don 'di brjod pa yin te / rnam pa thams cad mthong ba'i rdzas gang yin pa de dag ni ma mthong ba'i rnam pa yang de dang 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin gyi /
translated: This collection of texts expresses this meaning:üîΩThose substances that are seen in all aspects can be inferred to be the same in unseen aspects.

original: rnam pa thams cad ma mthong ba skyu ru ra dang sa la sogs pa de dag ni ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad ma mthong ba skyu ru ra dang sa la sogs pa de dag ni ma mthong ba'i rang bzhin mthong ba dang 'dra bar rjes su dpag par mi nus so //
translated: But those that are not seen in all aspects, such as myrobalan plums, earth, and so on, cannot be inferred to be the same in unseen nature as those that are seen.

original: tshig rnams ni skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnams ni skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su mthong ba'i phyir ma mthong ba'i khyad par gang yin pa de brtag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Words are seen to be of two kinds, those made by people and those not made by people. Therefore, the difference that is not seen cannot be examined.

original: gal te de lta na rang gi sems kyi rgyud mthong ba las sems kyi rnam pa thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de lta na rang gi sems kyi rgyud mthong ba las sems kyi rnam pa thams cad shes par 'gyur te /
translated: If that is so, then all aspects of mind are known from seeing the continuum of one‚Äôs own mind.

original: des na ji ltar da ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / dbang po la brten pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa de thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i nus pa dang 'brel pa yin pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su yang yin la /
analyzed: des na ji ltar da ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dang / dbang po la brten pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa de thams cad ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i skyed pa'i nus pa dang 'brel pa yin pa de bzhin du ma 'ongs pa'i gnas skabs su yang yin la /
translated: Therefore, just as the nature of the present, which is based on the faculties and is conceptual, is connected with the capacity to generate desire and so on, so too is the future state.

original: bdag ji lta ba de bzhin du sems dang ldan pa gzhan yang yin no //
analyzed: bdag ji lta ba de bzhin du sems dang ldan pa gzhan yang yin no //
translated: And just as it is for the self, so too is it for others who possess mind.

original: 'dir sems dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan du yang mi srid do //
analyzed: 'dir sems dang 'brel pa'i khyad par ma mthong ba gang yin pa de ni gzhan du yang mi srid do //
translated: Here, the difference that is not seen in relation to mind is not possible elsewhere.

original: des na gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen ba ldog par 'gyur la //
analyzed: des na gang las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen ba ldog par 'gyur la //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the one who is free from attachment and the omniscient one are blocked.

original: sems nyid dang dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa nyid dang / tshig la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / des pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du ci'i phyir rtogs par mi byed ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: sems nyid dang dbang po la sogs pa la brten pa nyid dang / tshig la sogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid kyis sems can thams cad kyi tshe 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa dang / des pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du ci'i phyir rtogs par mi byed ce na bshad pa /
translated: Since the mind itself is the basis of the faculties and so on, and since it is the cause of speech and so on, why do you not accept that all sentient beings possess attachment and so on and that they apprehend the entities of the virtuous and so on?

original: skyes bus ma byas pa las gyur pa'i @281b khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med par brjod kyi /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa las gyur pa'i @281b khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med par brjod kyi /
translated: We say that it is because there is no basis that establishes a distinction that is not created by a person.

original: 'di la ni sgrub pa'i yan lag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la ni sgrub pa'i yan lag yod pa yin te /
translated: But here there is a basis that establishes a distinction.

original: des na ji ltar dag la khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med par de ltar skyes bu dag ni khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dag la khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med par de ltar skyes bu dag ni khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag med pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, just as there is no basis that establishes a distinction in the elements, so there is no basis that establishes a distinction in persons.

original: gang gi phyir de dag la blo la brten pa'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu mi srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag la blo la brten pa'i khyad par gyi skyed par byed pa'i rgyu mi srid pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not impossible for a cause to produce a difference in the mind.

original: 'di la gang zhig blo'i gnas skabs kyis khyad par bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gang zhig blo'i gnas skabs kyis khyad par bskyed par bya ba'i rgyu de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba thams cad mkhyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par sgrub par byed pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Here, the cause that produces the difference in the state of the mind is the same as the cause that establishes the difference in the characteristics of the omniscience of one who is free from passion.

original: de'i phyir blo'i gnas skabs 'dir khyad par gyi rgyu mthong ba las sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir blo'i gnas skabs 'dir khyad par gyi rgyu mthong ba las sems 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i khyad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this state of the mind, the difference in the mind, such as being free from passion, is understood from the perception of the cause of the difference.

original: rgyu'i khyad par med pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par med pa de yang ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is that cause of the difference that is not absent?

original: bshad pa / rgyu'i khyad par med pa gang gis tshig la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / rgyu'i khyad par med pa gang gis tshig la sogs pa ste /
translated: It is said: The cause of the difference that is not absent is the word, etc.

original: sogs ba smos pas ni dbang po la brten pa nyid dang / sems nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs ba smos pas ni dbang po la brten pa nyid dang / sems nyid la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes being based on the sense faculties, being the nature of the mind, etc.

original: phyogs gcig cung zad tsam gyis chos mthun pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / nges pa'i yul can nyid dam /
analyzed: phyogs gcig cung zad tsam gyis chos mthun pa de'i phyir 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / nges pa'i yul can nyid dam /
translated: Because of the similarity of a small part, one direction, there is the possession of attachment, etc., and the ascertainment of the object,

original: gzhan gyis kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis kyang rung ste /
translated: or else,

original: skyes bu rnams rnam pa thams cad mthun par dpag bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: skyes bu rnams rnam pa thams cad mthun par dpag bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: all the aspects of a person are inferred in accordance with that.

original: gal te rgyu'i khyad par mi srid na ni de ltar rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gal te rgyu'i khyad par mi srid na ni de ltar rjes su dpag par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: If the difference in cause is not possible, then it is inferred in that way.

original: rgyu'i khyad par de ni med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par de ni med pa ma yin no //
translated: That difference in cause is not nonexistent.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na bshad pa /
translated: Why? It is explained:

original: sems kyi yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir te dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems kyi yon tan thams cad la khyad par mthong ba'i phyir te dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference is seen in all the qualities of the mind, because the object is seen.

original: chags pa dang shes rab la sogs pa rang gi yul 'dzin pa la dman zhing dman par 'jug pa yang yongs su gyur nas dus kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: chags pa dang shes rab la sogs pa rang gi yul 'dzin pa la dman zhing dman par 'jug pa yang yongs su gyur nas dus kyis gsal bar 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Attachment, wisdom, etc., which engage in the apprehension of their own objects in a lesser and lesser way, are transformed and become clear over time.

original: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi gsal ba yang yid brtan par goms pas gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba'i rnam pa mi gsal ba yang yid brtan par goms pas gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Also, the unclear aspect of the object is seen clearly through the power of the repeated practice of the clear mind.

original: gal te de lta na yang khyad par de gang las yin zhes khyad par gyi rgyu mi shes pas so /
analyzed: gal te de lta na yang khyad par de gang las yin zhes khyad par gyi rgyu mi shes pas so /
translated: If that is so, then what is the cause of the difference?

original: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'dod chags la sogs pa nyid rgyu dang bcas par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, attachment and so on are the cause,üîΩand not another mind.

original: sems gzhan ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: sems gzhan ni ma yin no zhes dogs pa la /
translated: In response to this doubt, it is said:

original: bshad pa / legs par bya ba ni goms pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa / legs par bya ba ni goms pa ste /
translated: The excellence is the repeated practice.

original: de'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi phyir yid kyi yon tan thams cad la thun @282a * //
analyzed: de'i bye brag las khyad par rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir ro // gang gi phyir yid kyi yon tan thams cad la thun @282a * //
translated: The difference is understood from the difference in that.

original: mong du yid kyi yon tan gyi rgyu goms pa'i khyad par mthong ba yin pa de'i phyir bdag med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan la yang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khyad par srid ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mong du yid kyi yon tan gyi rgyu goms pa'i khyad par mthong ba yin pa de'i phyir bdag med par shes pa'i mtshan nyid dang / don thams cad 'dzin pa'i phyir shes pa gzhan la yang goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi khyad par srid ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all the mental qualities are seen to be the cause of the mental qualities in general, the repeated practice is prior to the other cognitions, which have the characteristic of the knowledge of selflessness and the capacity to apprehend all objects, because the difference is possible.

original: yid kyi yon tan thams cad kyi bye brag gis rgyu shes pa yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi yon tan thams cad kyi bye brag gis rgyu shes pa yin no //
translated: The specific cause of all the good qualities of the mind is knowledge.

original: goms pa'i dbang gis de gsal bar snang ba'i bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / don thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzhi yin no //
analyzed: goms pa'i dbang gis de gsal bar snang ba'i bdag med pa'i rnam pa dang / don thams cad 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa de nyid 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa'i gzhi yin no //
translated: By the power of practice, that very concept is the basis of freedom from attachment and omniscience, because it is the aspect of selflessness that appears clearly and because it holds all objects.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa mi srid pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa mi srid pa nyid ni rnam pa gsum gyis 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the impossibility of freedom from attachment and omniscience is due to three reasons:

original: gal te bdag med pa'i rnam ba can dang dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa 'am /
analyzed: gal te bdag med pa'i rnam ba can dang dngos po thams cad la rnam par rtog pa mi srid pa 'am /
translated: If it is impossible to have a concept of all things that has the aspect of selflessness,

original: srid par gyur kyang yid kyi yon tan rnams gal te khyad par du mi 'gyur ram /
analyzed: srid par gyur kyang yid kyi yon tan rnams gal te khyad par du mi 'gyur ram /
translated: or if it is possible, but the good qualities of the mind do not increase,

original: khyad par yod kyang gal te khyad par gyi rgyu mi shes par 'gyur na'o //
analyzed: khyad par yod kyang gal te khyad par gyi rgyu mi shes par 'gyur na'o //
translated: or if they do increase, but the cause of that increase is not known.

original: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog par srid pa dang / goms pa khyad par gyi rgyu yin par yang shes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis rnam par rtog par srid pa dang / goms pa khyad par gyi rgyu yin par yang shes pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is known that the cause of the special attainment of the habit of the view of selflessness is the absence of the obstacles to the view of selflessness and the presence of the conditions for the view of selflessness.üîΩTherefore, just as one infers the potency of the assemblage of conditions, such as the seed, etc., to produce the sprout, from the fact that the sprout arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage, in the same way, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar ma tshang ba dang gags byed pa med nas la sogs pa'i tshogs pa myu gu skyed bar nus pa yin no zhes nus pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba med na yun ring du bar chad medüîΩpar goms pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa de dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa de gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar ma tshang ba dang gags byed pa med nas la sogs pa'i tshogs pa myu gu skyed bar nus pa yin no zhes nus pa rjes su dpog pa de bzhin du gegs byed pa dang ma tshang ba med na yun ring du bar chad med par goms pa'i dbang gis rnam par rtog pa de dang bdag med pa'i rnam pa can gyis shes pa de gsal bar snang ba nyid do //
translated: Thus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.üîΩThus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of selflessness from the fact that the view of selflessness arises when there is no deficiency in the assemblage.

original: de srid pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen ba dag srid pa rjes su dpog go //
analyzed: de srid pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen ba dag srid pa rjes su dpog go //
translated: Thus, one infers the absence of obstacles and the presence of conditions for the view of self

original: de'i phyir mthong ba'i sems la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan gyi khyad par shes par byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mthong ba'i sems la ni 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan gyi khyad par shes par byed pa yod pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the mind that sees does not have the special characteristics of being free from attachment and so on.

original: goms pas bsgrub pa'i 'du byed ma mthong ba nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: goms pas bsgrub pa'i 'du byed ma mthong ba nyid ni 'dod chags dang bral ba rjes su dpag pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan par mthong ba yin no //
translated: The nonseeing of formative factors that are accomplished through cultivation is seen to be a reason that can infer freedom from attachment.

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du dpog pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan par mthong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i tshig ni skyes bus ma byas pa nyid du dpog pa'i gtan tshigs dang ldan par mthong ba ma yin no //
translated: The words of a nonhuman are not seen to be a reason that can infer nonhuman authorship.

original: 'di ni re zhig kho bo cag gis srid par rjes su dpag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni re zhig kho bo cag gis srid par rjes su dpag pa yin no //
translated: This is our inference of possibility.

original: mi srid par rjes su dpag par bya @282b ba la ni chos de gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang khyed la med de /
analyzed: mi srid par rjes su dpag par bya @282b ba la ni chos de gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs 'ga' yang khyed la med de /
translated: As for the inference of impossibility, you have no reason that can invalidate that phenomenon.

original: de med pa'i phyir skyes bu dag la rgyu'i khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir skyes bu dag la rgyu'i khyad par med pa ma yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: Since that does not exist, it is connected to the point that there is no absence of a specific cause in beings.

original: gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa yang ji ltar zhe na 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med pa yang ji ltar zhe na 'dod chags dang bral ba ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, how could there be no reason to refute it? Because one does not see the absence of attachment.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa ste thams cad mkhyen pa yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is an illustration. Because one does not see omniscience.

original: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa mthong mod /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa mthong mod /
translated: If one does see the absence of attachment and omniscience,

original: de lta na yang de'i gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: de lta na yang de'i gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na bshad pa /
translated: then how could there be no reason to refute it?

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma mthong ba dang ni 'ga' zhig lhan cig 'gal ba mi 'grub la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma mthong ba dang ni 'ga' zhig lhan cig 'gal ba mi 'grub la /
translated: Because one does not see the absence of attachment and omniscience, one does not establish any contradiction between them.

original: 'gal ba ma grub na gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa de'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med do //
analyzed: 'gal ba ma grub na gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa'i dngos po mi 'grub pa de'i phyir gnod par byed pa'i gtan tshigs med do //
translated: If one does not establish a contradiction, one does not establish the relation of the refuted and the refuter. Therefore, there is no reason to refute it.

original: gal te dngos po nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid ma mthong ba dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba grub pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te dngos po nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid dngos po med pa nyid dang rtag pa nyid ma mthong ba dang phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'gal ba grub pa de bzhin du /
translated: If you think that impermanence and nonentityness are established as mutually exclusive and contradictory in the sense of being objects that are abandoned and their antidote, just as permanence and entityness are not seen,

original: thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa'i yang ma yin nam /
translated: then are omniscience and non-omniscience also like that?

original: de ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dus gzhan gyi tshe rang gi rgyud la 'gyur bar the tshom za ste /
analyzed: de ste 'dod chags dang bcas pa nyid dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid dus gzhan gyi tshe rang gi rgyud la 'gyur bar the tshom za ste /
translated: If you think that at another time one‚Äôs continuum will become both attached and not omniscient,

original: des na the tshom gyi tshul gyis gnod par byed pa /üîΩgrub pa des kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dgag par mi nus pa yin na ni /
analyzed: des na the tshom gyi tshul gyis gnod par byed pa / grub pa des kyang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba nyid dgag par mi nus pa yin na ni /
translated: then it is uncertain, and thus it is undermined by doubt.üîΩIf that is so, then omniscience and freedom from attachment cannot be refuted.

original: gal te de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: gal te de lta na ni 'o na mthong ba'i phyir la /
translated: If you think that, then omniscience and freedom from attachment are seen.

original: ma mthong ba la yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong ba la yang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro zhes smras pa de mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not tenable that the object of refutation and the means of refutation are not seen,

original: bsam pa 'di yin te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bsam pa 'di yin te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: then this is our response: The thought is this‚Äîbecause they are contradictory in the sense of being mutually exclusive,

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin du chags pa dang chags pa med pa'i sems dag ni gcig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa bzhin du chags pa dang chags pa med pa'i sems dag ni gcig pa ma yin la /
translated: like being a thing and not being a thing, minds of attachment and nonattachment are not the same.

original: lhan cig gnas pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig gnas pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor do they coexist,

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig las cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen gcig las cig car mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not arise simultaneously from the same equivalent immediately preceding condition.üîΩAnd it is contradictory for nonarisen states to be the same appropriator,

original: mi skye ba yang 'gal ba dag nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na'o //üîΩ'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral @283a * //
analyzed: mi skye ba yang 'gal ba dag nye bar len pa gcig pa nyid du 'gal ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di kho bo cag gi 'dod pa kho na'o // 'dod chags dang 'dod chags dang bral @283a * //
translated: so this is precisely what we accept.

original: pa'i sems cig car yod pa 'am tha mi dad par ni kho bo cag las mi len no //
analyzed: pa'i sems cig car yod pa 'am tha mi dad par ni kho bo cag las mi len no //
translated: We do not accept that minds of attachment and freedom from attachment exist simultaneously or that they are not different.

original: de'i phyir 'dir 'gal ba tsam du ni skabs kyang ci yang mi phan no //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir 'gal ba tsam du ni skabs kyang ci yang mi phan no //
translated: Therefore, it is not at all helpful to merely state a contradiction here.

original: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: This is what must be proven:

original: gzhan gyi rgyud gang la 'dod chags dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid mthong ba rgyu de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud gang la 'dod chags dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa nyid mthong ba rgyu de la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa nyid 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn any other continuum, the one who sees desire and non-omniscience cannot become free from desire and omniscient.‚Äù

original: 'di yang ji ltar bstan par nus she na /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar bstan par nus she na /
translated: How can this be demonstrated?

original: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du gal te de'i rgyu dang rgyu dag kyang phan tshun spangs pa nyid du mthong na'o //
analyzed: ji ltar thams cad mkhyen pa dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag phan tshun spangs te gnas pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa de bzhin du gal te de'i rgyu dang rgyu dag kyang phan tshun spangs pa nyid du mthong na'o //
translated: If the cause of desire and non-omniscience were seen to be mutually exclusive, then the cause of omniscience and non-omniscience would also be seen to be mutually exclusive.

original: rgyu dang 'gal bar mthong ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'gal bar mthong ba yang ma yin te /
translated: But this is not the case, because the cause of omniscience is not seen to be contradictory.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because freedom from desire and so on are not seen.

original: yod pa dang med pa rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i rgyu des na /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa rjes su byed pa'i sgo nas mthong ba'i rgyu des na /
translated: Because of the cause of seeing, which is the subsequent conformity with existence and nonexistence,

original: de las gzhan thams cad ni rgyu ma yin par nges par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las gzhan thams cad ni rgyu ma yin par nges par 'gyur la /
translated: it is certain that everything else is not a cause.

original: de'i rgyu yin pa dang ma yin pa yang rgyu 'gal bar nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu yin pa dang ma yin pa yang rgyu 'gal bar nges pa yin no //
translated: And it is certain that the cause is contradictory to the noncause.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ma mthong na ni de'i rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'gal bar nges par nus pa ma yin no //üîΩde'i phyir gang gis rang gi shes pa'i rgyud la thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur pa /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa ma mthong na ni de'i rgyu dang rgyu ma yin pa ma nges pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'gal bar nges par nus pa ma yin no // de'i phyir gang gis rang gi shes pa'i rgyud la thams cad mkhyen pa la sogs pa thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pas gnod par 'gyur pa /
translated: But if one does not see the absence of attachment, etc., then it is not possible to ascertain the cause and the noncause, and so it is not possible to ascertain the cause as contradictory to the noncause.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi snang ba dang / rgyu'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa grub ba med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa mi snang ba dang / rgyu'i sgo nas thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang gnod par bya ba dang gnod par byed pa grub ba med do //
translated: Therefore, since the omniscient one, etc., are not invalidated by the nonomniscient one, etc., in one‚Äôs own continuum of consciousness, and since the absence of attachment, etc., are not seen, and since the nonomniscient one, etc., are not invalidated by the omniscient one, etc., in the continuum of consciousness of others, and since the absence of attachment, etc., are not seen, there is no establishment of the invalidator and the invalidated by way of the cause.

original: de dang 'gal ba skyed par nus pa mthong ba'i rgyud la de'i rgyu med par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dang 'gal ba skyed par nus pa mthong ba'i rgyud la de'i rgyu med par 'gyur na /
translated: But if it were seen that the continuum of someone who is capable of producing a contradiction with that is without a cause of that,

original: de ni ma grub ste /
analyzed: de ni ma grub ste /
translated: then that is not established.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one who is free from attachment is not established.

original: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'di thams cad mkhyen pa srid pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dang ldan pa'i rgyud 'di thams cad mkhyen pa srid pa ma yin no zhes gang brjod pa de mi rigs so //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that this continuum of someone who is not omniscient is not possible for omniscience.

original: gal te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa gang yin pa de dag nye bar len pa gcig las skyes par mi rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te phan tshun spangs te gnas pa gang yin pa de dag nye bar len pa gcig las skyes par mi rigs pa yin te /
translated: If it is the case that those that are mutually exclusive and contradictory cannot reasonably arise from a single appropriation,

original: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang sngon po ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like blue and non-blue.

original: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig las thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag ji ltar 'byung bar 'dod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa'i rgyud gcig las thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag ji ltar 'byung bar 'dod ce na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, how could it be asserted that non-omniscience arises from a single continuum of consciousness?

original: gal te rnam @283b par shes pa'i skad cig gcig las thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag skye bar kho bo cag la rgol zhing rtog bar byed na ni ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gal te rnam @283b par shes pa'i skad cig gcig las thams cad mkhyen pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa dag skye bar kho bo cag la rgol zhing rtog bar byed na ni ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: If you are arguing that omniscience and non-omniscience arise from a single moment of consciousness, then we say no.

original: rim gyis de dag skye ba la ni rgyud tha dad ba kho na'o //
analyzed: rim gyis de dag skye ba la ni rgyud tha dad ba kho na'o //
translated: If they arise in sequence, then they are in different continua.

original: gal te grang ba skyed par byed ba'i rgyun las dro ba'i reg pa mi 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grang ba skyed par byed ba'i rgyun las dro ba'i reg pa mi 'byung ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But is it not the case that a warm sensation does not arise from a continuum that produces cold?

original: gal te la lar mthong du zad mod /
analyzed: gal te la lar mthong du zad mod /
translated: It is seen in some cases.

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: So what?

original: rnam par shes pa ni don dam par na don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rnam 'grel dang / 'dir yang le'u dang por bsgrubs zin to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni don dam par na don 'dzin pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rnam 'grel dang / 'dir yang le'u dang por bsgrubs zin to //
translated: Consciousness is by nature the apprehension of objects, as has been established in the Pramiirwvarttika and here in the first chapter.

original: rgyu dag gcig la sngar mu stegs pa'i bdag gi rnam par rtog pa dang / phyis bde bar gshegs pa'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rgyu dag gcig la sngar mu stegs pa'i bdag gi rnam par rtog pa dang / phyis bde bar gshegs pa'i lugs kyi rjes su 'brangs pa bdag med pa'i rnam par rtog pa mthong ba yin no //
translated: The cause is the same, but first there is the tirthikas' conception of a self, and later there is the conception of selflessness that follows the system of the Sugata.

original: rnam par rtog pa khyad par du 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs srid pa yang bshad ma thag pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa khyad par du 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs srid pa yang bshad ma thag pa yin no //
translated: The possibility of a state of consciousness that is a transformation of the conceptualization has been explained.

original: de'i phyir rgyu dag gcig la 'gal ba 'byung ba ni mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu dag gcig la 'gal ba 'byung ba ni mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the simultaneous occurrence of mutually contradictory causes.üîΩThus, pleasure and pain, which are mutually contradictory, do not arise from the same cause. But it is seen that they arise from the same type of cause.

original: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag rgyu dag cig car mi skye yang rigs kyis skye ba mthong ba dang / de bzhin du sa bon gyi rgyud gcig nyid las phan tshun dben pa nyid yin yang myu gu'i rang bzhin dang sa bon gyi rang bzhin skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bde ba dang sdug bsngal 'gal ba dag rgyu dag cig car mi skye yang rigs kyis skye ba mthong ba dang / de bzhin du sa bon gyi rgyud gcig nyid las phan tshun dben pa nyid yin yang myu gu'i rang bzhin dang sa bon gyi rang bzhin skye ba yin no //
translated: And in the same way, from the same continuum of the seed, the nature of the sprout and the nature of the seed arise, even though they are mutually exclusive.

original: 'di snyam du sa bon gyi rgyun la ni lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las /
analyzed: 'di snyam du sa bon gyi rgyun la ni lhan cig byed pa tha dad pa las /
translated: If you think that in the continuum of the seed, the difference in nature arises from the difference in the cooperating conditions,

original: rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'byung ba yin gyi rgyud tsam las ni ma yin no snyam na bden te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi khyad par 'byung ba yin gyi rgyud tsam las ni ma yin no snyam na bden te /
translated: and not from the continuum itself, that is true.

original: 'di la yang lhan cig byed pa lus dang ngag gi las kyis mtshan nyid can /
analyzed: 'di la yang lhan cig byed pa lus dang ngag gi las kyis mtshan nyid can /
translated: But here, the cooperating conditions are the actions of body and speech, which have the nature of the continuum of the seed.

original: bsod nams dang goms pa las 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsod nams dang goms pa las 'gal ba'i rang bzhin 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and the nature of the opposite of merit and practice would arise.

original: dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags smin par byed pa'i yul las skye la /
analyzed: dbang po las byung ba'i bde ba dang sdug bsngal ni bde ba la sogs pa'i bag chags smin par byed pa'i yul las skye la /
translated: The pleasure and pain that arise from the sense faculties are born from objects that ripen the habitual tendencies of pleasure, etc.

original: yid kyis ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las yin gyi rgyun tsam las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyis ni 'bad rtsol la sogs pa las yin gyi rgyun tsam las ni ma yin no //
translated: But the mental faculties are born from effort, etc., not from mere continuity.

original: de'i phyir skad cig gcig la 'gal gyi rim gyis ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa de nyid las 'gal ba skye ba'i phyir mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig gcig la 'gal gyi rim gyis ni lhan cig byed pa la ltos pa de nyid las 'gal ba skye ba'i phyir mi 'gal lo //
translated: Therefore, there is no contradiction in the arising of the opposite from the very same thing that is the cause of the opposite, since the opposite arises in one moment, but not gradually.

original: de ltar rgyu la brten pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i phyir re zhig rang gi rgyud la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma mthong bas dus gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de ltar rgyu la brten pa'i 'gal ba med pa'i phyir re zhig rang gi rgyud la 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / thams cad mkhyen pa ma mthong bas dus gzhan du yang mi 'gyur ro zhes brjod par ni mi nus so //
translated: Thus, since there is no contradiction in the cause, it cannot be said that one who is free from attachment in his own continuum and who has not seen omniscience will not become so at another time.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyi rgyud la yang thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang da ltar nyid kyang dgag par @284a * //üîΩmi nus so zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyi rgyud la yang thams cad mkhyen pa dang 'dod chags dang bral ba dang da ltar nyid kyang dgag par @284a * // mi nus so zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Likewise, it is impossible to refute omniscience and freedom from attachment in the continuum of another.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can gang yin pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rnams kyi 'bras bu 'khrul pa med pa can gang yin pa de ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained because the effect of attachment and so on is not seen.

original: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa 'khrul pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags la sogs pa 'khrul pa med pa can gyi 'bras bu yod na ni /
translated: If the effect of attachment and so on were not erroneous,

original: de ma mthong ba las gzhan gyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma mthong ba las gzhan gyi rgyud la 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag pas 'dod chags dang bral ba la gnod pa yin no //
translated: then it would be possible to infer attachment and so on in the continuum of another from the nonseeing of that effect.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ldog par byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa rjes su dpag pa la 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ji ltar 'dod chags dang bral ba ldog par byed /
translated: But how could freedom from attachment be refuted on the ground that attachment and so on are inferred, since the effect of attachment and so on is nonexistent?

original: 'di snyam du gal te de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod na kho bo cag gis ji ltar ma dmigs she na bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di snyam du gal te de la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par yod na kho bo cag gis ji ltar ma dmigs she na bshad pa /
translated: If you think, ‚ÄúIf there is a difference in the characteristics of the one who is free from attachment, why don‚Äôt we see it?‚Äù

original: rgyud gzhan la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de rnams ni srid kyang bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyud gzhan la 'dod chags dang bral ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi khyad par de rnams ni srid kyang bltar mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: we reply: although there is a difference in the characteristics of the one who is free from attachment in another continuum, it is not visible.

original: don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The point is this:

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu mthong bas mi srid par rjes su dpag par mi nus la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyis khyad par ni 'gal ba'i 'bras bu mthong bas mi srid par rjes su dpag par mi nus la /
translated: The difference in characteristics of the one who is free from attachment cannot be inferred to be impossible because of seeing a contradictory effect.

original: rang gi ngo bo ma mthong bas med par dpag par yang ma yin no //üîΩrnam pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni spang bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma mthong bas med par dpag par yang ma yin no // rnam pa de lta bu'i mi dmigs pa ni spang bar rigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Nor can it be inferred to be nonexistent because of not seeing its own nature.üîΩIt is not right to reject such a nonapprehension.

original: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni spang bar 'os pa yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not right to reject such a nonapprehension.

original: des na gzhan gyi rgyud las yod pa'i khyad par dag ni 'gal bar rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pas ldog pa ma yin la /
analyzed: des na gzhan gyi rgyud las yod pa'i khyad par dag ni 'gal bar rjes su dpag pa med pa'i phyir 'gal ba dmigs pas ldog pa ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, since the opponent cannot infer the existence of a difference in the continuum of another, the difference is not refuted by the perception of contradiction.

original: rang gi rang bzhin ma dmigs pas kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rang bzhin ma dmigs pas kyang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it by the non-perception of its own nature.

original: rang gi rgyud la yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi srid par pha rol pos rjes su dpag par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la yang ma 'ongs pa'i dus su mi srid par pha rol pos rjes su dpag par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Nor can the opponent infer that it is impossible in the future.

original: srid pa'i dus su dpag pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
analyzed: srid pa'i dus su dpag pa ni sngar bshad zin to //
translated: The inference of its possibility in the present has already been explained.

original: das na skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can ma yin no //
analyzed: das na skyes bu dag ni rgyu'i khyad par med pa can ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, persons do not have the same cause.

original: gal te 'di snyam du skyes bu'i khyad par mthong ba nyid yin yang spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ngag kyang yin no snyam na bshad pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du skyes bu'i khyad par mthong ba nyid yin yang spang bar 'os pa ma yin pa de bzhin du ngag kyang yin no snyam na bshad pa /
translated: If you think that although the difference of persons is seen, it is not suitable to be refuted, and the same is true of speech, then we reply:

original: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnams ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: Words are not like that.

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu rnams la ni khyad par yod kyang bltar mi rung ba de'i phyir spang bar mi 'os pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu rnams la ni khyad par yod kyang bltar mi rung ba de'i phyir spang bar mi 'os pa yin no //
translated: Because although there is a difference in persons, it is not suitable to be refuted since it is not suitable to be seen.

original: gal te dag kyang khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin na ni khyad par spang bar 'os pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: gal te dag kyang khyad par bltar mi rung ba yin na ni khyad par spang bar 'os pa ma yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If the difference were not visible, then the difference would not be suitable to be rejected.

original: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir dag rnams kyi khyad par ma mthong ba ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: khyad par bltar rung ba'i phyir dag rnams kyi khyad par ma mthong ba ni spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: But because the difference is visible, the difference of the pure words is to be rejected because it is not seen.

original: gal te ji ltar sa la sogs pa thams cad mthong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig dag kyang @284b thams cad ni mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar sa la sogs pa thams cad mthong ba ma yin pa de bzhin du tshig dag kyang @284b thams cad ni mthong ba ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say: Just as the earth, etc. are not seen, so also the words are not all seen.

original: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: bltar mi rung ba nyid gcig yin na yang zhes smos so //
translated: But if there is only one that is not visible, then it is said:

original: gal te ngag 'ga' zhig gi ma mthong ba de ltar na yang khyad par ma mthong ba can gang yin pa de rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid khas len pa 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te ngag 'ga' zhig gi ma mthong ba de ltar na yang khyad par ma mthong ba can gang yin pa de rnams rigs mi mthun pa nyid khas len pa 'gal ba yin no //
translated: If some speech is not seen, then it is a contradiction to accept that those which have no seen difference are of different types.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te tshig thams cad mthong ba ma yin pa de lta na yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyung zad cig ni mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te tshig thams cad mthong ba ma yin pa de lta na yang skyes bus ma byas pa nyung zad cig ni mthong ba yin no //
translated: If all words are not seen, then a small part of the non-human is seen.

original: de dag kyang skyes bus byas pa las khyad par ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ste /
analyzed: de dag kyang skyes bus byas pa las khyad par ni 'ga' yang ma mthong ste /
translated: We see no difference between those and the words of a person.

original: des na gang gi phyir ngag nyung zad mthong ba dag la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyang rnam par ma mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gang gi phyir ngag nyung zad mthong ba dag la skyes bus ma byas pa nyid kyang rnam par ma mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because we do not see that even a few words are not made by a person,

original: skyes bus ma byas pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi khyad par de ni ma mthong ba'i ngag rnams la yang khas blang bar mi nus te /
analyzed: skyes bus ma byas pa'i rgyu mtshan can gyi khyad par de ni ma mthong ba'i ngag rnams la yang khas blang bar mi nus te /
translated: we cannot accept that words that we do not see are different in that they are not made by a person.

original: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can ni gcig la med na thams cad du yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de tsam gyi rgyu mtshan can ni gcig la med na thams cad du yang khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the reason for that difference does not exist in one case, then there is no difference in all cases.

original: des na 'gal ba'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa mthong ba'i ngag la bltar rung ba ma mthong pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni thams cad du spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'gal ba'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa mthong ba'i ngag la bltar rung ba ma mthong pa'i khyad par gang yin pa de ni thams cad du spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is contradictory, the difference between words that are seen and those that are not seen, which is based on whether or not they are made by a person, is to be rejected in all cases.

original: mthong ba nyung zad po la ji ltar khyad par med ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: mthong ba nyung zad po la ji ltar khyad par med ce na bshad pa /
translated: How can there be no difference between what is seen and what is not seen?

original: de'i khyad par rnams te bzla dka' ba la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan skyes bus byas pa'i ngag la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i khyad par rnams te bzla dka' ba la sogs pa skyes bus ma byas pa'i khyad par rnams ni gzhan skyes bus byas pa'i ngag la yang bya bar nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The differences in those, such as being difficult to understand, are also possible in the speech of others, which is created by a person.

original: gal te dngos po tha dad par mthong yang 'khrul bas tha mi dad par rtogs pa de bzhin du skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa'i ngag dag la tha mi dad par mod kyang 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po tha dad par mthong yang 'khrul bas tha mi dad par rtogs pa de bzhin du skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa'i ngag dag la tha mi dad par mod kyang 'khrul pas rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you see that things are different but understand them to be non-different due to delusion, in the same way, you understand the speech of a person and that of one not a person to be non-different due to delusion.

original: 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir zhes smos te /
translated: Because delusion is not established.

original: 'khrul pa ma 'grub pa'i phyir na skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la khyad par srid pa med pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa ma 'grub pa'i phyir na skyes bus byas pa dang ma byas pa dag la khyad par srid pa med pa ma yin no //
translated: Because delusion is not established, it is not the case that there is no possibility of a difference between that created by a person and that not created by a person.

original: yang ji ltar 'di la 'khrul pa ma grub ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar 'di la 'khrul pa ma grub ce na /
translated: Again, how is delusion not established in this case?

original: gnod par byed pa med pas zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pas zhes smos so //
translated: Because there is no harm.

original: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa tha dad pa med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin na /
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa tha dad pa med pa ni mngon sum gyis grub pa yin na /
translated: The non-difference between that created by a person and that not created by a person is established by direct perception.

original: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par yang grub pa de spang bar ji ltar nus nyams su myong ba tshad ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i tshad ma med par yang grub pa de spang bar ji ltar nus nyams su myong ba tshad ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that experience is a valid cognition,

original: 'o na tshad ma gang yin gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pas tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na tshad ma gang yin gzhan dag kyang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pas tshad ma yin la /
translated: then any valid cognition that obtains the meaning of the teaching is a valid cognition.

original: nyams su myong ba yang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang bstan pa'i don thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: And experience also obtains the meaning of the teaching.

original: gang la gnod pa byed pa med pa de ji ltar tshad ma yin te gnod pa yod na @285a * //
analyzed: gang la gnod pa byed pa med pa de ji ltar tshad ma yin te gnod pa yod na @285a * //
translated: How can that which is not contradicted by a valid cognition be a valid cognition?

original: ni myong ba 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: ni myong ba 'khrul par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If there is contradiction, then experience is mistaken.

original: shes pa'i don med pa nyid ni rang dga' ma yin gyi /
analyzed: shes pa'i don med pa nyid ni rang dga' ma yin gyi /
translated: The absence of the object of consciousness is not random,

original: 'on kyang tshad mas yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang tshad mas yin no //
translated: but rather is due to a valid cognition.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel las /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam 'grel las /
translated: For that very reason, Dharmakirti's Commentary on Valid Cognition says:

original: gnod byed kyi rigs pa dam pa med par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i blo cig car du 'byung ba yang spangs par mi nus so zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gnod byed kyi rigs pa dam pa med par nyams su myong bas grub pa'i blo cig car du 'byung ba yang spangs par mi nus so zhes bshad do //
translated: Without a valid reason that contradicts it, an awareness established by experience cannot be refuted.

original: de lta ma yin na gang mthong ba de thams cad spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang mthong ba de thams cad spang bar bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then everything that is seen would have to be rejected.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong bas grub pa'i don ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas dgag par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong bas grub pa'i don ni gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas dgag par bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, the meaning that is established by experience is to be refuted by a valid cognition that contradicts it.

original: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad kyi tshogs shes pa gnod par byed pas bzlog pa dang / mngon sum gyis rtogs par rloms pa'i skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad bzhin du rim dang cig car mi 'thad pa'i mtshan gyi gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas zlog par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can gyis skra shad kyi tshogs shes pa gnod par byed pas bzlog pa dang / mngon sum gyis rtogs par rloms pa'i skad cig ma ma yin pa nyid kyang rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i skra shad bzhin du rim dang cig car mi 'thad pa'i mtshan gyi gnod par byed pa'i tshad mas zlog par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the consciousness of a mass of hair by one with eye disease is refuted by that which contradicts it, and the nonmomentariness that is presumed to be understood by direct perception is refuted by a valid cognition that contradicts it, just as the hair seen by one with eye disease is untenable in terms of gradual or simultaneous arising.

original: de bzhin du li dong gra dang dug gnyis tha dad pa med par rtogs pa yang gnod par byed pa nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du li dong gra dang dug gnyis tha dad pa med par rtogs pa yang gnod par byed pa nyid kyis bzlog par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, the realization that the two, a mustard seed and a poison, are not different is to be refuted by that which contradicts it.

original: de lta na ni 'o na bdag nyid bzhin du gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong ba nyid kyis nges pa des na gnod par byed pa med par de 'khrul pa ji ltar pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na bdag nyid bzhin du gzhan yang 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong ba nyid kyis nges pa des na gnod par byed pa med par de 'khrul pa ji ltar pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If that is so, then just as one sees oneself as being endowed with attachment and so on, one would also see others as being endowed with attachment and so on.

original: gtan tshigs des na 'khru rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na 'khru rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of that reason, the error is not due to a cause of error.

original: de la ni re zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'i lus 'dra bas mngon sum ma yin pa'i sems kyang 'dra bar rtogs par byed par zad do //
analyzed: de la ni re zhig mngon sum du gyur pa'i lus 'dra bas mngon sum ma yin pa'i sems kyang 'dra bar rtogs par byed par zad do //
translated: In that case, one would merely understand that the non-evident mind is similar to the evident body.

original: de lta na 'o na 'dir yang mngon sum du gyur pa 'dra bar mthong nas /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'dir yang mngon sum du gyur pa 'dra bar mthong nas /
translated: If that is so, then here also, having seen the evident as similar,

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa 'dra bar rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa 'dra bar rtogs par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: one would understand the non-evident as similar.

original: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: sgra mngon sum pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To that, he says with regard to the evident sounds and so on.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being explained.

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na de dag 'di la med do //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i ngo bo ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin na de dag 'di la med do //
translated: The non-evident nature is the cause of error, but those [sounds] do not have that [non-evident nature].

original: de med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin te /
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa yin te /
translated: Because that does not exist, there is no reason for error.

original: de'i phyir yang mngon sum gyis rang bzhin la gnod par byed pa med na /üîΩji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du tha snyad 'jug par bya bas 'di la yang de'i rang bzhin can du khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang mngon sum gyis rang bzhin la gnod par byed pa med na / ji ltar nyams su myong ba bzhin du tha snyad 'jug par bya bas 'di la yang de'i rang bzhin can du khas blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, if direct perception does not contradict intrinsic reality,üîΩthen just as it is experienced, one should engage in conventional activity.

original: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, one should accept that it has that intrinsic reality, because there is no contradiction.

original: gal te mngon sum ma yin pa gzhan gyi sems la 'khrul pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te mngon sum ma yin pa gzhan gyi sems la 'khrul pa yin gyi /
translated: If it is said, ‚ÄúThe mind of another that is not direct perception is mistaken,

original: rang gi rgyud la brten pa'i shes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong zhing nges pa yin @285b no ;
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la brten pa'i shes pa ni 'dod chags la sogs pa dang ldan par mthong zhing nges pa yin @285b no ;
translated: but the consciousness that is based on one‚Äôs own continuum is seen and ascertained to be endowed with attachment and so on.

original: / rang gi sems kyi khyad par la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: / rang gi sems kyi khyad par la ni 'khrul pa'i rgyu mngon sum ma yin pa'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no reason for error in the specific mind of one‚Äôs own continuum, because there is no intrinsic nature that is not direct perception, and there is no consciousness that contradicts it.

original: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yang med pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba srid par ci ltar rjes su dpag ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i shes pa yang med pa'i phyir 'dod chags dang bral ba srid par ci ltar rjes su dpag ce na bshad pa /
translated: Therefore, how could it be inferred that freedom from attachment is possible?‚Äù

original: skyes bu dag la ni shes rab la sogs pa gnas pa'i khyad par phul du byung ba goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can mthong ba de nyid gnod par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dag la ni shes rab la sogs pa gnas pa'i khyad par phul du byung ba goms pa sngon du 'gro ba can mthong ba de nyid gnod par byed pa yin no //
translated: The fact that the mind of a person who is well-versed in the special, excellent knowledge, etc. is seen to be impaired is the refutation.

original: gal te goms pa la ltos nas khyad par du mi 'gyur na ni skyes bu'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: gal te goms pa la ltos nas khyad par du mi 'gyur na ni skyes bu'i sems 'dod chags dang bral ba mi srid par 'gyur ba zhig na 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: If the mind did not become different through the force of practice, then it would be impossible for a person‚Äôs mind to become free from attachment, but it does become free.

original: des na bdag med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar snang ba dang / de'i phyir rtog pa med pa nyid kyang yin pa na /
analyzed: des na bdag med pa ni rnam par rtog pa dang / mtha' dag la dmigs pa'i rnam par rtog pa dag goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar snang ba dang / de'i phyir rtog pa med pa nyid kyang yin pa na /
translated: Therefore, since the non-existence of self is clearly seen through the force of the practice of the conceptual thought that has all aspects as its object, and since it is also free from conceptual thought,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba dang thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ni mngon sum nyid yin no //
translated: freedom from attachment and omniscience are direct perceptions.

original: de'i phyir rang gi rgyud kyi sems kyi khyad par mngon sum du gyur ba ni tshig gi mngon sum 'khrul pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi rgyud kyi sems kyi khyad par mngon sum du gyur ba ni tshig gi mngon sum 'khrul pa dang mtshungs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the direct perception of the special mind in one‚Äôs continuum is not like the direct perception of words that is mistaken.

original: de la ni 'khrul pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par mthong bar gnod par byed pa yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ni 'khrul pa rnam par 'jog pa'i rgyu mtshan khyad par mthong bar gnod par byed pa yod pa yin no //
translated: But in this case, there is a reason for positing error, namely, the perception of a special cause of error.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ni da ltar yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i 'dod chags dang thams cad mkhyen pa ma yin pa ni da ltar yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And future attachment and nonomniscience do not exist in the present.

original: des na de ni mngon sum ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ni mngon sum ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not perceived.

original: de'i phyir med par nges pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir med par nges pa ni 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the ascertainment of their nonexistence is erroneous.

original: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa mngon par 'dod pa dag la mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tha dad pa med par nges pa la ni gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skyes bus byas pa dang skyes bus ma byas pa mngon par 'dod pa dag la mngon sum sngon du 'gro ba can gyi tha dad pa med par nges pa la ni gnod par byed pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the case of the desired objects of human action and nonhuman action, the ascertainment of their nondifference, which is preceded by perception, is not erroneous.

original: 'di snyam du 'o na dag la yang bltar mi rung ba'i khyad par tha dad pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du 'o na dag la yang bltar mi rung ba'i khyad par tha dad pa yod pa yin te /
translated: But in this case, there is a difference that cannot be perceived,

original: dper na skyes bu'i lus mthong ba'i sems la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na skyes bu'i lus mthong ba'i sems la 'khrul pa'i rgyu yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: just as the body of a man is the cause of error in the mind that perceives it.

original: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes smos so //
analyzed: tshig gi khyad par gzhan gyi ngo bor zhes smos so //
translated: The difference is stated in the words ‚Äúthe nature of another.‚Äù

original: tshig de las tha dad pa'i tshig gi khyad par gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag rtag pa de dang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med la de las byung ba'i yang med de /
analyzed: tshig de las tha dad pa'i tshig gi khyad par gang yin pa de ni skyes bus ma byas pa'i ngag rtag pa de dang de'i bdag nyid kyi 'brel pa med la de las byung ba'i yang med de /
translated: Any difference in the words that is distinct from those words is not related to that permanent, nonhuman speech as the same nature or as a different nature.

original: des na de'i khyad par ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de'i khyad par ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not a difference of that.

original: 'brel pa med na de'i zhes bya ba'i tha snyad mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med na de'i zhes bya ba'i tha snyad mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If there is no relation, the expression ‚Äúthat‚Äù is not tenable.

original: gtan tshigs des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu med pa yin la /
analyzed: gtan tshigs des na 'khrul pa'i rgyu med pa yin la /
translated: By that reason, there is no cause for error.

original: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ni mngon sum la snang ba'i tha dad pa mad pa grub ba yin no //üîΩdes na ji ltar skyes bus ma byas ba cung zad cig skyes bus @286a * //üîΩbyas pa las khyad med pa de gzhan du thams cad kyang khyad med pa yin no //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i phyir ni mngon sum la snang ba'i tha dad pa mad pa grub ba yin no // des na ji ltar skyes bus ma byas ba cung zad cig skyes bus @286a * // byas pa las khyad med pa de gzhan du thams cad kyang khyad med pa yin no //
translated: And because there is no harm, the difference that appears to direct perception is established as nonexistent.üîΩTherefore, just as a nonhuman utterance is not the slightest bit different from a human utterance, so too all other things are not different.

original: de'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed par 'gyur ba'am /
