analyzed: de'i phyir skyes bus byas pa dang khyad par med pa'i rang bzhin thams cad skyes bus byed par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Therefore, everything that is not different from a human utterance would be a human utterance.

original: yang na ni de dag skyes bus ma byas na 'ga' yang skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no ;
analyzed: yang na ni de dag skyes bus ma byas na 'ga' yang skyes bus byas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di grub pa yin no ;
translated: Or else, if they are not produced by a person, then it is established that nothing is produced by a person.

original: / gang la khyad par gyi rgyu med pa der ni thams cad 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: / gang la khyad par gyi rgyu med pa der ni thams cad 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin la /
translated: When there is no cause for distinction, it is possible to infer that everything is similar.

original: gang la khyad par gyi rgyu srid pa der ni bdag nyid thams cad 'dra bar rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la khyad par gyi rgyu srid pa der ni bdag nyid thams cad 'dra bar rjes su dpag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But when there is a cause for distinction, it is not logical to infer that everything is similar.

original: de las dang sman dang skyu ru ra la sogs pa dang / skyes bu dag ni khyad par spang bar mi nus pas phyogs gcig tu bzhag pa yin la /
analyzed: de las dang sman dang skyu ru ra la sogs pa dang / skyes bu dag ni khyad par spang bar mi nus pas phyogs gcig tu bzhag pa yin la /
translated: In that case, actions, medicine, myrobalan, etc., and persons cannot be excluded from the distinction, so they are posited as one class.

original: khyad par dgag par nus pa'i ngag rnams kyang phyogs gcig tu gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dgag par nus pa'i ngag rnams kyang phyogs gcig tu gnas pa yin no //
translated: And statements that can exclude distinctions also remain as one class.

original: de la don dam ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la don dam ni 'di yin te /
translated: The ultimate meaning of this is as follows:

original: gang la rnam pa thams cad bltar rung ba de la ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas na 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la rnam pa thams cad bltar rung ba de la ni rnam pa gzhan mi srid pas na 'dra bar dpag par nus pa yin la /
translated: When something can be seen in every way, since another aspect is not possible, it is possible to infer similarity.

original: gang la rnam pa thams cad bltar rung ba ma yin pa de la ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas thams cad 'dra bar rjes su rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la rnam pa thams cad bltar rung ba ma yin pa de la ni phyogs gcig gi sgo nas thams cad 'dra bar rjes su rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if something is not visible in every way, then it is not the case that everything is understood to be similar in terms of one aspect.

original: des na rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bsgrub bya log pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa de tsam gyis ni don thams cad la don gnyis ka ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nges pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: des na rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis bsgrub bya log pa la gtan tshigs ldog pa de tsam gyis ni don thams cad la don gnyis ka ldog pa dang ldan pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di nges pa med pa kho na'o zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the mere reversal of the probandum in some aspects does not entail the reversal of both things in all cases. This is just a matter of uncertainty.

original: gang gi phyir slob dpon ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par mi bzhed pa dang 'thad pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ldog par bya ba'i dngos po de kho na tsam de dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i ngo
analyzed: gang gi phyir slob dpon ma mthong ba tsam gyis ldog par mi bzhed pa dang 'thad pa yang ma yin pa de'i phyir ldog par bya ba'i dngos po de kho na tsam de dang 'brel pa'i ngo bo mi rtag pa la sogs pa gang yin pa de'i ngo
translated: Since the mere non-observation of the master is not accepted as a reversal, and since that is not tenable, therefore, that very thing to be reversed, which is merely related to impermanence and so on, is the nature of that.

original: bo nyid kyis sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyor te /
analyzed: bo nyid kyis sgra rim pa gzhan du sbyor te /
translated: The nature itself is connected to the term in a different order.

original: ngo bo nyid kho nas rang nyid ldog pa na sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i ngo bo ldog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kho nas rang nyid ldog pa na sgrub par byed ces bya ba'i ngo bo ldog par byed pa yin no //
translated: When it is the very nature of something to be excluded from itself, then the nature of the probandum is excluded.

original: 'am zhes smos pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: 'am zhes smos pa ni 'bras bu'i gtan tshigs la ltos pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù indicates that this is also a reason based on effect.

original: rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi dper brjod pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gtan tshigs kyi dper brjod pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The following is an example of an essential reason:

original: dper na shing zhes bya ba shing nyid kyis shing sha pa zhes bya ba shing sha pa nyid ldog par byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shing zhes bya ba shing nyid kyis shing sha pa zhes bya ba shing sha pa nyid ldog par byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the word ‚Äútree‚Äù excludes the word ‚Äú≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ‚Äù by virtue of being a tree.

original: gang du shing med par ni nges la shing sha pa med par ma nges pa de la dper brjod pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: gang du shing med par ni nges la shing sha pa med par ma nges pa de la dper brjod pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is an example of a case where the absence of a tree is ascertained, but the absence of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ is not ascertained.

original: rgyang ring po nas shing nyid ni rnam par dbye bar nus kyi shing sha pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyang ring po nas shing nyid ni rnam par dbye bar nus kyi shing sha pa ni ma yin no //
translated: From a distance, one can distinguish a tree, but one cannot distinguish a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ.

original: shing dang shing sha pa 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: shing dang shing sha pa 'di gnyis de'i bdag nyid du bsgrub pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to prove that these two, a tree and a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ, are the same nature, it is said:

original: yal ga la sogs @286b pa dang ldan pa'i don de las gzhan pa dag las khyad par du gyur pas na khyad par te /
analyzed: yal ga la sogs @286b pa dang ldan pa'i don de las gzhan pa dag las khyad par du gyur pas na khyad par te /
translated: The meaning that possesses branches, etc. is distinguished from other things, and therefore it is a distinction.

original: de nyid 'ga' zhig la yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'ga' zhig la yin gyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: That is so for some, but not for all.

original: de skad du zhes bya ba shing sha pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don de ni shing sha pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de skad du zhes bya ba shing sha pa nyid du grags pa'i phyir lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'i don de ni shing sha pa nyid kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: In that way, because the meaning that possesses leaves, etc. is known as a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree, it is the nature of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree.

original: gang gi phyir gzhan ni 'ga' yang shing sha pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan ni 'ga' yang shing sha pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Because nothing else is a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree,

original: lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma la sogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: it is the one that possesses leaves, etc.

original: don shing gi sgra brjod par bya ba nyid shing sha pa yin pa de'i phyir de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin na /
analyzed: don shing gi sgra brjod par bya ba nyid shing sha pa yin pa de'i phyir de ni de'i rang gi ngo bo yin na /
translated: The meaning that is the object of expression of the word tree is a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree. Therefore, that is its intrinsic nature.

original: de yang bdag nyid por nas ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid por nas ji ltar yod par 'gyur /
translated: But how could that be, having been discarded?

original: des na shing sha pa nyid kyi ngo bo ldog par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo la 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: des na shing sha pa nyid kyi ngo bo ldog par byed pa bsgrub par bya ba'i ngo bo la 'brel pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reversal of the nature of a ≈õi·πÉ≈õapƒÅ tree is related to the nature of the object to be established.

original: 'brel pa'i phyir na 'khrul pa med do //
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir na 'khrul pa med do //
translated: Because of the relation, there is no error.

original: rgyu yis kyang /
analyzed: rgyu yis kyang /
translated: Also, the cause

original: kyang smos pa ni rang bzhin yang ldog par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: kyang smos pa ni rang bzhin yang ldog par byed pa yin la /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the nature is also the reason for reversal.

original: rgyu yang ldog par byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rgyu yang ldog par byed pa yin gyi /
translated: The cause is also the reason for reversal.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: It is not something else.

original: ci zhig ldog par byed ce na /
analyzed: ci zhig ldog par byed ce na /
translated: What is the reversal?

original: 'bras bu ste 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ste 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect, because there is no error.

original: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can 'khrul pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ldog par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan can 'khrul pa med pa yin pa'i phyir ldog par byed pa yin no //
translated: The nature is the reason for reversal because it is the cause that is related to the effect and is not erroneous.

original: rgyu log pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid rnam par 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: rgyu log pa na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'di nyid rnam par 'grel par byed do //
translated: He explains this very point with ‚ÄúWhen the cause is reversed, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan du na gal te de log pa na 'bras bu log par mi byed na /
analyzed: gzhan du na gal te de log pa na 'bras bu log par mi byed na /
translated: Otherwise, if when that is reversed, the effect is not reversed,

original: de med par 'byung ba'i dngos po ni de la 'khrul pa'i phyir de de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par 'byung ba'i dngos po ni de la 'khrul pa'i phyir de de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the entity that occurs without it would be erroneous with respect to it, and it would not be its effect.

original: gang gi phyir rgyu la 'khrul pas na de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ba des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de rgyu la nges par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rgyu la 'khrul pas na de'i 'bras bu nyid du mi 'gyur ba des na rgyu dang 'bras bu dngos po gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu'i rang bzhin de rgyu la nges par byed pa yin no //
translated: Because the cause is mistaken, it would not be the effect. Therefore, whatever is the entity of cause and effect, that is the nature of the effect, and it is ascertained in the cause.

original: de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de yod na ni yod la med na ni med pa zhes bya ba'i 'bras bu'i nges pa yin no //
translated: When it exists, it exists; when it does not exist, it does not exist. This is the certainty of the effect.

original: de'i phyir gnyi gar yang de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung bas rang bzhin 'brel pa gang yin pa de kho nas yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi gar yang de'i bdag nyid dam de las byung bas rang bzhin 'brel pa gang yin pa de kho nas yin no //
translated: Therefore, in both cases, it is just by that which is the essential nature or that which arises from it, that is, by the essential relation.

original: de ltar gang la 'brel pa yod pa de la ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa yod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar gang la 'brel pa yod pa de la ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa yod pa yin no zhes bsgrub pa'i sgo nas bshad nas /
translated: Thus, having explained by way of proof, ‚ÄúThat which has a relation, for it there is the negatee and the negating,‚Äù

original: da ni rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa la ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa med do zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir de lta min na zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin 'brel pa med pa la ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa med do zhes ldog pa'i sgo nas bstan pa'i phyir de lta min na zhes smos so //
translated: now, in order to teach by way of negation, ‚ÄúThat which lacks the essential relation, for it there is no negatee and no negating,‚Äù he says, ‚ÄúIf that were not so,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang yang rung ba gcig log pas ji ltar ma 'brel pa gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba gcig log pas ji ltar ma 'brel pa gzhan ni ldog par 'gyur na /
translated: How could the other, which is unrelated, be eliminated by the elimination of any one of them?

original: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mi la zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid dpe'i sgo nas bsal bar bya ba'i phyir mi la zhes smos so //
translated: In order to clarify this very point through an example, he says, ‚ÄúA man . . .

original: rta med pa'i phyir na rta med pa'i mi de la phyugs kyang med par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: rta med pa'i phyir na rta med pa'i mi de la phyugs kyang med par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: ‚Äù If a man has no horse, would he also have no cattle?

original: de ltar ni mi srid @287a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi srid @287a * //
translated: This is impossible.

original: de mngon sum gyis gnod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de mngon sum gyis gnod par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen to be undermined by direct perception.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'brel pa med na ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yang rung ba gcig cig nye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'brel pa med na ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa'i ngo bo mi 'thad pa de bzhin du byas pa nyid la sogs pa gang yang rung ba gcig cig nye ba'i phyir /
translated: Just as the nature of that which is eliminated and that which eliminates is untenable if there is no relation, in the same way, when any one of the properties such as being a product is present,

original: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan ni nges par nye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa gzhan ni nges par nye bar 'gyur te /
translated: how could the other properties such as being impermanent definitely be present?

original: 'di ltar mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi la phyugs ni bdog ces te /
translated: It is just like saying, ‚ÄúA man has cattle.‚Äù

original: phyugs yod pa'i phyir de bzhin du rta yang bdog par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: phyugs yod pa'i phyir de bzhin du rta yang bdog par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: If he has cattle, would he also have horses?

original: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin no //üîΩrang bzhin 'brel pa de yang de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi 'brel pa yin pa'i phyir gtan tshigs bsgrub par bya ba go bar byed pa ma yin no // rang bzhin 'brel pa de yang de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de /
translated: Therefore, ‚Äúonly by the relation of intrinsic identity‚Äù means that the reason does not make the probandum understood because of being related by intrinsic identity.

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid do //üîΩrgyu mtshan gang la yod pa 'am /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i bdag nyid kyi mtshan nyid do // rgyu mtshan gang la yod pa 'am /
translated: And that relation of intrinsic identity is the identity of that, i.e., the definition of the probandum.üîΩIt is the reason that has that as its cause,

original: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i mtshan nyid yin no //
translated: or it is the definition of that which arises from that.

original: gal te rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin 'brel pa kho nas gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin na /
translated: If the reason makes the probandum understood only by the relation of intrinsic identity,

original: 'o na ni dpe dgod par mi bya ste /üîΩdes na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can 'dra ba'am /
analyzed: 'o na ni dpe dgod par mi bya ste / des na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dang dpe'i chos can 'dra ba'am /
translated: then the example should not be stated,

original: mi 'dra ba tsam ston pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba tsam ston pa yin zhe na /
translated: because it merely shows the similarity or dissimilarity of the subject of the proposition and the subject of the example.

original: dpe des chos can 'dra ba 'am cig shos su ston to zhes bya /
analyzed: dpe des chos can 'dra ba 'am cig shos su ston to zhes bya /
translated: If you say that the example shows the subject to be similar or dissimilar,

original: 'o na ci byed ce na /
analyzed: 'o na ci byed ce na /
translated: then what is the point of the example?üîΩIt is the reason that has that as its cause,

original: de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can nam /
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid kyi rgyu mtshan can nam /
translated: The reason is that it is the nature of the mind.

original: de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med na mi 'byung ba de nyid ston to /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i rgyu mtshan can gyi med na mi 'byung ba de nyid ston to /
translated: The reason that arises from that is taught to be the invariable concomitance.

original: dpe de dag gis med na mi 'byung ba'i yul can gyi tshad ma nye bar ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: dpe de dag gis med na mi 'byung ba'i yul can gyi tshad ma nye bar ston par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The meaning of the statement is that the examples teach the valid knowledge that has an invariable concomitance as its object.

original: tshad ma bstan pas med na mi 'byung ba bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma bstan pas med na mi 'byung ba bstan par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: By teaching the valid knowledge, the invariable concomitance is taught.

original: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel pa'i tshad ma tsam rab tu ston pa de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i yul gyi dpe la nges par gdon mi za bar 'di la zhes bya ba gtan tshigs la gtan tshigs kyi tshul rab tu grub pa'i don du gzhi chos
analyzed: gang gi phyir dpe dag gis 'brel pa'i tshad ma tsam rab tu ston pa de'i phyir chos mi mthun pa'i yul gyi dpe la nges par gdon mi za bar 'di la zhes bya ba gtan tshigs la gtan tshigs kyi tshul rab tu grub pa'i don du gzhi chos
translated: Because the examples teach only the valid knowledge of the relation, therefore, in the example of the dissimilar class, it is definitely necessary to state ‚Äúin this,‚Äù in order to establish the mode of the reason in the reason.

original: can dngos por gyur pa mi 'dod do //
analyzed: can dngos por gyur pa mi 'dod do //
translated: The basis, the subject, is not asserted to be an entity.

original: gal te chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i stobs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dngos po gzhan dang chos mi mthun par bstan par bya ba yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te chos mi mthun pa'i dpe'i stobs kyis bsgrub par bya ba'i chos can dngos po gzhan dang chos mi mthun par bstan par bya ba yin na ni /
translated: If, by the power of the example of the dissimilar class, the property of the subject is to be shown to be dissimilar from another entity that is the object of affirmation,üîΩthen the example of the dissimilar class would not be established.

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yang dngos por gyur pa zhig tu khas blang bar bya ba zhig na /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe yang dngos por gyur pa zhig tu khas blang bar bya ba zhig na /
translated: And the example of the dissimilar class must be accepted as a thing.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa'i tshad ma tsam bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa'i chos gnyis gcig las ldog pa tsam du bstan pa ni dngos po med pa la yang bstan par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa'i tshad ma tsam bstan par bya ba yin pa de'i phyir 'brel pa'i chos gnyis gcig las ldog pa tsam du bstan pa ni dngos po med pa la yang bstan par nus pa yin no //
translated: But since the mere valid cognition of the relation is to be taught, therefore, the mere reversal of the two related phenomena from one is taught, and it is possible to teach that even in the case of a non-thing.

original: dngos po la ni sgrub par byed pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dngos po'i chos dag 'jug par dogs @287b kyang /
analyzed: dngos po la ni sgrub par byed pa dang / bsgrub par bya ba dngos po'i chos dag 'jug par dogs @287b kyang /
translated: In the case of a thing, although there is the possibility of the relation of the probandum and the proof engaging in the phenomena of the thing,

original: dngos po med pa la ni gegs med par ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la ni gegs med par ldog pa nyid du rtogs pa yin no //
translated: in the case of a non-thing, the mere reversal is understood without obstruction.

original: gal te yod pa la chos dag 'brel par tshad mas bstan par nus pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te yod pa la chos dag 'brel par tshad mas bstan par nus pa ma yin nam /
translated: If it is said: ‚ÄúIs it not the case that the relation of phenomena to an existent can be taught by valid cognition?

original: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dngos po med na chos de dag mi srid pas sgrub pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma yang bstan par mi nus so zhe na /
analyzed: chos mi mthun pa'i dpe dngos po med na chos de dag mi srid pas sgrub pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma yang bstan par mi nus so zhe na /
translated: And if the example of the dissimilar class is a non-thing, since those phenomena are impossible, the valid cognition of the proof that has an object cannot be taught.‚Äù

original: dpe la ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: dpe la ni zhes smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúIn the case of an example . . .‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa nyid de'i ngo bor bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba'i chos sgrub par byed pa nyid de'i ngo bor bsgrub par bya ba'i chos nyid yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes ston te /
translated: It shows that the proof is the nature of the probandum, and not anything else.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: the nature of the proof.

original: de tsam dang 'brel pa ste sgrub par byed pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
analyzed: de tsam dang 'brel pa ste sgrub par byed pa tsam dang 'brel pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis so //
translated: The reason is: the connection with that much, i.e., the connection with the mere proof.

original: de ltar bstan na de'i rang bzhin du bstan par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bstan na de'i rang bzhin du bstan par 'gyur gyi gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is taught in this way, it is taught as its nature, and not otherwise.

original: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ston pa ni 'di ltar byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa ston pa ni 'di ltar byas pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of the connection with that much is: ‚ÄúThe nature of the effect, etc.‚Äù

original: zhes kyi sgra ni ngag gi don 'dzin par rung ba'i byed pa yin te zhes bya ba de ltar ngag gi don de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma ni dpe ston to //
analyzed: zhes kyi sgra ni ngag gi don 'dzin par rung ba'i byed pa yin te zhes bya ba de ltar ngag gi don de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa rtogs par byed pa'i tshad ma ni dpe ston to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is a proper object of speech. The meaning of the statement is: the reason that causes the understanding of the connection with that much is the example.

original: dpes bstan pa'i tshad ma des kyang ngag gis bstan pa tsam du rjes su 'brel pa'i rtogs par 'gyur gyi brjod pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dpes bstan pa'i tshad ma des kyang ngag gis bstan pa tsam du rjes su 'brel pa'i rtogs par 'gyur gyi brjod pas ni ma yin no //
translated: And by that valid cognition indicated by the example, one understands the relation to the mere verbal expression, but not by the expression itself.

original: yang na rgyu'i dngos por bsgrub par bya ba don gzhan dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na rgyu'i dngos por bsgrub par bya ba don gzhan dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Or else, the probandum, the state of being a cause, is understood by valid cognition that is well established in the example.

original: dpe la rab tu grub pa'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las thams cad du rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe la rab tu grub pa'i mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dag las thams cad du rgyu nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because by perception and non-apprehension that are well established in the example, the state of being a cause is understood in every case.

original: de yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni gong du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dang lan cig zhugs ba'i rgyu'i dngos po de yod pa kho na na cig shos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes kyi sgra ni da ltar gyi don te /
analyzed: de yod pa nyid na zhes bya ba ni gong du mngon sum dang mi dmigs pa dang lan cig zhugs ba'i rgyu'i dngos po de yod pa kho na na cig shos yod pa'i phyir ro zhes kyi sgra ni da ltar gyi don te /
translated: When that exists means that when the state of being a cause of perception and non-apprehension that was mentioned above exists, the other exists. The word only has the meaning of the present tense.

original: de ltar dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas rgyu'i dngos po rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas rgyu'i dngos po rtogs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is the meaning that the state of being a cause is understood by valid cognition that is well established in the example.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rab tu bstan pa'i 'brel pa'i yul can gyi tshad mas de'i ngo bo sgrub bar byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dang rgyu'i dngos por rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba la
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chos mthun pa'i dpes rab tu bstan pa'i 'brel pa'i yul can gyi tshad mas de'i ngo bo sgrub bar byed pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid dang rgyu'i dngos por rab tu grub na mi rtag pa nyid med na zhes bya ba la
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the subject that is related to the example that is similar to the predicate. If the subject is established as the nature of the object that is established by valid knowledge, and if it is established as the nature of the cause, then the subject would not be established as impermanent.

original: sogs pa'i don 'di yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sogs pa'i don 'di yang 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThus‚Äù refers to the subject that is related to the example that is similar to the property. If the valid cognition that establishes the nature of that property is well established as the nature and cause of that property, then the meaning of ‚Äúif impermanence does not exist‚Äù and so on is established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause‚Äù is stated.

original: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni sgrub par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin par dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas grub pa yin no //üîΩdes na sgrub bar byed par gyur ba'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu med @288a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bsgrub par bya ba'i chos ni sgrub par byed pa de'i rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu yin par dpe la rab tu grub pa'i tshad mas grub pa yin no // des na sgrub bar byed par gyur ba'i dngos po bsgrub par bya ba bdag nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo dang rgyu med @288a * //
translated: The property to be established is established by valid knowledge that is well established in the example as the nature and cause of the proof.

original: par yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: par yod par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could the property that is the proof exist without the nature and cause of the probandum?

original: rgyu de'i phyir chos mthun pa'i dpes rab tu bstan pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i 'brel pa'i dbang gis gzhi chos can dngos bor gyur pa med par yang nye bar bkod pa tsam gyi chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog par byed pa dang ldog par bya ba'i mtshan
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir chos mthun pa'i dpes rab tu bstan pa'i tshad mas grub pa'i 'brel pa'i dbang gis gzhi chos can dngos bor gyur pa med par yang nye bar bkod pa tsam gyi chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la ldog par byed pa dang ldog par bya ba'i mtshan
translated: For that reason, the mere statement of a dissimilar example, without a real basis, by the power of a relation established by a valid cognition that is well taught by a concordant example, and the definition of what is to be reversed and what is the reversal,

original: nyid kyang ldog pa rab tu 'grub po //
analyzed: nyid kyang ldog pa rab tu 'grub po //
translated: are also established by the reversal.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gis chos gnyis kyi rten dngos por gyur pa tshol bar 'gyur ba chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la 'brel pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos gnyis kyi rten dngos por gyur pa tshol bar 'gyur ba chos mi mthun pa'i dpe la 'brel pa'i yul can gyi tshad ma bstan par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: The subject matter of a dissimilar example, which is the domain of a relation, is not to be taught by a valid cognition that seeks out the real basis of two properties.

original: 'brel pa grub zin pa dag gi ldog pa tsam ni dngos por ma 'gyur ba la yang bstan par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa grub zin pa dag gi ldog pa tsam ni dngos por ma 'gyur ba la yang bstan par nus pa yin no //
translated: The mere reversal of those whose relation is already established can be taught even in the absence of a real basis.

original: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni 'ga' zhig ldog par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa ni 'ga' zhig dgag pa go bar bya ba'i yang gtan tshigs yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'brel pa ni 'ga' zhig ldog par byed pa yin pa de'i phyir rgyu dang rang bzhin dag med pa ni 'ga' zhig dgag pa go bar bya ba'i yang gtan tshigs yin te /
translated: Because the relation is what is to be negated, therefore, the nonexistence of cause and nature are also the reason for understanding the negation.

original: go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: They are the means of understanding.

original: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag kho na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid rnam par 'grel pa ni de dag kho na zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being commented on by the statement ‚Äúonly those.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i rtags ldog par byed pa yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir yod pa'i bsgrub par 'dod pas 'brel pa gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rang gi bdag nyid dang 'brel pa'i rtags ldog par byed pa yin pa'i rgyu de'i phyir yod pa'i bsgrub par 'dod pas 'brel pa gtan tshigs su brjod par bya ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: Because the reason that is related to itself is what is to be negated, therefore, not only is the relation to be stated as the reason when one wishes to prove existence,

original: ci srid du du ba la sogs pa'i don 'ga' zhig dgag pa bsgrub par 'dod pas kyang gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ci srid du du ba la sogs pa'i don 'ga' zhig dgag pa bsgrub par 'dod pas kyang gtan tshigs nyid du brjod par bya'o //
translated: but also, to the extent that one wishes to prove the negation of some object such as smoke, one must state the reason.

original: de lta ma yin te ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa dag 'brel pa med na ni 'brel pa med pa log pas gzhan 'brel pa med pa ldog par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin te ldog par bya ba dang ldog par byed pa dag 'brel pa med na ni 'brel pa med pa log pas gzhan 'brel pa med pa ldog par mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object to be refuted and the refuting factor are not related, then the refuting factor, which is unrelated, does not establish the refutation of the other, which is also unrelated.

original: gal te brtsal ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te brtsal ma thag tu byung ba la sogs pa sgrub par byed pa'i chos bsgrub par bya ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa la 'brel pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that the proving factor, such as ‚Äúarising from effort,‚Äù is related to the probandum, such as ‚Äúimpermanence,‚Äù

original: bsgrub par bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba ni sgrub par byed pa dang 'brel pa ma yin te /
translated: the probandum is not related to the proving factor,

original: sgrub par byed pa med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it exists even when the proving factor does not.

original: de 'di nyid kyi phyir bsgrub ba'i gtan tshigs ma yin na /
analyzed: de 'di nyid kyi phyir bsgrub ba'i gtan tshigs ma yin na /
translated: If for that reason the probandum is not the reason that proves it,

original: de ci'i phyir 'brel pa med pa ldog pas gzhan ldog par mi 'grub po zhes brjod ce na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir 'brel pa med pa ldog pas gzhan ldog par mi 'grub po zhes brjod ce na /
translated: why do you say that the refutation of the absence of relation does not establish the refutation of the other?

original: 'di snyam du bsams pa yin te ;
analyzed: 'di snyam du bsams pa yin te ;
translated: We think as follows:

original: 'brel pa ni gnyi ga la gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: 'brel pa ni gnyi ga la gnas pa yin te /
translated: The relation must exist in both.

original: de'i phyir 'brel pa'i yul du gyur pa de dag ldan pa bsgrub bya'i chos la yang 'brel pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'brel pa'i yul du gyur pa de dag ldan pa bsgrub bya'i chos la yang 'brel pa zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, those that are the objects of the relation are said to be related to the predicate of the probandum.

original: mi dmigs pa gsum pa yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa gsum pa yang bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the third type of nonobservation, the text says:

original: dmigs par rigs pa gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs par rigs pa gang la yod pa ste /
translated: That which is suitable to be observed.

original: rgyu gzhan yod pa dang ba ltar rung @288b pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dmigs par rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu gzhan yod pa dang ba ltar rung @288b pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni dmigs par rigs pa yin no //
translated: That which has the nature of being suitable to be observed is the cause of the other, like the nature of the suitable to be observed.

original: yang gi sgras ni de dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag kyang yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni de dang rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dag kyang yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that it is also the nonobservation of the cause and the nonobservation of the pervader.

original: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs par ni dgag pa grub pa yin pas de'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin mi dmigs par ni dgag pa grub pa yin pas de'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: If the nonobservation of the nature is established as a negation, then is it not the case that the expression of that is not to be proven?

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs de zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs de zhes ji ltar brjod ce na /
translated: How can it be said that it is a reason of negation?

original: bshad pa / dgag pa'i yul gang la yod pa'i tha snyad de'i go bar byed pa gang yin pa de la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba dgag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes le'ur bya bar bshad do //
analyzed: bshad pa / dgag pa'i yul gang la yod pa'i tha snyad de'i go bar byed pa gang yin pa de la de'i gtan tshigs zhes bya ba dgag pa'i gtan tshigs zhes le'ur bya bar bshad do //
translated: NƒÅgƒÅrjuna responds: The reason that is the means of understanding the convention of nonexistence with respect to a negated object is called a reason of negation.

original: ci ste dgag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na bshad pa /
analyzed: ci ste dgag pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su ci'i phyir ma bshad ce na bshad pa /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúWhy is it not explained as a reason of nonexistence itself?‚Äù

original: de lta bu ste bltar rung ba'i don gyis mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i rang nyid dgag pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: de lta bu ste bltar rung ba'i don gyis mi dmigs pa gang yin pa de'i rang nyid dgag pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is like this: Nonobservation of a visible object is the nature of its own negation.

original: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: It is the nature of nonexistence.

original: ji ltar bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de la dmigs pa'i shes pa nyid bum pa med pa yin pa de ltar ni de nyid med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba der gtan la phab zin to //
analyzed: ji ltar bum pas dben pa'i sa phyogs dang de la dmigs pa'i shes pa nyid bum pa med pa yin pa de ltar ni de nyid med pa rnams kyi med pa yin no zhes bya ba der gtan la phab zin to //
translated: Just as the place that is devoid of a pot and the cognition that observes it are the nonexistence of a pot, so too they are the nonexistence of those that are nonexistent. This has already been determined.

original: de'i phyir dgag pa grub zin pas tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs su brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir dgag pa grub zin pas tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la gtan tshigs su brjod do //
translated: Therefore, since the negation is already established, it is stated as a reason for the purpose of establishing a convention.

original: gnyi ga'i yang zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang tha snyad kyi'o //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i yang zhes bya ba ni dgag pa dang tha snyad kyi'o //
translated: Both of these are negations and conventions.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab bya bltar mi rung ba la ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga go bar byed la /
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab bya bltar mi rung ba la ni rgyu dang khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pas dngos po med pa dang med pa'i tha snyad gnyi ga go bar byed la /
translated: When the effect and the pervaded are not visible, the non-apprehension of the cause and the pervader causes one to understand both the non-existence and the convention of non-existence.

original: 'bras bu dang khyab bya bltar rung ba la ni med pa'i tha snyad 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang khyab bya bltar rung ba la ni med pa'i tha snyad 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: When the effect and the pervaded are visible, there is only the convention of non-existence.

original: mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum du bstan nas mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste zhes smos so //üîΩrgyu la sogs pa ji 'dra ba zhig dang / gang gi tshe mi dmigs pas go bar byed pa de gnyi ga yang ston par byed de /üîΩdmigs su yod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de gang gi tshe de ltar te /
analyzed: mi dmigs pa rnam pa gsum du bstan nas mjug bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dgag pa'i gtan tshigs 'di ni rnam pa gsum kho na ste zhes smos so // rgyu la sogs pa ji 'dra ba zhig dang / gang gi tshe mi dmigs pas go bar byed pa de gnyi ga yang ston par byed de / dmigs su yod pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de gang gi tshe de ltar te /
translated: Having taught the three kinds of non-apprehension, in order to summarize, he says: This reason of negation is only of three kinds.üîΩHe shows both what kind of cause, etc. and when non-apprehension causes understanding.

original: rgyu nyid du nges par 'gyur pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu nyid du nges par 'gyur pa de'i tshe mi dmigs pa go bar byed pa yin no //
translated: When the cause, etc. that is visible is such that it would be ascertained as the cause, etc., then non-apprehension causes understanding.

original: ji ltar sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sgron ma bzhin du rung ba nyid kyis ni gtan tshigs go bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the reason is understood by the mere fact that it is similar to the example.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What, then, is it?

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa nyid na yin no zhes bya ba de ni bshad zin te /
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa nyid na yin no zhes bya ba de ni bshad zin te /
translated: It is that the reason is ascertained as being invariably concomitant with the probandum. This has already been explained.

original: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa dang sa phyogs la sogs ba la brten pa'i rtags nyid bsgrub bya nges par byed pa yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med na mi 'byung ba nyid du nges pa dang sa phyogs la sogs ba la brten pa'i rtags nyid bsgrub bya nges par byed pa yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For, when the reason is ascertained as being invariably concomitant with the probandum, it is seen that the reason itself, which is based on the locus, etc., ascertains the probandum.

original: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba gzhan ldog par nges par byed pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can @289a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba gzhan ldog par nges par byed pa yang rang bzhin 'brel pa nges pa sngon du 'gro ba can @289a * //
translated: In the same way, the ascertainment of the negation of the probandum is also preceded by the ascertainment of the relation of identity.

original: yin pas na de'i rgyu nyid du nges pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yin pas na de'i rgyu nyid du nges pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the reason is ascertained as the cause of that.

original: dmigs su yod pa'i khyab par byed pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du de ltar nges pa go bar byed pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dmigs su yod pa'i khyab par byed pa khyab par bya ba dang khyab par byed pa'i dngos po nyid du de ltar nges pa go bar byed pa yin te snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The pervasion is ascertained as the invariable concomitance of the pervader with the pervaded, as before.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyang ngo //
translated: And the reason itself.

original: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig ce na ;
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu dang ldan pa zhig ce na ;
translated: What kind of difference does it have?üîΩIt is ascertained as existent in the perspective of the object,

original: dmigs par yod pa dang de ltar nges pa ste dmigs par yod pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: dmigs par yod pa dang de ltar nges pa ste dmigs par yod pa nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: because it is ascertained as existent in the perspective of the object.

original: rnam pa gang gis bum pa dmigs par bya ba nyid du nges ba'i rnam pa des ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis bum pa dmigs par bya ba nyid du nges ba'i rnam pa des ma dmigs pa'i phyir med pa'i tha snyad du byed pa yin no //
translated: In whatever way a vase is ascertained as an object of observation, in that way it is not observed, and it is designated as nonexistent.

original: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po de ni phyogs gzhan dag tu rnam pa du mar te /
analyzed: dgag pa'i gtan tshigs rnam pa gsum po de ni phyogs gzhan dag tu rnam pa du mar te /
translated: Those three types of reasons for refutation are explained in many different ways in other treatises.

original: dbye ba mang por bshad do //
analyzed: dbye ba mang por bshad do //
translated: They are explained in many different divisions.üîΩHow is that?

original: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bshad pa /
translated: It is said:

original: 'gal ba la sogs pa de dang de dag gis so //
analyzed: 'gal ba la sogs pa de dang de dag gis so //
translated: By those such as contradiction and so on.

original: 'gal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal ba la sogs pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: What are contradiction and so on?

original: sogs pa smos pas ni rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa smos pas ni rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes essential nature and so forth.

original: rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ma dmigs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo la sogs pa ma rtogs pa ma dmigs pa dang 'gal ba la sogs pa rtogs pa dmigs pa'o //
translated: Nonobservation of the essential nature and so forth is nonobservation, and observation of the essential nature and so forth is observation.

original: de dag gi sbyor ba ni de dag brjod pa'i sgra yin la /
analyzed: de dag gi sbyor ba ni de dag brjod pa'i sgra yin la /
translated: Their application is the words that express them.

original: de'i dbye ba de dang de dag ni 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa'i dbye ba de dang des so //
analyzed: de'i dbye ba de dang de dag ni 'gal ba la sogs pa ma rtogs pa dang rtogs pa'i dbye ba de dang des so //
translated: The divisions of those are the divisions of non-realization and realization of contradiction, etc.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba tha dad de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pas so //
analyzed: rgyu la sogs pa mi dmigs pa'i sbyor ba tha dad de rang bzhin mi dmigs pa dang / rgyu mi dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa mi dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu mi dmigs pas so //
translated: The applications of non-observation of cause, etc. are different, because of the non-observation of essence, the non-observation of cause, the non-observation of a pervader, and the non-observation of an effect.

original: de bzhin du de dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yang tha dad de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de dang 'gal ba dmigs pa'i sbyor ba yang tha dad de /
translated: Similarly, the applications of the observation of contradiction with that are also different.

original: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa dang / khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / 'bras bu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba dmigs pa dang / rgyu 'gal ba'i 'bras bu dmigs pa ste /
translated: There is the observation of contradiction with essence, the observation of an effect that is contradictory, the observation of a pervader that is contradictory, the observation of an effect that is contradictory, the observation of a cause that is contradictory, and the observation of an effect that is contradictory with the cause.

original: de ltar sbyor ba rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: de ltar sbyor ba rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: Thus there are ten types of application.

original: bcu gcig pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni le'u gsum par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu gcig pa 'gal bas khyab pa dmigs pa ni le'u gsum par 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The eleventh, the observation of a pervader that is contradictory, will be explained in chapter three.

original: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba'i tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las le'u gnyis pa'o /
analyzed: slob dpon chos mchog gis sbyar ba'i tshad ma rnam par nges pa'i 'grel bshad las le'u gnyis pa'o /
translated: This is the second chapter of the commentary on the Pramanavarttika called ‚ÄúThoroughly Clarifying the Pramana Compendium,‚Äù composed by the master Dharmottara.

original: // /'di la bam po bcu gnyis dang tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do /
analyzed: // /'di la bam po bcu gnyis dang tshigs bcad sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do /
translated: This chapter has twelve folios and thirty-two verses.
